Applejack was busy with the orchard, Rainbow Dash had weather duty today, Pinkie would never hold still long enough so only Twilight was left. The purple unicorn didn't mind, she enjoyed spending time with all of her friends.

It was also not like Twilight was completely uninterested in fashion, it was just not her top priority. On her way she tried to imagine what kind of dresses Rarity wanted her to try on. Finally the boutique came into view. A soft bell announced Twilights arrival at the crrousel boutique.

"Sure thing Rarity." Twilight went into position and waited for her friend to return. A small growl made her blush. With Spike already leaving pretty early her breakfast was minuscule and she was still hungry, Twilight just hoped that Rarity wouldn't hear it. Said friend returned with an elegant and simple blue dress. Twilight put the dress on and Rarity started to work on it, putting needles here and there and taking some measurements.

"No problem my dear, maybe we can get something to eat after we're done." Twilight happily agreed to this plan.

What Twilight assumed would be a quick session has already drawn out for two hours. Her stomach felt as if it was about to digest itself while Rarity just assured her that they were almost done, like she assured Twilight one hour ago. Everything started to look weirdly delicious by now, the dress, the yarn, even Rarity looked tasty to Twilight by now. Of course she knew that none of these things were edible, especially Rarity.

Said unicorn mare dropped a ball of yarn which rolled behind her. Rarity, not bothering with magic for now, turned around and bent over to pick it up, giving Twilight a good view of her ass. 11111111111111212112121112.content:
Twilight rested in the grass, letting her belly finish off the last of AJ. She felt a little guilty about what she'd done, but took solace in the fact that it was necessary. If she didn't eat AJ, AJ would've eaten her. That was the grim truth of their situation. As she felt the last of AJ's body melt away, becoming one with hers, Twilight attempted to tune out the world and listen to her own mind.

"Hello? Hello!? Is anyone there?”

“Agh! Not so loud!”

“Rarity? Is that you?”

“Can you guys stop shouting so much? It feels like the whole world just flipped over on itself.”

“That you, Rainbow.”

“Yeah. Still me. Still just a voice in the void,” she replied despondently. “By the way, is it me or do you guys feel, I don’t know, smarter?”

“Come to think of it, I have noticed a little something.”

“Wait… Is this cuz we’re in Twilight now?”

The purple mare giggled. “That would be my guess.”

“Aww shoot. So Ah lost?”

“You don’t remember?” Rarity inquired.

“Not especially. Ah think gettin’ eaten threw me off a tad. Also the whole not havin’ a body stuff.”

“I can vouch for that.”

“Likewise.”

“Hey, girls,” Twilight interjected. “I just wanted to check on you. Is everything alright?”

“Still not too sure, sugar cube. Think ya’ll could have a look around?”

Twilight nodded and looked around the familiar scenery of Sweet Apple Acres. As she did, she felt a sense of ease from one of the newest souls in her head. That, in turn, seemed to spread to the other three and put them all in a sense of nostalgic relief.

“Did Ah jus’ do that?”

“Not sure what it was, but yeah. I think so.”

“Celestia said that our souls will eventually merge into one,” Rarity reminded. “I can already hear all of your thoughts, so maybe feeling your feelings is part of it.”

“Really? That’s pretty cool.”

“Hold on a second,” AJ cut in. “So this is all leadin’ ta us eventually becoming’ an alicorn, right? Well, what happens after?”

“What do you mean?”

“Fer one thing, what are Granny, Big Mac, ‘n’ li’l Apple Bloom gonna think about their sister bein’ nothing but a voice in somepony’s head?”

“Goodness, you’re right! What about Sweetie Belle?”

“And I’m still peeved that I’m never gonna be a Wonder Bolt!”

“Easy girls, easy.” Twilight attempted to think calming thoughts of herself curling up with a nice book by the fire place. Whether or not the others found the scene as relaxing, it seemed to have an effect. “When this is all done with, I guess, we’ll have to make arrangements.”

“What kind of arrangements?” inquired Rarity. “My parents are still touring Equestria and Sweetie Belle has nowhere else to stay.”

“Well, she can stay with me,” Twilight offered, paying attention to Rarity’s feelings on the matter. “If we’re all going to be one, then I guess that means our family ties will as well. Sweetie, now that I’m thinking about it, feels a lot like how I see Cadance.”

“Come ta think of it, Ah feel the same,” AJ added. “Sweet li’l filly’s practically kin already.”

Radiant warmth spread out from Rarity’s consciousness, washing the others in her gratitude. A picture appeared in their thoughts. It wasn’t clear who was thinking it, though. Maybe all of them? Twilight was hugging Sweetie and sending her off to school. Dresses would be strewn about the library as she sewed for a hobby. This was followed by a trip to Sweet Apple Acres where she would help with chores and chatter with the Apples. With her new wings she’d fly faster than ever before, doing Sonic Rainbooms for fun. Less prominent were the imaginings of her visiting Sugar Cube Corner or looking after Fluttershy’s animals.

“Ya’ll feel that?”

“Yeah. From now on, whenever somepony asks ‘Did you feel that?’ the answer is always gonna be ‘yes.’” Rainbow replied with far less snark than expected. It sounded like she was just putting on an act, but deep down she was starting to come to terms with things.

“So we’ll all be one, then,” Rarity summarized. “We’ll share the same family, interests, responsibilities, and, of course, our body.”

“So we’ll be poopin’ from the same butt?”

“Eww!” As Rarity retreated in revulsion, AJ and Rainbow began snickering at her expense.

Twilight felt a bit disgusted, but mostly found the situation funny. Was this how things were going to be from now on? They’d all just keep feeling and thinking alike until it became impossible to tell one from the other?

“Hold on. Let me try something.” And Rainbow proceeded to remember every dirty magazine she had hidden under her bed. Most of them were of scantily clad mares in alluring poses, but there were a few stallions here and there.

“Agh! Rainbow!” Twilight cried out in alarm, feeling her new wings suddenly turn rigid as a fire burned in her nether regions. “Don’t, ugh, do that.”

“Do what?” Rainbow asked, feigning innocence. “Oh wait. Did you mean… this!?” She threw her weaponized fantasies at the others. Soarin, Spitfire, and the rest of the Wonder Bolts necking with wreckless abandon, carrying out terribly lewd acts in the showers, locker rooms, and everywhere else Rainbow had ever imagined.”

“Sweet Celestia, that stallion is hung!” Rarity exclaimed.

“Don’t look!” AJ begged. “Yer jus’ makin’ it worse!” Try as she might, even in her non-corporial state, the former farmer felt the familiar tingle of arousal, an itch begging to be scratched. Except the body needing scratching wasn’t hers, but Twilight’s. “This is so confusin’!”

“You’re telling me,” Twilight agreed, feeling flushed and breathless. Her thighs were grinding together in a futile effort to stem the tide of heat, but she knew it wouldn’t last long. Rainbow’s sexual fantasies had caused a kind of feedback loop with her mind’s many occupants, leading to a perpetual cycle of arousal. Something had to be done.

111121.content:
Twilight was not just an avid reader of books. Coming to discover that Manehattan had a publisher that networked and distributed scholarly journal magazines from all walks of life, she had taken to their subscriptions--all of them, and was currently reading one about psychology. It was tied with her study of friendship, as it was dealing with a discussion on trust. It was a long read, but the generalized idea of it was that being invited to spend time in another pony's house and then bedroom was a sign of trust, and the elaborate on a theory and several other models of psychology that tied with it. It mentioned that the level of trust it showed was different from pony to pony. Some ponies trust easily, and let new friends into their homes easily. Others are harder. It also acknowledged that a pony can be warm to strangers and friends without necessarily taking this step of trust and inviting friends into their homes.

It interested Twilight because, as she finished it and considered the material, she realized that she'd been in everypony's homes, including Fluttershy's... but not Rainbow Dash. Out of her friends, Rainbow Dash was the only pony who hadn't invited anypony else into her home that she knew of, aside from Gilda, who had been a friend in school...

Rainbow also knew that Twilight could walk on clouds now, if she wanted to, so considering that loyalty and trust were very different things fundamentally, she started wondering if Rainbow trusted her a lot or not. Oh sure, Rainbow would trust her with her life, she figured, but Twilight didn't know just how much Rainbow could trust other ponies with her emotions and feelings of insecurity, which she hid well and sometimes dangerously so... Twilight hadn't forgotten Rainbow's panic attack in Cloudsdale.

On a side note, Twilight's article had referenced some old folktale about a powerful fairy pony who was sick from a germ, and had to trust an Earth pony to shrink down, enter her, and remove the germ. The fairy pony had been mistrusting, but had eventually allowed the Earth pony to enter her, not to save her life, but because she grew to care for the Earth pony. Twilight had of course read this same folktale and found it charming, if a little weird.

Twilight decided to visit Rainbow Dash. She left a note for Spike to tell him where she'd be while he was out doing errands for her. She stepped out into Ponyville and started trotting to the outskirts, where Rainbow's cloud home hovered near the roadside. She looked up at it and smiled.

"I bet she'll be surprised!" she said and then cast the spell on herself that would enable her to walk on clouds. She then broke off a small chunk of the cloud with her magic and levitated it down to ground level, stepped on it, and then levitated it back up to Rainbow's home and nudged it back into place. She trotted along the soft cloud surface and approached Rainbow's home. She knocked on the door.

Nothing happened, so Twilight knocked again loudly, and waited. Frowning, she began to wonder if Rainbow wasn't even home before Rainbow peaked her head out of a high window. "Twi? What on earth are you doing... up here?" she asked. Her voice sounded funny. Twilight wondered if something was wrong.

11112221111222.content:
Twilight rubbed her enormous belly as it continued to squirm from Mrs Cake's futile efforts to fight from inside, as she pondered who to make her dessert. A soft cry broke her concentration, and Twilight's face fell slightly.

"Pumpkin and Pound," she whispered to herself. Then a wicked thought occurred to her; it would simply be too cruel to leave these poor defenseless foals as orphans, now, wouldn't it? Not to mention, keeping them apart from their mother! Twi rolled forward onto her four hooves, and her belly compressed a bit as it dragged on the floor between her legs, and even behind them a bit. Very slowly, she dragged herself to the stairs, then with a scowl, she cast a spell to convert the barrier into a slide, so she could get down to the floor where the nursery was.

Ever so slowly, she descended, her belly acting as a brake against the force of gravity, until she reached her objective, and began dragging herself into the nursery. Pound was awake, fluttering his wings as he tried to see who was coming in, even as Pumpkin slept blissfully. Twi licked her lips, and approached Pound's crib, and cast a spell to levitate the foal towards her watering mouth.

Then, she placed the foal back down, in confusion. As good as this felt, and as much as she wanted more, her stomach was warning her very forcefully that it was at its absolute limit. She sighed as she carefully set the giggling foal back down. There had to be a way around this problem. She pondered. There really wasn't any spell to expand the size of a stomach, although she started wondering if she could improvise one. Then a stray memory hit.

When she had been a smaller filly, she had occasionally had to accompany Celestia to diplomatic meetings. And one of those, she remembered, was with the Griffon ambassador, who insisted as a matter of protocol of treating the Equestrian monarch to a traditional Griffin meal. That being, roast pig. It was the first, and prior to today the only, time animal flesh had touched Twilight's tongue. And while the flavor was unusual (not bad, just unusual), the stomach cramping afterwards was awful. Celestia had told her young student that she had done this every year for more than a thousand years, and she too had trouble digesting the meal afterwards, but she had a spell to correct it. She had also pondered whether her occasional consumption of meat had been responsible for her imposing size, so much larger than anypony else. In any event, Celestia cast a spell, and Twilight's cramps had subsided almost immediately.

Twilight was a master of spellcraft. If she had ever seen a spell performed, she could copy it, although not necessarily perfectly as her first attempts at teleportation attested to. She had simply never again needed the spell to digest meat before. A part of her wondered how she had digested Pinkie so easily, but it shut down quickly - never question anything Pinkie Pie did, after all, else you would lose your sanity. Although perhaps that spell cast ten years ago had helped a little this morning; but it was so slow now that she was awake for it.

There really was nothing else for it. She closed her eyes as her horn glowed, then bent her head down to zap her own stomach. Almost immediately, she felt a sense of pressure decreasing, as her stomach began to break down her latest enormous meal. It wasn't fast, but it was working.

She grinned, and levitated the tiny pegasus again with her magic, and this time, her stomach gave no protest as she wrapped her lips around Pumpkin's neck, and sucked him down in a single delicious gulp. She turned, and did the same with the sleeping baby unicorn, delighting in the flavor, as a muffled scream hit her ears; Mrs Cake realizing her son had been consumed. Sobs continued as Twilight felt Pound Cake's tiny horn against the edge of her stomach.

Just to be safe, Twilight cast the digestion spell on herself a second time, then dragged herself to the storefront of Sugarcube Corner. Noting with satisfaction that the "Closed" sign was properly set to closed, and the door locked, she rested a moment (dragging her belly was slow work!), before teleporting herself back to the library to plan her next meal.

111122211112222.content:
Twilight tried to make herself comfortable as she went over some research, looking for any information she could on the meat digestion spell and any other cases of ponies eating ponies. Unfortunately, the research was very, very scant. It was mildly frustrating to hit on so little information, but she took some solace in the idea that this meant she was doing original research. And even if she was intending to eat the entire town, that was no excuse for not properly documenting her findings!

She idly rubbed her belly as she took down notes of what had happened so far that morning, feeling the sloshing remnants of five ponies in her engorged intestines. A quick scan revealed that her stomach was still overstretched, and some quick math suggested it would be at least another hour before it shrank down enough to accommodate another meal.

She sighed to herself, as a small cramp hit. Although the feeling of being so full was wonderfully intoxicating, even with the meat digestion spell her anatomy simply wasn't designed to take in this much food, much less this much flesh, at one time. She took a detour in her research, and quickly found that adding some fiber to her diet would help.

Well, there was nothing for it. She dragged her way into the kitchen, and gulped down a loaf of bread before her stomach could protest the addition. This action got her thinking, however. How DID she manage to open her mouth so wide, it should be far beyond any pony's physiological abilities. In fact the only pony who could swallow so much so fast that she knew of was... Pinkie.

Was there a connection? She decided to test a theory, and began whipping up a batch of cake batter. As long as she didn't think about what she was doing, it seemed to be working. Yet, Twilight knew from long experience that she was a very poor chef; it's why Spike was responsible for meals around here.

Had she absorbed more than just the flesh of the ponies she ate? This would require further testing!

As her cake baked, her digestion of Pinkie and the Cakes continued. The smell was delicious; even if she had become a carnivore, Twi had no intention of not having sweets as well, after all. She magically scanned her insides again, and frowned... Pinkie was starting to make her way into her large intestine, and there was still an awful lot of her first meal not absorbed.

But as she watched, her intestines seemed to resist the idea of a single drop of a pony meal going to waste. Her intestines lengthened, and new loops formed before her metaphorical eye. She felt a twinge in her back, and was surprised to find her spine also lengthening, to accommodate the extra intestines. She didn't have a theory yet as to why this was happening, but she wasn't about to complain. All the extra room meant she had room for another pony. And she knew just who she wanted first. Rarity. If she was indeed absorbing traits from her meals, Rarity's ability to make anything fashionable would give Twi the ability to continue hunting for meals without being as obvious. And even if not, well, Rarity was simply bound to be delicious anyway. Plus, even as weak as a spellcaster as she was, she was still the next best to Twilight herself in Ponyville, and therefore the only possible pony to stop her.

Twilight's horn glowed brightly, as she teleported Rarity to her side. Before the confused unicorn could even ask what happened, Twilight stuffed Rarity's head into her mouth. She felt a warm glow inside her mouth as Rarity attempted to cast a spell, and on instinct, she twisted her head around, and snapped Rarity's horn off against her teeth.

Suddenly, the flavor of raw magic mixed with hot blood flooded her tongue, as Rarity began to struggle fiercely. The feeling was electric. All too quickly, however, the flavor began to lose some of its potency, and Twi felt regret - that the flavor had not lasted longer. She moved so that Rarity's hind quarters were forced up against a wall, then bent forward, gulping Rarity down to her shoulders. She felt Rarity's nose get forced into the pool of fluid already in her stomach, and Rarity's struggles briefly become more frantic, before ceasing suddenly altogether. Twilight felt regret again - Rarity must have choked on Twilight's stomach acids, and that meant the wonderful feeling of the struggle had come to an end. With almost a sigh of resignation, Twilight gave another long gulp and bent forward, taking in Rarity's shoulders. Then she slowly fell forward, letting her own gravity force most of Rarity down as Twilight's mouth slipped forward, until Rarity's tail and hind legs were all that remained outside.

Twi rested just a moment, then rolled over slowly, allowing her stomach to spill to the floor on both sides of her back, as she slurped up what remained of Rarity contently. The wonderful feeling of being overly full yet again spread throughout Twi's body, and lulled her into a nap.

She awoke, to the smell of a perfectly cooked chocolate cake, perhaps an hour later. Lazily checking herself, she found Pinkie had been totally absorbed while she napped, the Cakes were mostly gone, and Rarity was just beginning her final journey, with only a small part remaining in the stomach itself. She licked her lips, and floated her cake to her mouth, swallowing it in a single gulp. It was, indeed, very tasty. But ponies were far tastier, and there was now plenty of room in her stomach for lunch. She giggled at the thought - six ponies were her breakfast; at this pace, all of Ponyville would be inside her stomach within a week! Still, there was the troubling matter of deciding where to go for lunch, exactly.

Do you know what they do with their victims, Moon? They drain their emotions from straight from their horn! And they do so until either, the victim dies or until their just empty shells! Until their shanows of who they used to be! And they don't just attack when they need to feed. They do it for fun and for pleasure!"

Moon was shocked, disgusted and horrified!. Sure, she wanted to bring Eternal Night and have a living meal now and then. But she wanted her soon to be subjects to live happily under her's and Twilight's reign! That's why she was developing a spell that could reform the ponies that they ate. So that they would have their meals but nopony would die or suffer from loss. She would never be so cruel or kill without need!

"W-wait! I can explain-"

"SILENCE,BUG!!!"

Twilight's ire was now bigger than ever, and so was her aura. Now, the aura was four times Twilight's height and it expanded a bit around her. Moon too was furious at the queen and her children.

"You, Changelings, have sealed your fate! We will get rid of you, cursed parasites, and rid the world of Equis from your plague!"

*NO! This may be the last thing I do but!!!* "ATTACK!!!"

Then, multiple changelings appeared from many tunnels in the throne room and surrounded Twilight and Moon. They all stood firm. Ready to fire at their queen's command. By Twilight's counting, there was a total of 150 changelings. Not counting Chrysalis.

"So you want to do this the hard way? Fine! Moon, love, care lend a hoof?"

"*chuckle* It'll be my pleasure, honey."

"Moon! Not now. Wait until we're done here."

"Aw. You're no fun, darling."

"Don't worry, I'll make it up to you. I promise. *wink*", said Twilight, with a naughty tone.

"Enough! What is this, a battle or a couple moment?!"

"*chuckle* You're the only one here who thinks this is a battle."

"What?!"

"You heard her. Now, Moon. Let's beat this bunch of weaklings already!"

"Gladly."

Twilight and Moon joined their horn and ignited them, mixing their magic and creating an imens thunderstorm inside of the throne room. They also conjured a barrier to protect themselves and the captured guards. The thunderstorm took care of Chrysalis' children quickly. In mere seconds, all of them laiid unconcious. Leaving only Chrysalis to be dealt with.

"Thanks for your help, love."

"It was no problem at all, dear."

The guards were stunned. With only one attack, they had beaten the entire changeling army! Chrysalis too was shocked. Now they were all condemned! They would all die! Chrysalis simply laid there, weeping for herself, for her children, and for the fate that awaited them.

"Chrysalis."

Chrysalis looked up and saw the two ones that were responsible fo this.

"You have no one to blame but yourself, you know that? If you hadn't invaded Canterlot, none of this would have happened."

"WE WERE DESPERATE-"

"Horseshit!!! If you were so desperate, why didn't you tried to find a way to comunicate with Celestia or Luna? Why didn't you asked for help or for an audience with them? They would have recived you with no problems at all!"

"Liar!"

"I'm not lying, Chrysalis. The pony kind are good by nature. Some turn evil, true. But most are good natured and would have accepted you in due time!"

"More lies! How could anyone accept us? You said it yourself. We are parasites."

"Crysalis-"

"Stop! Just deliver our fate to us get it done already!"

"*sigh* Fine then. If that's how you want it, so be it. Your fate and the fate of all of your children is to be devoured by Moon and by myself. Call it poetic justice."

At this sentence, Chrysalis could only weep harder. Ironicly, her children and herself wolud suffer the same fate they had inflicted on others.

"Want some help, my love?"

"No, thank you. I can do this. Still, until the changelings awake, I would llove to have sompony to give me belly rubs after I finish my meal.", sid Twilight in a sultry tone. "Then again. We have to deal with the guards too."

"W-what do you mean with, deal with us?", asked the leader fearfully.

"Well, we can't let you escape. After all, if you did, you would tell Celestia and Luna about us. Either, because it's your duty or because you would think it's the right thing to do. And we can't let that happen."

"P-please! We won't tell anypony!"

"I'm really sorry. But we can't risk it. We have plans. And we can't let anypony find out.", said Twilight while standing in front of the guard.
"Still, Moon will use a spell. So that you sleep through it all and don't feel any pain. I'm truly sorry, but that's the best we can do."

The guards looked down with sad expresions.

"We understand.", said the leader. "But, can we ask something, please?"

"Sure. What is it?"

"Well, since we're going to be eaten, we would like to choose whowill eat us."

Twilight was surprised by this. She looked at Moon, who too was surprised. Moon smiled, and so did Twilight. She looked at the guards and nodded.

"Of course you can. It's only fair. Now then, who do you choose?"

The guards talked among themselves for a minute or two before they decided.

"We, Solar guards would like to be devoured by you, Twilight Sparkle. And the Nocturnal Guards want to be eaten by you, Nightmare Moon."

Twilight and Moon nodded. Once that was done, Twilight went to the fallen queen and readied herself. Chrysalis saw her, and decided to close her eyes. She didn't wanted witness her demise. Twilight opened her mouth a bit and began to suck Chrysalis' horn into her mouth. Once she reached the base, she opened her mouth wide. Wider than before. Before, she had to eat normal sized ponies. But Chrysalis was more or less Alicorn sized. She would make good practice for when she ate Celestia. Then, Twilight engulfed Chrysalis' head, followed by her neck. Chrysalis' imprint could already be seen clearly in Twilight's neck. Even tough they were witnessing such an act, none of the guards could loo away. Moon didn't looked away either. Rather, she looked with pride at hre student/lover for doing so well so far. But she was worried for the next part. Bewcause Twilight was now past the queen's neck and at her shoulders. She grinned. Normally, they would pose an obstacle. However, it seemed that she didn't inherited only the baking talent from Pinkie Pie. Now that Pinkie had bee absorbed completely by her body, she could stretch further. And so she did. She opened her mouth a bit more to allow the queen's shoulders into her gullet. Next was Chrysalis' belly and wings. Twilight did enjoyed the taste of the changeling queen. But this was a matter of vengeance and justice. So she couldn't take her time. Thus, she pressed on. She gulped down Chrysalis' belly. Then, she raised her head to the ceiling to get some aid from gravity. Twilight then gulped the queen's buttocks next, then her hooves and lastly, her tail.

"*buuuurp* Oops. Sorry", she said, blushing.

Continued...

11112221111222212211121221111111111.content:
(Luna, Cadence)

"*buuuuurp* Oops! Excuse me."

"*giggles* Congratulations, Twilight."

"Thank you, my beloved."

"Seriously tough. I honestly thought you would get stuck on the shoulders."

"Me too, at first. But, remember Pinkie Pie a.k.a Laughter?"

"Oh? The pink earth pony? Yes. What about her?"

"Well, whenever there was a cake, she would stretch her jaw impossibly wide. So, since I had eaten her, I thought "maybe I can do it too now" and, to my relief, I was proved right."

"I see. Quite an uncommon ability she had tough. Not many can stretch their jaws to the point of eating a whole cake. Celestia and Luna are the only ponies I know who can do that."

"He, he. Yeah. I'm aware of Celestia's sweet tooth. Heck! She herself created a room in the castle made 100% of chocolate! The room is of the same size of the throne room! Before, I never knew how she managed to eat so much cake and not gain a single pound. But now I know. Guess it's another advantage of this "diet", huh?"

"Precisely. And an entire room made of chocolate? I didn't knew about that one."

"Not many know. If memory serves right, the ones who know about it are me, Luna, Celestia's advisor, Celestia herself and now you. Still, while I do appreciate a good chocolate or cake now and then. I would have Moon Pies anyday over those. And no, I don't mean it in the naughty sense. Rather, tonight, I will turn you into a littleral Moon Pie, hun."

"*blush* Oh, Twilight! Who's the uncorrigible mare now, hm?"

The two of them began laughing out loud. Whn they heard two voices that made them shake.

"Awwwwww! Isn't this a lovely sight, Aunty Luna?"

"Why, indeed it is, my dear niece. Although it's quite unexpected, I must say."

"L-Luna! Cadence! W-what are you doing here?!"

"Shh. Calm down, Twily. First thing first. Hello, you must be Nightmare Moon, right?"

"Y-yes, I'am."

"I see. My name is Cadence, pleased to meet you."

"Cadence? Twilight's foalsitter and sister-in-law?"

"Ah, I see Twily has told you about me."

"Yes, she did. And the pleasure is mine. She also told me about the wedding incident."

"Yes. It was quite harsh. And that brings us to this moment. We came because Celestia sensed that Twilight was in distress and a huge surge of magical power. But she couldn't make it here, since she was in ameeting with the Gryphon and the Zebra ambasadors. So she called us. And when I heard that Twilight was here, I had to come and ensure that my favorite and precious little sister was okay.", said Cadence, approaching Twilight and hugging her as best as she could. "Still, I would never had imagined that the events form that day had scarred you like that, Twiliy. Nor that you had so much power inside of you."

"I didn't knew it myself. I guess I had my feelings buried so deeply that I had forgoten about them. As for the power, Moon had already told me that I had a lot of potential."

"Oh? Moon, is it?"

"Ah! Er... Well, you see..."

"*giggles* You're so cute when your nervous like that, Twily! And don't worry. I already knew that you two were a couple. I'm the Princess of Love, remember?"

"And, judging by thee enourmous belly, I don't think we need to ask where the queen of the bugs is."

"He, he. Yeah. At first, this new diet of mine took me by surprise. But, soon enough I linked the dots. You, Cadence and Celestia do this as well, don't you?"

"We did, in the past. But our subjects feared us and some even hated us for doing so. So we stopped."

"You won't have to worry about that for long. I'm developing a new spell and, with Twilight's help, it will be a success. It's a spell that can reform anypony that has been digested. You just have to apply it to the meal and, once it comes out of the *ahem* backdoor, the pony will be instantly reformed."

"Oh, goodie! We'll have our living meals back!"

"Yes. And I think none of you would mind having bugs for lunch, would you? I mean, there are 150 changelings here. And I already ate Chrysalis so, I think we can rationalize. 40 for Luna, 40 for Cadence, 40 and 30 for myself. How does that sounds?"

"Fair enough."

"I concurr."

"Me too."

"Good! Now, about the guards..."

"Oh! Don't worry about them. I'll use a memory spell and erase what they saw today, is that okay with you, boys?"

The guards looked at each other and nodded fervishly at Luna.

"Okay, good. I didn't really wanted to start eating innocents. So... What do we do now?"

"Why, we feast, of course!"

All three alicorns used thair magic to divide the changelings into the agreed amounts. And once that was done, they dug in. Some of Chrysalis had already been digested. Thus, Twilight could walk now and had some space left for dessert. By the end of the buffet, Moon had eaten 30 changelings, Luna 25, Cadence 26 and Twilight 15, due to what was left of Chrysalis in her belly. After that, they put a paralisis spell on the remaining changelings, so that even if they woke up, they wouldn't be able to move and a sleep spell of the guards. Then, thay tehmselfves drifted of to sleep. With Twilight and Moon sleeping in each others hooves.

"*Yawn* We still have a lot to talk about, you know? So, we'll meet at Dreamland to have our chat, okay?"

"Alright. *yawn* See you soon girls."

And so, they all drifted of to sleep physically, while their mindsweant to meet oeach other to try and exlapin what was happening.

111122211112222122111212211111111111.content:
(Just a refresher Twilight, Moon, Luna, Cadence)

Twilight found herself back in Dreamland. However, this part felt, rather than seemed (since all around was darkness), unfamiliar.

"I must be in a different part than where I was with Moon."

"Precisely, Twilight."

Twilight turned and found herself looking at Luna and Cadence.

"Hi, girls! Hey, where's Moon?"

Suddenly, something tackled her and she and the mysterious object rolled in the ground a bit. Twilight turned and found that the mysterious objec was a known, and very welcomed, one. Moon smiled at her and sighed hapily when Twilight began to stroke her right cheeck with her left hoof. Moon then spoke with a playful tone.

"Missed me?"

"*chuckle* Hi, love."

"Hi, beloved."

Both stared at each other with care and passion. But, just as Moon and Twilight were about to kiss...

"*AHEM* I hope we're not interrupting?"

"*giggles*"

Moon and Twilight turned and saw Luna giving them a look that said 'Seriously?' and Cadence giggling at them like a school filly.

"Eh, he, he..."

"Sorry. We got a bit carried away."

"No. Really?" ,said Luna with sarcasm.

"Okay, okay. We get it. Bussiness now, intimacy later.", said Moon, as she and Twilight got up.

"Right. Now then-"

"Save it, Luna. We know what you want to know. And, to make a long story short, there was a great difference in power on the time that Celestia used the elements on Moon and the time when my friends and I did so. And, since the elements try to make balance, they separated you from Moon and gave her a body. That happened because when the six of us faced Moon, we weren't nearly as powerful as an Alicorn. As for our relationship, I was in my library, planning on my next meal when Moon entered through my window as a mist and took form in front of me. Rather than fighting, we began chatting, cautiously at first. From then, we found we had a lot of things in common. Also, Moon helped me to overcome some of my insecurity and comforted me after telling her about the wedding. All of that together, along with how caring and loving she was with me, made me fall for her. Plus, her looks are QUITE a bonus!", she added a wink to that last comment.

Moon was blushing like a tomato. She had been wanting to ask Twilight what she tought of her and why she had fallen for her. Now, she knew. And she was happy for it. She embraced Twilight and gave her the kind of hug only a lover can give. Making them both blush profusely.

"Thank you, my beloved star."

"You're welcome, my precious moon."

Twilight then leaned in and rested her head on Moon's side. Both looking at each other's side.

"BEFORE you go all lovey dovey again, that answers most of our questions. However, we still wonder about your purposes, Moon."

That earned Luna a glare from Twilight.

"HEY! Only I get to call her Moon and Moony!"

"Then what do we all her? And, "Moony"?"

"Call me, Diana. And "Moony" is the pet name Twilight used for me when we had sex. I call her "Twi Twi"."

"You ALREADY had sex?!"

"Yes."

"Yes."

"What? It's not like we did something wrong."

"W-well, no but... Normally one waits and dated a bit before getting to second base."

"Maybe so, but we want and will do thing in our own way and at our own peace. Right, hun?"

"Absolutely, honey! Just because others do it like that, dosen't mean we have to do it as well. This is OUR relationship. And we'll manage it as we see fit."

"*sigh* Okay. You win. But you haven't answered my question."

"Look. I'm not the same as before, okay? I don't want eternal night anymore. All I want is to be by my Twilight's side for the rest of my days.", said Moon, looking lovingly at her precious marefriend.

"Very well then. In that case, we won't interfer, Still, Tia will want to know-"

"Please, don't tell Celestia. Not yet."

"Why not?"

"Because we don't think she has forgiven me yet. And if she found out not only that I'm alive, but that Twilight and I are having a relationship..."

"Yeah. I don't think she would be happy. Okay, we won't tell. But you'll have to tell her eventually."

"Don't worry. I'm sure we'll figure something out."

"Well then. We shall leave you alone then. Let's go, aunty."

"What? Already?"

"Yes. I think that Moon and Twilight have a LOT to "talk" about.", she looked at Twilight and winked at her.

"A-alright then.", said Luna. Not really understanding what her niece was implying. "Good night you two."

"Good night, Twily. Good night, Diana. Take GOOD care of Twilight, will you?", she said, winking at Moon.

"Oh, don't worry. I will.", countered Moon, winking back.

"Good night, Luna. Good night, Cadence."

"See you later."

Then, Luna and Cadence woke up, took the sleeping guards, not before erasing their memories of today though, their remaining share's of changelings and went back to Canterlot to give Celestia their report. Meanwhile, back in dreamland:

"Moon, you weren't serious when you said that you didn't wanted eternal night anymore, right?"

"Of course not, Twilight. But I couldn't tell them the truth now, could I?"

"Certainly not. Now then, let's wake up, pick our left overs and go back home, shall we?"

"I'm right behind you, hun."

"*giggles*"

They did just that. They collected their meals for tomorrow and went to Twilight's home in Ponyville.

Twilight and Moon woke up on the changeling's former hive, just recently returning from dreamland and from their chat with Luna and Cadence. Both were still wraped in each other's hooves with their faces facing the ceilling.

"Hi, Moon.", said Twilight, turning to see her beloved.

"Hi, dear- *GASP!*"

"What's wrong, love?"

"W-well..."

Moon then conjured a full-body mirror for Twilight to see herself.

"*jaws drop* Oh, my, gosh!!!"

The imager that Twilight saw in the mirror resembled her. But she was way taller now, being only half a head shorter than Moon. Her body also was longer, as were her mane, tail and her horn. Her horn was the most noticeable change, aside from her stature. Now, it was roughly 3/4 the size of an Alicorn's horn and it was perfectly spiralled (think of a drill).

"And I thought you were pretty before. Now I think your plain beautiful!"

"Oh, Moon, stop it!", said Twilight, quite embarassed.

"So, do you like the changes?"

"Oh! Do I! I also feel more powerful than before, both, in magic and physical strenght."

"Hmmm. I can't wait to try that new strenght of your's in more, intimate, ways."

"*growl* Neither can I, honey."

"I thought you said this should stop?", said Moon, smirking.

"As if you would listen. Still, I did promised you to turn you into a literal "Moon Pie", did I not?", Twilight bore a seductive smile.

"*chuckle* You're progressing quite a bit in the art of seduction, aren't you?"

"Yeah, I guess I am. Still, I think it'll be useful for our purposes."

"Oh? How so?"

"I'll tell you back at home. No one will bother us there."

"Okay then."

So, Twilight and Moon rounded up their left meals, which totalized 25 changelings, and teleported to Twilight's home. Once they had arrived:

"Say, Moon. I don't feel hungry. What about you?"

"Now that you mention it, no. So what do we do with these pests?"

"Hmm... How about we shrink them and place them in a jar by our bed?"

"Oh! That sound great! And speaking of bed and accomodations, I think we should do a bit of a reform here. I mean, I don't want to sleep in the basement. And I don't think you want to either."

"Hmm, you're right about that. Enev if last night's company was, exquisite."

"*blushes* Oh? Was I that good?"

"That good and much better, my love."

"Huh, you sure know how to treat a mare, hmm?"

"I'm learning from the very best.", said Twilight, bating her eyelashes to Moon. "Now, first things first. When I said that seduction would be useful, I meant that it would help us catch our preys. I'm not that naive. I've seen my friends and even Celestia staring at my flanks when they thought I wasn't aware of them doing so."

"So, you mean to seduce them and, give them one last good time, right?"

Moon sounded a bit hurt with that. And that fact didn't go unnoticed by Twilight. So, she went to her marefriend's side and hugged her tightly.

"Hey. I know you're not very keen on this idea. But it's necessary for our ultimate goal. Besides, what I'll share with them, will be lust only. But my everything will ALWAYS belong to you and only you. Moon, I love you. And I belong to you. In body, mind, sould and, more than anything, in heart."

Twilight then felt something wet hit herright shoulder. She looked up and saw that Moon was crying. But she was also smiling.

"Thank you, Twilight. I needed that. I needed to hear it. I needed to be sure that this relationnship that we have is real! That it's not just a dream or my mind playing a trick on me. I- I'm scared, Twilight. Scared that I'll wake up and that everything, and especially you will disapear! I'm scared that-!"

Moon couldn't finish that phrase. Because Twilight had sealed her lips shut with her own. She kissed her precious Alicorn with all the passion she could muster and began to french kiss her. She kept doing so until both couldn't take it anymore and she broke the kiss to breath.

"Tell me, my love. Did that felt like a dream? Or like an ilusion?"

"Twilight...I-"

"Shh. Don't worry Moon.", said Twilight, holding her mate closer and tighter. "I promise that I won't leave you. Not now, not ever. I swear it, with the Moon itself as my witness, that I'll be forever by your side. Besides, if I had intended to leave you, I wouldn't have done that binding ritual with you now, would I?"

"*sob**sob* Thank you, my love! Thank you so much! I'll never leave you either! I promise that I'll do everything in my power to make you happy!"

"And I'll be happy as long as you are. And if you still think that this is a dream...", said Twilight, drying up the last remaining tears from Moon's beautiful teal eyes. "Then wait here."

"Where are you going?"

"It's a surprise."

And with that, she teleported away. So, to pass time until her marefriend came back, she began searching for a book to entertain herself. Soon enough, she ended up at the farthest part of the library. There, she found a door that said, "Restricted Area: Only to enter with the librarian's permission".

"Hmm. Well, I'm her marefriend so, that should give me permission, right?"

So, she used her magic ot open the door and went inside. Inside, she found many books and scrolls that looked very old, yet well mantined. She browsed for a while until a book drew her attention. It did so because, diferently from the other books, it looked a bit dusty. Like it hadn't been read in quite a while.

"Hmm? What's this?"

She picked up the book and read the title.

"*GASP!* O-oh my goodness!"

The book she had just found had the title "Positions and Kisses from the Pony Sutra"".

*I doubt Twilight knows of this. I'm sure that if she knew about this book, she would have had it in a squeaky clean condition, like all the others. Well, Twi Twi, you wantd to make me a surprise. But now, you're not the nly one with a surprise in store.*

And so, while Twilight was somewhere, doing something, Moon took the time to read and study all and every detail of the book and to absorb every piece of information it had. After a couple of hours, she had finished the entire book. Another thing they had in common. Both were avid readers.

*Oh boy, Twilight is in for a surprise. I'll let her lead tonight. But, tomorrow, I'll have her screaming my name to the heavens over and over again!*, thought Moon with glee and joy. Of course, she wouldn't harm Twilight, she'd never EVER dream of doing so. But what she had planned for Twilight would most likely impede her from walking straight for a couple of days! Suddenly, she heard somepony calling her.

"Moon? Moon, where are you?"

"Coming dear!"

Moon exited the restricted area and found Twilight standing there, giving her a stern look.

"Um... Sorry. I thought that since I was your marefriend, that I had permission to go in."

"*sigh* It's okay.", said Twilight with a reassuring smile. "Just warn me next time. Some tomes need to be handled carefully or the spells inside maight become unstable. And I don't want you to get hurt, okay?"

"Okay. Thanks for caring."

"No problem, love. Now, can you come with me to the bedroom? I have something to show you."

"Okay. Lead the way."

Moon couldn't help but be excited. Sure, they had already had sex. But, until now, she hasn't entered Twilight's bedroom. So they went up the stairs and stoped right at the door.

"Okay. Now, wait a minute here, and I'll call you when you can come in, okay?"

"Sure love."

Twilight blushed slightly when Moon called her like that.

Twilight teleported inside of her room. She could have opened the door, but she didn't wanted to spoil the surprise she had made for her beloved moon. Truly, their relationship may have began quickly. But she was absolutely sure that Moon was her destined one. She could feel it in her very soul.

Once in the room, she took a good look at the modifications she had done to it. Her bed had been replaced with the one that they had used last night. The sheets had been washed clean. The room was altered to fit the bed. The ceiling now portrayed the starry sky that they loved so much and was enchanted to make it so that the constellations it showed changed frequently. The walls had been painted dark purple. A middle point between the colors of Moon's coat and her own. The furniture, aside from the bookshelves, was now a slightly darker tone of Aqua. The bookshelves were pink colored. Everything looked perfect. She then took a look at the attire she was going to use for her dream-mare. A dark-red dress with light-red highlights that hugged her curves not too loosely and not too tightly and that showed and highlighted har now more slender legs. It also was cut in a way to give the watcher a slight peek under the dress. As if inviting to take a better look. Also, just as they had arranged, on top of the night stand, was the jar with the leftover changelings.

Twilight didn't wasted more time and doned the dress. She also went to her mirror to brush her mane and to apply a bit of make-up. She applied a bit of shadow on her thin eyebrows. Just enough to slightly darken them. She also put some blush on her cheecks. Lastly, she put on an ametist colored lipstick. She looked at herself in the mirror and hardly recognized herself. She then grabbed a blood-red rose she had bought that day andlaid on the bed.

*Better not make her wait any second longer* "Okay love, come in.", she said in a seductive tone.

"About time dear. Now what was it-!", Moon would have finished her sentence, if she wasn't busy admiring the room of her lover. She looed at everything in the room. She, of course, knew the meaning of the colors. So, she instantly got the message Twilight wanted to transmit to her. She then looked to the ceiling.

"*gasp!* W-woah..."

"*giggles* Speechless, are we?"

"Y-yes. You did all of this?"

"Yes."

"It's beautiful my love."

"Thank you. But you haven't looked at everything in the room now, have you~?"

Moon then lowered her gaze until her dragonic eyes rested on the love of her eternal life.

"*GASP!!! T-Twilight!"

Twilight smirked. "Yes dear~?"

Moon looked Twilight over and over. Her eyes graping every detail of the most beautiful thing they had ever seen.

"You're so beautiful my love...But, why?"

"Well, I thought I could do something special or you. Besides, I want you to be completely sure and reassured that this is no dream, my beloved moon. This is real. And so am I. And I'll never going to leave you. Never."

Moon was crying again. but this time, they were tears, not of sadness or fear. But of joy and love. She was deeply touched at what her marefiend had done for her. That she would go to such lengts just to reassure her and cheer her up.

"S-so? What do you think?", asked Twilight, nervous and fearful that Moon hadn't liked what she had done.

Instead on answering with words, Moon pounced on Twilight and hugged her tightly.

"Okay. I hope we make it."

"Don't worry. I'm sure we will. *I hope.* Just, please, be very careful when we get there. We don't know what we'll fing or what Nightmare will be capable off. She probably was counting that we would come. Otherwise, she wouldn't had let you, Rarity and Rainbow Dash there. She left you because she knew you were going to tell us, so she's most likely waiting for us."

"Yeah. I noticed that the traps weren't meant to kill us. Do you think she's buying time?"

"Most likely. Obviously, she expects us to get there. Otherwise you probably would have been dead already and I wouldn't bee too far behind."

"We only blasted her with the elements, rather than battling on the last time we met her so, I didn't knew she was THAT dangerous."

"She wouldn't have risked facing Luna, Cadence, the Elements, Shining Armor and myself without some kind of plan or counter-measure. She also must have spies all across the forest. My points are proved right by the fact that the traps we faced were specifically designed for Alicorns and Earth Ponies. I just hope that we make it and that the others are well."

"Don't worry, Princess. Luna's group has an Alicorn, a Unicorn and a Pegasus. Cadence's group has magic and shields and AJ and Rainbow are the thoughest mares I know. They'll make it just fine. You'll see."

Celestia smiled at Pinkie's optimism.

"You're right. Now, hold on! The bridge to the castle is just ahead! I'll burst trough the door and then I'll teleport us to the tower that used to be my room."

Unbestknown to Celestia, Nightmare was watching them even now. She already knew what they were goinf to do and had already prepared their "welcoming comitee".

-Manwhile-

Nightmare had just finished placing the spells she would need to delay them for the final minutes she needed. It was almost time for the birth of her foal. She placed a spell around the castle that prevented enemy flight and teleport and had hidden on her mane an anti-magic ring rady to be used. However, this was no regualr anti-magic ring. She had designed it specifically for Alicorn magic. She also remembered that the Element of Lughter was the most energetic and random of the bearers. And thus, she used a very old trick that would ensure she stayed out of her way. She had turned the stone into water, frozen it and then made it and the cage, which she had used magic to make and that served to imprisson them, invisibles. That way, the pink earth pony would be out of commission and Celestia would be distracted long enough for Nightmare to place the ring. Of coure, she had also placed other preventive spell, just in case.

Suddenly, she heard the sound of hoofs aproaching quickly. Thus, she hid on the shadows, waiting for her first preys. Just as she had predicted, Celestia threw the doors open with her front hooves and ran in, instantly sliping on the invisible ice. As planned, Pinkie ended up on the cage, which closed as soon as it's ocupant was completely inside of it. Doue to it being closed, Celestia's head was slamed right on the cold iron. Stunning her. Nightmare didn't wasted a second. As soon as Celestia's head impacted on the iron, she ran to her and quickly slipped the ring around Celestia's horn, renddering her magic useles. The action, however, caused Celestia to shake her head, to clear it, and she looked straight at Nightmare. Anger clear an the day in her eyes.

"Nightmare Moon."

"Hi, Celestia. It's been long, hasn't it?"

"Not long enough."

"*hmph* I'm not surprised to see your not happy to see me. However, it seems you're at a disadvantage, aren't you? You have no magic. And thus, I can do this!"

Nightmare lit her horn and created onyx colored chains, ready to trap Celestia with them. Celestia tried to fly but, due to Nightmare's spell, she couldn't. Thus, the chains got her easily. Throwing her on the cold stone floor.

"Y-you! What have you done with my Twilight!!!"

"YOUR Twilight? *hmph!* Why don't you look down and take a guess?"

Celestia did so.

"*GASP!!!*"

She hadn't noticed it before but, from this angle, she could see that Nightmare's underbelly was round and inflated.

"Y-you ate her?!"

"*chuckles evily* Not quite. I unbirthed her. And turned her into my daughter!"

"N-no. I-it can't be!", said Celestia, horryfied. She was too late.

"Oh, but it is, Celestia! You're precious student is now my beloved daughter."

Nightmare then, suddenly felt a series on kick in her womb.

"Ohhh... And speaking of her, it's time for her to come out!"

Nightmare then used her magic to tie up Celestia to the wall with the chains. She then layed down on the ground and began pushing and pushing. Breathing deeply and exaling, like her instincts told her too.

"AAahhhh. AAAAAAhhhh! Ugh! GYYYYYYYYYYAAAAAAAAAA!!!"

Nightmare Moon's screams echoed through all of the castle. Usually, that would make Celestia feel good, knowing that her most hated enemy was in pain. Hoever, this time, it wasn't like that. Because on the meaning of that scream;

The next sound that was heard, was a baby's first cry. Nightmare got up at once, severed the umbilical chord and picked up Twilight in her hooves.

"Shhhh. Shhhhh. It's okay, Twilight. I'm here."

Twilight stoped criying and opened her tiny purple beady eyes. She looked at Nightmare and uttered the one word that filled Celestia's fave and heart with dread;

"Mama?"

Celestia's natural white face went even whiter, as did the rest of her body. This meant that she had utterly failed. She had failed Twilight completely.

"Yes, my dear Twilight. I'm your mother. I'm your mama.", said Nightmare, rocking Twilight from one side to the other.

Twilight chirped happily and hugged and nuzzled what she could on her mother's face with her tiny hooves. Nightmare nuzzled her little one as well. Happy that she now had a daughter.

"Welcome back to the world, Twilight Andromeda Moon."

Okay, readers. Choice time!

What happens next?

Does another one of the teams arrives?

or

Do we have a scene with Nightmare Mom, Twily and Celestia?
1112221111211111111212122222222222122221.title: Celestia and Pinkie Pie.

choices: Cadence and Shining Armor/Rainbow Dash and AJ.
1112221111211111111212122222222222122221.content:
If this was a nightmare, Celestia wanted to wake up right now. She wanted to dismiss all of this horrible situation as a bad dream. She wanted it to be fake, a lie. But, no matter how much she wanted it, she wasn't Discord. She couldn't change reality. She couldn't deny what her eyes were seeing. There, right in front of her, was her most hated enemy, Nightmare Moon, holding and rocking a little baby who once was her beloved student and secret love, Twilight Sparkle. Twilight was now different than before. She was a bit bigger than the regular foals. Her horn was a bit more slender, straight and perfectly spiraled. Her coat was a darker shade of purple. Her mane was now the same color that Luna's mane was with a hot-pink streak on the middle. To top it, she had now two little wings on her back. She was now a pure-blooded Alicorn. It was a t this point that Celestia fully realized that she had failed her. And, even if she got out of this alive, which she doubted, she would never be able to undo what Nightmare had done. The only thing she could do now was, with her head hanging low, watch how that monster was having fun with Twilight and, for the first time since Twilight's original parents passed away, she wept. She wept for herself, for Twilight, for the lost love that would never return and for the fear of what Nightmare planned to do with Twilight.

Nightmare noticed Celestia's condition and smiled cruelly. Her plan was working perfectly, so far. Twilight was her daughter, one of the elements was imprisoned and Celestia was in a pitiful state. Now she had to deal with the other foals left, and then she could focus on reigning Equestria with her little star by her side and on raising Twilight to be the Goddess that Nightmare knew she could become. First tough, she had to ensure that the rest of the plan flowed perfectly. First, she had to hide her prisoners. That way, when the rest of the fools showed up, they would think that they were the firsts and would try to stall her, foolishly waiting for the reinforcements that would never come. Then, she would use illusions of herself to confuse and tire her preys. Once that was done, she would use the second magic-nullifier ring she had designed for Alicorns on Luna and take knock out the third Alicorn. The rest would be simple enough to defeat. After all, with Twilight being her daughter and the element of laughter imprisoned, the Elements of Harmony couldn't be used. And even if the pink mare was free, without Twilight's element of magic, the others were useless. She remembered that the bearers of loyalty and honesty's specialities were speed and strength respectively. The bearer of kindness had that stare that could terrify/pacify many wild animals and ponies alike. Unfortunately for her, that trick wouldn't work on an Alicorn. Generosity would be the easiest. Her magic was, at best, poor and could be easily distracted by insulting/dirtying her looks. While she complained, Nightmare could take her out with a frontal magical blast and another one on the back, just to be sure. Then there was the last unicorn who, according to Twilight's memories, was Shining Armor, Twilight's older brother. She called one of the bats that were spying on the other "guests", she was waiting and saw that she still had some time before she had to prepare everything. So, she decided to have "fun" with Celestia. Thus, she teleported the crib she had built for Twilight with her magic to the room they were now and placed Twilight inside of it. She then placed a special sleep spell on Twilight. One that would ensure she slept through the whole night. That way, she wouldn't have any memory of Celestia, Luna or of any of the others that were on their way.

"So, Celestia. How do you feel? Knowing that Twilight is now mine?"

Celestia didn't answered. She couldn't fight, but she wouldn't give Nightmare the satisfaction of letting her humiliate her.

"Still a bit defiant, I see. Good, good. Otherwise this would be boring. Oh, by the way, I know about your attraction towards Twilight."

Celestia's eyes widened like dinner plates.

"H-how did you...?!"

"When Twilight entered my womb and regressed to a foal, I gained access to her memories from her previous life."

"So?"

"C'mon, Celestia. You had raised her to be a bright Unicorn, had you not? She wasn't that naive. She had seen you steal a few looks at her flanks, when you thought she wasn't looking."

"How do I know you're not just lying to see me suffer?!"

"*chuckles evilly* Seeing you suffer is delightful to me. But I'm telling the truth. Let me show you."

Nightmare ignited her horn and a mirror with obsidian markings appeared in front of Celestia. The mirror began to show to Celestia some of Twilight's memories. On them, she saw that Nightmare was telling the truth. Twilight blushed on some scenes after Celestia had stole a glance. Meaning that she truly knew or that she suspected, at least.

"B-but... S-she never..."

"That was because she didn't knew what to do, Celestia. She was thorn. One one hoof, you had always been a second mother to her. More so after her parents passed away. On the other hoof, she too had romantic feelings for you. Not strong enough to become a full fledged love. But she liked you in a romantic way. But, I don't think you really loved her."

"What?! And exactly what do you know about love, huh?! And exactly why would you think that, hm?!"

"Because you were trying to restrain her! You treated her more like a prized pet than anything! Twilight knew it to on her subconscious. She didn't wanted to admit it. But she always felt the magic on the letters you sent her! Magic that you used to keep her own at, according to you, acceptable levels. Despite trying to deny it, she knew right from the first letter."

Celestia was stunned. Twilight had known about it all along! Yet, she had never said anything. She trusted Celestia that much, and she had let Twilight down. At this realization, Celestia could only weep harder. Which made Nightmare smile.

"As for what I know about love, well, let's just say that being a mother can be pretty enlightening. And, unlike you, I will never harm or restrain her. I plan on training her. So that she could achieve her true potential! The potential that you were afraid off! I'll train her to be the full-fledged Goddess she was meant to be all along!", said Nightmare, while nuzzling Twilight, who cooed happily at her mother's touch.

Nightmare then called the bat again and saw that the next group was going to arrive soon. So, she dismissed the bat, teleported Twilight back to the nursery and used a spell to knock Celestia out, so that she couldn't want the others. She wasn't sure if she would even be able to. But she wouldn't take that risk. Everything had to be exactly according to her plans. And she was going to make sure it was that way. She then teleported Celestia and the knocked out pink mare to the underground dungeons, where they would stay until Nightmare finished with the rest of her "guests". She the created the illusions, like she had planned and hid into the shadows, awaiting to see which group on fools would get here first.

Well, reader. Which group arrives first?
