choices: The last group arrives (Luna, Rarity and Fluttershy)(reserved).
1112221111211111111212122222222222122221.content:
(Applejack, Cadence, Shining Armor)

The Everfree Forest was a place of curious and, more often than not, undecipherable attitudes and actions. For instance, although the forest had a tendency to cover up and consume everything it wanted, for some reason, it left Zecora's cottage alone. The same happened here, with the ruins of the Royal Pony Sisters castle. The forest made an almost perfect circular shape around the ruins. It was as if the ruins themselves were tracing their territory, and the forest obeyed. Cadence, Shining, AJ and Rainbow were currently on the border of that circular shape. The groups had met each other by chance. Cadence and Shining had arrived a few minutes prior to AJ and Rainbow and were discussing what to do when the pair arrived after surpassing the latest of the many obstacles created by Nightmare Moon. Granted, the earth pony and the pegasus were in a pretty bad shape, with bruises and cuts all over. Applejack's hat was practically in shreds, as was her mane. Her tail seemed like it had a fight with a bunch of scissors and lost. Rainbow wasn't much better. Her body was pretty much like Applejack. Most of the feathers of her wings were either, mangled, bent or simply weren't there. Her usually messed mane was even more so. If Rarity saw it, she would most likely faint and accuse her of committing a grave crime against fashion and style. Cadence and Shining were pretty bad too. Although Cadence was an Alicorn, between Celestia, Luna and herself, she was the youngest and weakest. She knew how to deliver a good punch and could defend herself, of course. But, being the Princess of Love, she had difficulty in harming others. Whether they were ponies or from other species. Even regular animals. Despite Shining Armor's shields and protective spells, she had had a pretty hard time with Nightmare's traps. Her mane and tail had been partially scorched. Her wings were like Rainbow's and she had her horn bruised, which made it difficult for her to cast spells without feeling pain. Among them all, Shining was the one with the less amount on injuries, thanks to his spells and military training. He hadn't become the Captain of the Royal Guard for nothing, after all. Most of his armor had been either, discarded or destroyed during the journey. His white coat was now more gray that anything, his horn was a bit hot from all the spells he had to use and, like Cadence's, his mane and tail were scorched. Even more so than Cadence's, due to him trying, and failing, to protect her from that trap. They were currently trying to decide the best methods to enter the castle.

"Well, what are we going to do?"

"Hmm... Maybe we could split up and-"

"No. We're stronger if we stay together. If we split, Nightmare could takes us out one by one. Remember, like the Princesses, Nightmare is an Alicorn. Meaning that she's, at least, trice as strong as an Earth Pony, trice as fast a flyer than a pegasus and has more magic than the most powerful Unicorn, which is Twilight."

Suddenly, they heard a voice that made their blood run cold and sent shivers down their spines.

"Oh, my little Unicorn. That's were you are wrong. YOU are currently the most powerful Unicorn in all of Equestria."

"W-what?! WHAT HAVE YOU DONE WITH MY SISTER, YOU MONSTER!!!"

"Watch your tongue, fool! As for Twilight, if you really want to find out, then come inside."

Then, the frontal gate to the ruins opened and the bridge was restored enough for them to walk safely to the other side. Shining began to move, when Cadence placed her right hoof on his left shoulder.

"Be careful. This most likely is a trap."

"I know, Caddy. I know. But my little sister is in there. I can't just stand here and do nothing."

And so, all four of them began walking towards the bridge. Once they had crossed it, the bridge collapsed completely.

"Great. We're trapped!"

Applejack looked ahead. Everything beyond the doors were darkness. Even tough she had been here before, she didn't felt anymore safe or secure for that.

"Ah guess there's only one way to go, partners."

"Then let's move! I wanna save our egghead friend and beat that monster of a mare's ass!"

"Ah know, Rainbow. Ah want ta save Thwalight as much as you do, but we'll be no good if we get caught. We need ta be careful."

The four of them continued to advance and were almost at the doors. Unaware that Nightmare could see and hear everything they were doing and speaking. She had already prepared everything she would need. She had created a total or six illusions of herself and had prepared a third magic-nullifying ring. It wasn't as powerful as the other two, since it was made in a hurry. But it, would give her enough time to take this third Alicorn out of the picture. As for Twilight's brother, who she knew specialized in shield and protective magic, she would catch him by surprise and knock him out before he could use his magic.

Soon, the group crossed the doors. Once they did, the doors were closed shut.

"Darn it! I knew it was a trap!"

"*chuckle* And you walked straight into it!"

Nightmare then teleported behind Shining Armor and blasted him with a minor magic blast on the back of his neck, effectively leaving him out of commission for a while.

"Shining!"

"You should care less about him and care more about yourself!"

Nightmare then tackled Cadence to the ground and rolled with her for a few seconds. She then got up and jumped back, creating a good distance of 10 meters between them. Cadence then tried to use her magic to create chains to hold Nightmare in place but, when she attempted to summon them, her horn wouldn't light up. She looked up, to see what was causing this and, to her dismay, a magic-nullifying ring was tightly fixed atround her horn.

"When did she-"

"Princess, look out!"

"Huh?"

Cadence looked in the direction where Nightmare was a few seconds ago but found nothing.

"She's right above you!"

Cadence looked up but, when she did, she received a lightning pulse from Nightmare, which shocked her until she fell to the ground, almost unconscious. Nightmare stood above her, smiling cruelly.

"W-what... have you... done to... Twilight and to... the other Unicorn?", she asked, her voice pleading for an answer.

"Don't worry about Twilight. She's safe and sound. And I will take care of her. As for the other Unicorn, well, let's just say that she was delicious."

Cadence teared up a bi, as did AJ and Rainbow. They had realized that Vinyl had already been eaten and digested.

"Ya said ya would take care of Twalight. What do ya mean with that?!"

"*evil chuckle* Why? Isn't a mother's duty to protect and to take care of their children?"

Cadence's eyes, as well as AJ's and Rainbow's went wide.

"W-wait. Y-you mean that you-?!"

"Unbirthed her and turned her into my daughter? Yes. I have."

"Liar! Your belly is normal!"

"That is because she has already been rebirthed. Why did you think that those taps only injured you? I was only stalling and gaining time until I could give birth to my daughter, Twilight Andromeda Moon."

"W-we're too late. W-we failed."

"That's right, my dear nice."

"But why?! Didn't you hated Twilight and us?!"

"Oh, believe me, I do hate you. But, a mother can never hate her child. Besides, she has a lot of potential. A potential that Celestia feared and tried to restrain."

"You think we're going to-"

"To believe me or not is your choice. But Twilight's memories don't lie. She knew what Celestia was doing, even tough she tried hard to deny it. No that it matters now. After all, I will train her to reach that hidden and untapped potential. And then she will become the most powerful being in all of Equis!"

"What?! Egghead can be THAT powerful?!"

"Oh, yes. You see, I don't know if you've been told this but, we, Alicorns, are demi-goddesses."

"Yeah, we know. Celestia is the demi-goddess of the Sun, Luna of tha Moon, Cadence of the Love and you..."

"And I'm the demi-goddess of Dreams, Nightmares and the original demi-goddess of the Night. However, Twilight had the potential to become a full goddess! And I plan to help her reach that power! Once she does, we'll rule Equis, side by side, forever! *Evil Maniacal Laugh!!!*(like the one from the ending of the first episode of the show)."

"No you won't!"

"Rainbow wait!!!"

Rainbow charged head on at full speed, trying to hit Nightmare. But Nightmare simply stepped aside. As if Rainbow had passed in slow motion. She then teleported the cage where Pinkie Pie, who was still knocked out, was and opened it right in front of Rainbow Dash, causing for her to slam into the bars on the cage. Nightmare then used her magic to throw Shining into the cage along with Applejack and slammed it shut. Effectively trapping the elements of loyalty and honesty. She then knocked Cadence out and sent them to the underground dungeons with Celestia, In different cells, of course. She then, once again, hid in the shadows and a waited for the final group to show up.
1112221111211111111212122222222222122221.title: Meeting Love, The Shield, The Loyal and The Honest

1112221111211111111212122222222222122221.content:
(Luna, Rarity, Fluttershy)

Luna, Rarity and Fluttershy had arrived at the edge of the ruins' territory as Cadence's group was entering the what was left of what once was hers and Celestias' home. Rarity had suggested they went after them but, just as they were about to follow, they saw the bridge fall, and since flight and teleportation were useless, they would have to find another way in. It pained Luna to be here, for this place brought back many painful memories. Many times she had asked Celestia to salvage what ancient books and texts where there and completely destroy what was left of the castle. But Celestia had refused every time. She said that, just like there were many, as she put, unpleasant memories, there were others that were very happy. And although Luna agreed that there were indeed many memories she treasured of this place, saying that the others were "unpleasant" was the understatement of the millennium. Celestia had also said that destroying the place wouldn't erase the memories of the events that had transpired here. And although Luna hated it, Celestia was right. She couldn't change the past just by destroying a place where bad things had happened. Unfortunately, the fact that they didn't destroyed this place was both, a good thing and a bad thing. The good thing, was that Luna knew the territory, since she had grown up here. The bad thing was that, if they had destroyed this place, maybe this wouldn't have happened. Maybe they wouldn't be here, risking their lives fighting a ghost of the princesses' past and trying to rescue a beloved friend. However, one thing that no one knew, was that Luna wished to be more with Twilight Sparkle than just a friend. In her past, she had a few lovers. But none were the one. The one she wanted to truly be with. The one she wanted to have a family with and to spend her life with. But, Twilight was different. Luna knew that Twilight was a night lover. But to her, it wouldn't matter if Twilight liked the night or not. She knew that she would love Twilight no matter what. But, she was torn. Because on one hoof, she was an Alicorn, thus immortal. She could overcome that if it was for Twilight. After all, she knew that Celestia planned to ascend Twilight to an Alicorn, like they had done with Cadence. On the other hoof, she knew that her sister wished to have Twilight as her mate too. They did shared a few lovers in the past. But this time, it was different. For she wanted Twilight to be her mate and, eventually, to marry her and live happily by her side. Of course, she hadn't discussed this with Celestia. How would she approach this subject? It's not like she could go to Celestia and say "Hey, Tia! I'm in love with Twilight just like you and I want her for myself!", no. This was a very delicate subject. Besides, she knew Celestia well enough to know that she would pretend that her love for Twilight didn't existed and would give Twilight up. She knew that Celestia still blamed herself for what had happened a thousand years ago. And thus, would give anything up if Luna was happy. Even the love of her immortal life.

"Um, your highness?"

Luna snapped to attention and noticed that her companions were looking at her with worry. She realized she had been spacing out.

"Are you alright?"

"Yes. It's just that I don't like being here. Too many bad things happened here."

Rarity and Fluttershy nodded. The princesses had told the six of them what had happened before Luna became Nightmare Moon.

"Anyway, what are we going to do? You and I can't fly and Rarity and you can't teleport. How do we get in?"

"Hmm... I think I have an idea.", she said, looking at the wall of what was left of what once was the tower where her room was."

"What are you thinking, your highness?"

"First, please stop calling me that. We're friends. So, please just call me Luna, okay?"

"A-alright. It's just that, well, you're a princess so..."

"I understand that, but I prefer to keep those formalities for our regular subjects."

"Okay."

"Alright."

"Thank you. Now, I was thinking of conjuring a rope and tie something heavy on one side, then we could use magic to secure the heavy side on the window from that tower. Then we could easily climb the rope and get in with out being noticed."

"I think that's a good idea, your- I mean, Luna."

"Indeed. Although I wouldn't risk dirtying my coat so much, it's for Twilight. Besides, my coat can't get worse that it currently is."

"*chuckle* We were, how do you say it nowadays? Ah yes, pretty roughed up, weren't we?", said Luna, with a small smile.

And it was true! Luna's usually midnight blue coat and now a mix of blue and brown. He cutie-mark was barely visible and her regalia, except for her crown, were lost in the forest. Rarity's coat was white with a few brown spots. She also was soaked from head to hooves and from muzzle to tail, due to one of the traps. And, like the first time she came here, her tail was missing all the way to the base. Only for different reasons. Fluttershy was the one in the worst shape of all three on them. She was almost bald, from a trap that used fire, all that was left of her tail were a few very short threads and her wings had cuts in many places and had many missing feathers.

Luna then used her magic to conjure the rope they needed. Fluttershy grabbed three stones and Rarity grabbed a fallen branch. Luna then used her magic to close some of the branches ramifications around the stones, tie the rope on the branch tightly (think of it like a grapple hook), and to carefully and silently move it to the window they had to climb to. They got to the rope and began to climb. First, Luna, since she was the faster of them. Next was Fluttershy and lastly Rarity. What they didn't knew, was that Nightmare was watching them, with the help of one of her many bats. She went to the location and created an invisible shield to hide Twilight's crib from their sight. She then made herself invisible too.

After about half an hour, the trio made it to the top. Once Luna had reached the window, she had entered the tower and pulled the rope until Fluttershy and Rarity could get in as well. What they saw shocked them. What had been once Luna's room, was now a beautifully made, if a bit rushed, mix of bedroom and nursery.

"Why would she make a nursery? Do you think had a foal?"

"I don't think anyone would be insane enough to mate with that monster."

"Oh, Luna. You hurt me with such comments! And here I thought we were intimate.", said Nightmare with sarcasm.

"I will do more than that if you don't show up right now and release Twilight at once!"

"I can't give Twilight back. Not now, not ever. Besides, Luna, I'm right behind you."

Luna turned, only to receive a buck right on her muzzle from Nightmare's powerful back legs. The impact sent her flying and she hit hard against the opposite wall. The impact was so hard that it broke a few ribs and her right wing. Nightmare didn't relent. She quickly fired a magical blast at the roof, making a couple of large stones fall. Both stones slammed into Luna. One broke her left back leg and the other one broke her left front leg. All the time, Luna could only scream and cry from the amount of pain she was suffering. It was so much pain that she ended up passing out.

"Luna!"

"Your highness!"

"Instead of worrying about her, you should pay attention to your surroundings!"

Nightmare then used her magic to make the stone floor become intangible. Making Fluttershy and Rarity sink a bit until their hooves were knee deep into it. She then turned the floor solid again.

"Darn it! I-I'm stuck!"

"M-me too!"

"*evil chuckle* Good, good. That way you won't interfere. Still, just for precaution..."

Nightmare then used her magic to envelop Rarity's horn.

"W-what are you going to do?!", squeaked Rarity, terrified.

"You're magic levels are poor, at best. But I still can't risk you making a stunt to hinder my plans!"

With a strong pull of her magic, Nightmare snapped Rarity's horn straight from the base of her skull, making Rarity howl and cry in an immensurable amount of pain. Rarity's head went down, facing the ground, making blood fall freely to the floor beneath.

"Rarity!"

Her hut had been tidied up and the ingredients for tomorrows brews were all gathered, as well as a few freshly picked vegetables for snacks. Looking down at her slightly less swollen stomach, she chuckled and rubbed the fleshy jail of her little tag-along. Pondering the resilience of her meal, Zecora swung her belly from side to side to test if Twilight was still alive.

Twilight had long since lost her fight against Zecora's stomach and indeed was barely recognizable as a pony with her melted features. Her fur had turned Zecora's acid's a brighter purple and small clumps still resiliently clung to the walls, though they were slowly dripping to meet the acid. Her horn was floating on the top of the pool, having fallen off yet not yet succumbing to the acids. As Zecora swung her prey from side to side, the motion further ground Twilight's lifeless corpse, molding her already deformed body into a real mess. The sudden stimulation revitalized Zecora's stomach, and the acid levels began to rise from just over a quarter full to nearly halfway. The acids hissed as they were united with Zecora's prey and worked double strength on the hapless unicorn. From the outside, the quiet murmur of the stomach suddenly transformed into fierce growling, something Zecora took note of.

Feeling her belly kick into overdrive, Zecora felt it her duty to lend a hand where she could. Moving with a noticeable hip-shake, Zecora sauntered over to her bedroom and nestled herself into her leopard skin covers. Snugly tucked away, Zecora patted her distended stomach one last time.

"Oh little unicorn,
Though you were a smart little lass,
I expect you will look rather cute,
On my ass."

She chuckled, and kissed her moaning tummy good night.

Zecora awoke at 6:30 A.M. on the dot as she always did, stretched herself out and yawned. she swung her hind legs over the edge of her cot, and leaped to the floor. A tiny hiccup crept out from between her lips, and she was reminded of her little passenger. Looking towards her abdomen, sure enough it was as flat and muscular as before she had devoured Twilight. Their was only her rump to remember her by, now more voluptuous than before, a real piece of eye candy if Zecora was being honest with herself. Her morning continued normally however, but even among her daily routines she was on occasion reminded of her actions. She would on occasion scrape by a shelf with her slightly larger behind, or be greeted by more wary visitors to Everfree searching for what was indeed now just her ass. Even as she ate her breakfast she could still taste a tiny bit of the purple unicorn whenever she belched, and the tribal zebra couldn't help but giggle.

"Young Twilight Sparkle,
you tasted quite fine.
And now my delicious little pony
you are all mine~."

Zecora felt confident as a huntress that she could devour all of ponyville should she desire without ever being seen, but deep down the thought of such treacherous behavior was slightly unnerving. Twilight soon found herself in the upper floor of the cottage, in what was possibly the only animal-free room in the house. "So... you're absolutely sure this will be safe?", Fluttershy asked. Twilight smiled and told her, "Positive. The spell has passed all of Roaring's Tests of Secure Biological Transfiguration, and I've done the spell several times on both inanimate and animate objects. Besides, we're simply doing some tests to find any way the spell can be refined. You'll be perfectly fine."

"Oh... Okay... What do you need me to do?" Twilight gave a quick look about the room saying, "Well right now, just stand... right where you are now. I'll be shrinking you a little bit at a time so you can adjust to the change easier. Are you ready?" Fluttershy hesitantly nodded. Despite trusting Twilight, Fluttershy's heart skipped a beat as the unicorn pointed her horn straight at her and shot out a violet beam. When she could bring herself to open her eyes again, Fluttershy found that she was at shoulder height compared to Twilight. "How are you feeling? Any dizziness or vertigo?"

"A-a little vertigo, but that's it..." Twilight nodded, and jotted down some notes. "Very good. Tell me when you feel ready for another cast."

------

Before long, Fluttershy was small enough to be mistaken for a young filly. "Before we continue any further," Twilight noted, "We should move you up onto the table. How's that sound?" Fluttershy turned her head away from the floor long enough to take in her 'new' surroundings. It didn't take very long for her to decide that she didn't like being that close to the ground at all. "...Okay. I'll-"

Before she could say anything else, Fluttershy found herself swept up in Twilight's forelegs, and was gently seated on the edge of the table with a quick nuzzle. "There~♡. Isn't that much better?" There was a brief yet horribly long silence as Twilight slowly realized what she just did. "...Ohmygosh, Fluttershy, I'm so sorry! You were just so small, and I just- I don't know what came over me! You're a grown mare, I should treat you like one!" Fluttershy merely stared at the floor saying, "It's okay. Let's... just forget that ever happened."

Twilight nodded and jotted down another note. 'Psychological effects on caster not encountered in previous tests. Resized organisms changes instinctual reaction?' Looking back up at Fluttershy, Twilight decided to...

She hadn't been hurt, and the scariest part was over- plus, she knew she probably wouldn't be hurt if she did fall to the ground. (for anyone wondering(this is the second reference I've made to it, after all) the square cube law refers to the fact that in order to halve something's height, you must first divide it's volume by four. This is referred to as the square cube law for obvious reasons. Practically, this means that a statue will use exponentially less supplies for every inch of height you remove, and a persons bones, muscles, etc. will become disproportionately scaled as they shrink. I'm not going to go into everything, but the bones become super-strong, the muscles super dense, etc. If they were to grow instead, at somewhere around double the size(not height) they would no longer be able to support themselves. Much higher, and their legs would shatter under the pressure. Also, they would both be essentially blind- the shrunken one wouldn't have enough light entering his pupils, and the tall one would have too much. This will not be addressed though, because artistic license biotch!)

In front of the train station, said stallion was waiting for her. "Hello there Ms. Rarity, I am so glad you could make it." Normally you'd expect somepony like him to be snooty and condescending, the truth is that he was easily one of the friendliest ponies in Canterlot.

"Fancy Pants, Fleur, how nice of you to greet me here," She said in her best manners, holding herself with grace and dignity. She knew that Fancy Pants wouldn't care if her demeanor slipped a little but she couldn't help to show her best anyway.

"It's always nice to see a good friend." He answered while Fleur was fawning over him as if they were at a photo session. He held a slight smirk as he said this while his wife appeared slightly nervous for some reason. "Without further ado, shall we go then? The dinner party will be held at my mansion."

Rarity couldn't wait and immediately followed him to a cart that would bring them to his mansion. During the drive he continued their chat. "Now Rariy, I always liked the privacy of this party. If you are invited or not mostly depends on the level of trust between us. I trust you completely to keep everything that happens during the party a secret, that's why you're here." Rarity felt honored that Fancy Pants considered her such a good friend.

"Don't worry, my lips are sealed." After a while they arrived at Fancy Pants mansion, which was second only to the royal palace in terms of luxury. Marble walls lined the hallways and exotic flowers were planted in the garden. Paintings of famous artists decorated the walls and the ground was covered in a plush carpet. A butler appeared and greeted Fancy Pants and Fleur de Lis. "Good afternoon master, would you like me to accompany your guest to her room?" He asked in a dignified tone.

11333111.title: A chubby Fluttershy

113331111.content:
With every pound Fluttershy gained, Rarity could see more and more why that trend became so popular. Fluttershy looked simply amazing with all those extra pounds. Her soft curves and that slight jiggle in every step. The motions were downright hypnotic as those flanks shook a little while she walked past. It was no longer deniable for Rarity, she was very attracted to her friend, sexually. The shy pegasus mare noticed that her friend was staring but thought, it was out of jealousy. Ashamed, she looked to the ground. "I think, if you can't gain any weight, I will lose mine too. It's only fair."

Panic spread through Rarity as she heard this. Fluttershy losing all that glorious fat? There was no way in tartarus she could let that happen. It was a difficult situation now. On one hoof, she loved Fluttershy's fat body, on the other hoof she did not want to creep her out by coming on too strong. Fluttershy was still a very delicate mare, so moving too quickly could ruin everything.

The yellow mare just shook her head. "No, it just isn't fair. Being fat is such a huge trend now and you can't follow it, so neither will I." In her mind, it was just the right thing to do. She knew from her experience with Photo Finish, how much all of this meant to Rarity, so she won't make the same mistake again. What she didn't notice was, that Rarity was desperate to keep her fat. Now was time for a decision, either Rarity could just admit her feelings to Fluttershy, which would either be hit or miss or she could try to be indirect.

11333211.content:
Rarity had spent many years refining her walk to the point where her casual stroll through the market said many things; The poise spoke of a diamond found in the rough and polished to a shine. Each step echoed with the spirit of noblemares come and gone, crafting history as they passed. The delicate movements were a living piece of art, reflections of a lifestyle of precision and grace. Yet, with a subtle sway of the hips, all that was lost to the ether, drowned out by a much louder message.

"I'm sexy and I know it."

To watch the unicorn shop was to watch a hypnotist on stage. With a precision-strike compliment, a subtle smile, or a even a little sigh, ponies seemed to bend to her will. "You can go first." "I don't normally do this, but for you..." "And take one of these too, on the house!" It came as no surprise that she had plenty of spending money left over to use on some of the traveling sales carts that stopped in town. She took the time to glance at the inventory of each, until one merchant addressed her.

"You must be Rarity." With a mild start, Rarity looked to the hooded merchant in the caravan. "Why, yes I am. Do I know you?" All Rarity could see of her was her face; a mare with a dark, leafy green coat and sharp yellow eyes. Everything else was covered by an oversized baggy robe. "No, you do not. Your reputation merely preceeds you. You may call me Charina." Rarity subtly looked over the items on display, seeing no common theme between them. "It's a pleasure to meet you. If I may ask, what sort of shop is this?" Charina grinned, "Merely assorted odds and ends. I collect trinkets from one place and sell them in another, as a hobby of sorts. Although a mare like you probably isn't interested in sand bottles or dream catchers. I think I have just the thing for you..." She magically lifted an emerald necklace from beneath the makeshift counter. "What do you think?"

The decision was swift. Rarity's entire coinpurse was exchanged for the emerald beauty. She did not notice the brief glow it emitted as soon as she put it on. "Thank you very much," Charina said with sincere glee, "If you want anything else, come back by this evening. I'll be leaving town tonight."

------


That night, as Rarity slept, the necklace on her vanity dresser began to evaporate into a green mist. The cloud enveloped the sleeping mare, beginning her metamorphosis...

11333221.content:
Rarity was sitting on the floor in the main room of the library, only two others there with her, Twilight and Spike, who had "closed shop" in order to do an experiment involving an ancient spell that Twilight had discovered. Rarity had volunteered to act as the guinea pig, since she had experienced body transforming spells before... sort of. Well, she had been given wings anyway. Still, she couldn't help but feel nervous, all they knew was that the spell makes one "predatory".

"Are you ready Rarity?" Twilight smiled. "I think I have this down."

"Ready as I'll ever be darling."

Twilight nodded and her horn flared up, as magical light began to materialize and surround Rarity, lifting into the air. Rarity closed her eyes, and after a few seconds felt a strange ripple move through her, accompanied by a sharp popping sound as the spell took effect and she was deposited back on the floor with a flash.

"G-Get me a mirror." Rarity muttered, wanting to make sure there wasn't any unsightly changes as Twilight began examining her, making notes. She feel that something was off around her mouth.

Spike ran off, returning with a small mirror which Rarity took with her magic, looking her face over. Everything SEEMED normal so far... With a bit of trepidation she opened her mouth revealing sharp, carnivorous teeth in place of her normally equine ones. She gasped and Twilight quickly sketched the change in her notes.

"Fascinating! Rarity, try thinking of food or something, I think the spell may have made you a carnivore!"

Rarity didn't need to, she'd already put together the dots, and noticed an... urge. She hadn't eaten since breakfast and all of a sudden she was positively famished, and there were two rather tasty looking creatures in the room with her.

"Twilight, I believe that you are correct, in fact all of this thinking has got me feeling a bit peckish, perhaps you could go get the reversing spell and we could go eat?"

"Oh! Of course, the spell took a bit out of me too, I'll be right back with the tome I found the spell in." Twilight started upstairs.

Rarity thought fast, this new urge... she wanted to fulfill it so badly. It would be a simple matter to grab Spike and run off to eat him back home, but Twilight would be a much bigger meal. Of course if she wanted to get Twilight alone, she'd have to trick Spike into leaving before Twilight got that book.

114.title: Applejack.

1142.content:
The night Applejack has been dreading for as long as she could remember was nearing. Tomorrow would be her twentieth birthday, normally a joyful celebration but not for the apple family. Nopony could remember when it started but at one point in its history the entire family was cursed. On the night of their twentieth birthday every member of the apple family would change, mentally and physically. Physically they would become insanely strong for the night, capable of wrestling down manticores. Mentally they would gain a dark appetite, an appetite for other ponies.

The combination was what made this curse so dangerous, basically at midnight Applejack would become a super strong pony eater until the first rays of the sun were visible in the sky. The last family member that had to go through this was her brother Big Macintosh. Applejack, Granny Smith and Applebloom would visit another family member until it was safe again while her parents and uncle Orange would contain him. When they returned only uncle Orange was still there and Big Macintosh has never been the same after he learned that he has eaten his own parents.

Applejack shook herself out of these memories and looked back to the ponies that would hopefully contain her tonight.
1142.title: A family curse

choices: Somepony is knocking on the door.
11421.content:
Her brother and cousin were sitting with her at the dinner table, enjoying their meal together, it was possibly the last meal for Big Macintosh and Braeburn. Applebloom and Granny took the train to Manehattan yesterday and would be safe from Applejack, the two stallions would be responsible for keeping her away from Ponyville tonight. An awkward silence filled the room, they all knew the containment plan for Applejack.

First she would be bound in chains inside a cage. Said cage was in the apple cellar they recently built there. If she manages to break the chains Big Macintosh would get ready to hold her off while Braeburn would go up and close the hatch. The hatch looked like it was made of plain wood but it was just a disguise for a steel plate, even with her enchanted strenght it would take Applejack some time to get through. In the meantime Braeburn would do his best to keep Ponyville safe, setting up traps to slow Applejack down and luring her away into the orchard.

The clock was ticking, only two more hours until midnight. Big Macintosh and Braeburn used the day to rest while Applejack worked herself to the bone, hoping that this would increase her family's survival chances. The two stallions looked at each other and then Big Macintosh turned to his sister and started to speak. "Applejack, ah just want you to know that ah'll forgive you if you-know-what happens." Applejack gulped, dreading the prospect of not just losing her brother but to be the one to kill him. Silently she prayed to Celestia that the chains would hold her.
11421.title: Big Macintosh and Braeburn.

114211.content:
Almost two hours later Applejack was in chains, inside the cage. The chains were the strongest they could find, checked for weak links over and over again. The cage was made to contain grizzly bears, also well kept for this occasion. Applejack has already requested the chains to be tightened up despite the fact that she could barely breath as it is.

All three ponies stared at the clock hanging from the wall, only one more minute. They all were shivering as the dreaded hour drew closer, the hour that would turn Applejack into a pony eating monster. Finally the clock striked midnight and Applejack doubled over. Big Macintosh and Braeburn stared in horror as their sister and cousin groaned and moaned. She started to salivate and as she got up again she had a vicious grin on her face. "There is my meal for the night, let me out so I can eat you up." At this point their family member was gone, replaced by the monster of the curse.

She struggled against the chains with a great force, making the steel groan in protest. "I SAID LET ME OUT! I'M HUNGRY!" She wailed as she tossed and turned. Big Macintosh gasped as one of the chain end came undone. It laid close enough so he could grab it with his teeth so he dove his through the bars and bit down on it. His teeth hurt as he pulled Applejack against the cage wall but he endured it, fairly certain that what awaited him if he failed would hurt even more. He started to bang his sisters body against the wall, hoping this would get her to stay still.
114211.title: They get everything ready.

choices: He gets ready for the chase.
1142112.content:
With a loud snap the chain broke in Big Macintoshs hold. Applejack looked madder than before and started to bang her hooves against the cage. Big Macintoshs heart fell and he gulped, "Braeburn, go and secure the cellar, make sure that Applejack doesn't reach Ponyville until daybreak." ordered the large stallion. Braeburn looked at him sadly, knowing this is probably the last time he would see his cousin and ran outside.

Big Macintosh got into battle position while Applejack dented the bars even further. Finally they were bent enough for the crazed mare to squeeze through. She stood in front of her target with a wicked grin. "Let's start with the main course." She snarled while licking her lips.

The large, red stallion was sweating, was this what it was like for ma and pa? Anyway, he would not fail his duty as Apple family member, he would distract her long enough for Braeburn to prepare himself. He scraped his hooves across the ground and got ready for the fight. "Don't think ah'll make this easy for ya'll." The two ponies charged at each other.

The ensuing battle was fairly one sided, Applejack was much stronger and faster than Big Macintosh. He managed to score a few hits while dodging her snapping mouth but he was already exhausted while Applejack was just getting started. Finally she bucked him in the side and sent him flying. With a loud groan he hit the wall and laid there, too dizzy from the impact to stand up. This was it, he thought, maybe I deserve this for what I did back then. He saw Applejack approaching him with a salivating maw and prepared his last words. "I forgive you."

"I don't want you to forgive me, I want you to taste delicious." She taunted as her mouth engulfed his head. Big Macintosh was exhausted but he had to buy Braeburn more time. Her pushed against her in a futile attempt to slow her down only to find his hooves disappearing down her throat. Even his powerful hind legs could only slow his descend down a little bit as Applejack worked her way over his belly. His nose came into contact with a pool of some sort of liquid, he has already reached the stomach.

Outside Braeburn put up some final barricades against his crazed cousin. The sound of battle had ended and Braeburn allowed some tears to flow. He wasn't so naive to think that Big Macintosh could have subdued Applejack. The quiet meant that he would never see his cousin again.

11431.content:
A large table had been placed in a clearing at Sweet Apple Acres. At each of the two ends laid a large crate of apples, readily awaiting the two mares that would devour them. As it so happened, a major trading route was closed off due to unusually high roc activity, leaving Applejack with more apples than she could sell locally. Not wanting them to go to waste, she and Rainbow Dash decided on an impromptu eating contest.

Twilight took the role of judge, reviewing the scenario aloud as the other two mares took their seats. "Okay, here are the rules. Normally a winner would be declared based on how much food is consumed in a set time limit, but due to the circumstances, it will be based on how many apples are eaten before giving up." Saying it aloud gave Twilight a bad feeling about this contest. She was, after all, dealing with the two most stubborn ponies she knew. "You each have your own crate of apples. I've personally verified that each one contains the same amount of apples, both in quantity and overall mass. I will watch and keep score. Are you both ready?"

"Ah sure am, Twi!"
"Yeah, let's get this show on the road!"

"All right, on my mark you-" But the unicorn was interrupted by the starved mares munching away already, leaving her desperately grabbing for her scoreboard.

------

Several minutes in, neither Applejack nor Rainbow showed any signs of slowing down. "Wow, Applephack" Rainbow commented through a full mouth, "Thif waf one of the beft ideaf we had." Applejack simply nodded with an acknowledging 'Mmm'.

------

"Ya know, Rainbow, you ain't gonna be the fastest flier if you keep packing 'em away like that." The pegasus paused for only a moment. "Hah! Don't think you can win that easily! Even when I'm working off this," she said patting her slightly bulging belly, "I'll be seeing it as proof of how badly I beat you!"

Twilight only sighed, wishing she had enforced a time limit. Despite what enthusiasts of the 'sport' say, watching these two eat all morning was proving to be one of the most boring things imaginable.

------

"Hah! Done and done!" Rainbow rubbed her engorged stomach, the crate of apples now a thing of the past. "Well, AJ? Ready to call it quits?" Applejack took the time to swallow before answering, "Ah've only got three left! Just wait a sec." Dash watched intently as her opponent polished off her crate. "There, all gone. Guess it's a tie, huh?"

This was unacceptable to the pegasus. "Come on, there's gotta be a tiebreaker in case of something like this, right Twi?" They both looked to the unicorn in question, only to find that at some point she had fallen asleep. "Huh. Well we gotta find some way to settle this!" Applejack knew Rainbow well enough to know that she wouldn't drop the subject until, in her mind, there was a clear winner and loser.

And that was when an idea came to her. Upon retrospect, she would find it strange, perhaps blaming the thought on the competitive stress or postmeal bliss. But at the moment, it made perfect sense to her. She could prove right then and there that she had the bigger appetite!

114312.content:
Applejack spent a few more moments contemplating this idea. Should she really do that? The only edible thing around here was Twilight because if she ate Rainbow Dash it would probably be cheating and Twilight could still settle a winner from inside her stomach. Slowly Applejack crept closer to the sleeping unicorn while Rainbow Dash tried to think of a way to win this match, not knowing that the farmer already had a plan. Applejack now stood right in front of Twilight, who rolled onto her back in her sleep, and nervously bit her lip as she tried to make a decision. Then, as Rainbow Dash looked over to her, Applejack decided to act. Before Rainbow Dash could even ask what she was doing, she grabbed Twilights head and quickly shoved it into her mouth.

Rainbow Dash was thinking, how should they do this? Of course they could just pick more apples or go to sugarcube corner, the pegasus liked the second idea most. She already turned around and wanted to ask AJ and Twilight where they wanna go when she saw Applejack putting Twilights head into her mouth. "Wha.... what the hay are you doing AJ?" She asked in shock but she got no answer. The orange earth pony already had her mouth full of Twilights head and was currently pushing her further down her throat. Rainbow Dash could not say anything anymore and just stared at the spectacle, jaw almost hitting the ground.

Twilight was watching the two of them eat for several minutes. At first it was fascinating to see how much those two could eat. Twilight even considered running a few experiments on pony stomach capacity. After a while though it got pretty boring for her and it became harder and harder to focus. Eventually, she closed her eyes and succumbed to sleep. A few more minutes later though, she was roughly woken up again as she felt her body being moved. "Huh, what? Sorry, I fell asleep." She said groggily and tried to rub her eyes, only to find that her shoulders were stuck in position and she couldn't move her arms. It was dark and wet and she could feel movements all around her. Panicked, she looked around, trying to find out where she was. She let her horn glow a bit and saw the slimy walls of Applejacks throat, she realized that she was being eaten and started to struggle.

Applejack used Twilights confusion as she woke up for a few more gulps. Rainbow Dash also seemed to shocked to react at the moment, so AJ decided to send more of Twilight down her esophagus. A few gulps later Applejack could already feel Twilights belly button on her tongue. A huge bulge could already be seen on Applejacks neck as Twilight was forced down. As she reached the unicorns hips, the kicking legs became a problem. At this moment she hoped that Rainbow Dash was not looking to closely and snaked her tongue out, letting it slide between the other mares legs. From inside of herself, AJ could hear a gasp and the kicking legs became still, except for a delighted shudder. Applejack used this opportunity and grabbed Twilights flanks, shoving them past her lips. Immediately, Twilight tried to struggle again but now she could do nothing to stop her descend anymore.

Rainbow Dash watched part with shock, part with morbid curiosity as the lavender unicorn was eaten by the apple farmer. Her common sense told her to stop AJ, to pull Twilight out of the other mares mouth but something made her want to watch it. After watching for a few minutes as Twilight was sent down deeper and deeper with each gulp, her hooves finally disappeared past Applejacks lips and the orange earth pony craned back her neck, showing off the bulge that used to be a unicorn and gulped a few more times, sending Twilight into her belly. AJ let out a contended sigh as she finished her meal, while Rainbow Dash stared at the now moving belly, containing dozens of apples and a struggling pony. Applejack now turned around and faced the pegasus. "Alright Rainbow Dash, I win."

Twilight was speechless as she heard this, Applejack ate her? For one moment she was still in her fleshy prison, surrounded by apple mush, then she punched the wall she could still reach. "APPLEJACK, YOU LET ME OUT RIGHT NOW!" She yelled before she resumed to struggle. Applejack had to wince at the sudden push. "Ah am mighty sorry 'bout that but ah really wanted to win this contest." Twilight let out an exaspirated groan from within. "Alright alright, you win, now let me out already."

11511.content:
There were many ponies that loved Pinkie Pie. Her light-heartedness and love of fun and life was contagious. She was always cheerful, upbeat, and had a noble calling in life. More than just partying, her talent was to bring the festive spirit out in ponies and bring them together to celebrate. And while in her day-to-day activities she could be an annoying pest and a source of irritation for many, there weren't any ponies who could dislike her, although they all agreed that Pinkie was hyper active, and probably needed to chill out.

So it would come to a surprise to many of them that this whimsical pony was actually fairly calm when not in the presence of another pony whom she wanted to celebrate with. For every meeting, no matter how small or common, was like a small celebration to her, and when there were no ponies around, and nothing to celebrate, Pinkie would just smile and let her mind gently drift to nothing in particular, and everything in the universe--her imagination was extensive.

Pinkie had just put an order of cupcakes into the oven, and while fatigue never ever took her, she was leaning out the window and sighing, looking at a wind chime across the street and letting her mind wander. “Sorry to interrupt you Spike. I know you have a lot of work to do.” Twilight called over her shoulder.

“Yeah, yeah,” Spike muttered as he continued the arduous task of organizing the new library. The castle’s library contains copies of every book in the royal archive, which basically contains any book of note ever written. It was refreshing that Twilight didn’t have to go out and specifically order the books she wanted anymore, but unfortunately, organizing all these extra tomes was a nightmare. The cyclopean crystal walls of the library were like a winding maze, and Spike got dizzy just looking at it all.

Meanwhile, Twilight was having the time of her life poring over various ancient tomes that she had never even heard of before. She had been testing out new spells all day- most of them duds. But eventually, one of them was bound to do something interesting. She was sure of it. So eager was she to start studying that morning, in fact, that she skipped breakfast. She was getting a little hungry, she noticed. Maybe it was time to take a break for lunch. Just as she had that thought, a delicious smell overwhelmed her nostrils, like roast veal. Being a herbivore, the smell of meat usually didn’t appeal to Twilight; but for some reason, right now, it seemed mouthwatering.Twilight turned her nose to the air, taking in the smell, curious as to its origin.

Twilight stared at the dragon, and realized that the smell became stronger the closer she was to him. Could he be the source of the smell? Perhaps that spell wasn’t a dud after all? Maybe it was a fragrance spell, like the ones Rarity uses? Whatever the cause, he smelled delicious. She took another whiff of the air, closer to him this time, and the smell of veal overtook her. Her empty stomach grumbled loudly, demanding something to fill it.

“Uh… what are you doing?” Spike raised a brow, taking a step back from the hungry mare.

“Well, I’m not on the menu,” Spike rolled his eyes. “We can go down to Sugarcube Corner if you're that hungry.”

Before he could respond, Twilight, no longer thinking clearly, sent a lick along his cheek. Even the small hint of flavor she got from that was divine. Apparently, he didn’t just smell delicious-- he was delicious! “Whoa, gross! He opened his eyes to realize he had accidentally shoved his hands in her mouth. He tried to pull them out, only for the mare’s lips to clamp down on them as she savored the flavor. Twilight was stunned. This was the best thing she’d ever tasted! Her mind clouded by the effects of the spell, she decided on one course of action and one course only.

Twilight jerked her head backwards, bringing his head and shoulders into her mouth as well. Before Spike could react to anything that was happening, she reared her head back, lifting the small dragon into the air. As gravity began to pull him deeper into the mare’s gullet, Spike instinctively pushed his claws against the skin around the entrance to her throat, trying to keep himself from being pulled inside. He dared to open his eyes, and before the enveloping saliva could force them shut again, he got a terrifying glimpse down the mare’s throat, which yawned open as if beckoning him to crawl inside. If he really did get pulled into her throat, he wasn’t sure he would ever get back out again.

“Come on, Twilight! This isn’t funny,” he yelled as he began resisting with renewed energy, but his complaints fell on deaf ears. Twilight was in a state of ecstasy she’d rarely felt before. For all her life, she was always worrying about something. Always second guessing her every action, analyzing every situation. Always trying not to disappoint Princess Celestia her whole life made her a bit neurotic. But in this moment, all of her inhibitions melted away. For the first time in years, Twilight felt the bliss of being truly comfortable. She didn’t have to worry about anything, or try to impress anypony. She just had to relax and enjoy the moment.

Spike, on the other hand, was not so comfortable. Quite the opposite, actually. His calls were silenced as Twilight's throat muscles gripped tightly on his snout, and he finally realized that she wasn’t just joking around, in her own typical weird Twilight way. She was actually planning on swallowing him whole! This epiphany came a little late, though, as by this point she had closed her mouth around his feet, and his arms and shoulders had joined his head within her throat. He felt her throat muscles undulate and pulse unnaturally around him, slowly pulling him deeper into her esophagus like a conveyor belt. Soon, he was entirely within the mare’s throat, and it clasped so tightly around its prey that he couldn’t even move a muscle. Worse than the discomfort was the helplessness- all he could do was stay immobile, and wonder what kind of fate was awaiting him.

Twilight’s throat bulged to almost impossible proportions as the dragon slid down it, his descent assisted by a combination of gravity and her repeatedly swallowing. Eventually, the bulge in her throat disappeared into her chest, and Spike was deposited into a slightly roomier chamber. It was large enough for him to move around in a bit, and the walls and floor was covered in flowers, vegetables, and strange juices. He quickly realized he had entered Twilight’s stomach. Her stomach acids were completely ineffective against Spike’s tough scales. A supply of oxygen leaked in through the stomach lining, so luckily he could breathe in his new fleshy prison. The soft, smooth walls, the sauna-like heat and moisture, and swadling effect of her distended stomach subtly shifting back and forth like a cradle made it downright relaxing. Faster than he could yelp, the blur slammed into his chest, yanking him off his feet and onto his back, the force of the tackle dragging him through the dirt several feet until the two forces came to a stop.

Spike was dazed by the initial hit, his vision filled with an explosion of colors as he's left to get his marbles back. When he did, he was soon greeted by an odd sight, even for the subject in question. Leaning over him, he saw a certain pink pony with a poofy pink mane, the ecstatic pony wildly sniffing over him while her hooves are at either side of his shoulders. Spike groaned and tried to nudge Pinkie's muzzle away.

"Pinkie, what are you doing?" the dragon asked. It would be a silly question to ask most of the time, but this was weird even for her. Despite his nudging, the pony simply leaned in close and kept sniffing, her pupils thin as she lauded in the strange new scent. Despite that, if her next statement was anything to go by, that didn't seem to dull her demeanor.

"Oh, I just smelled something funny," she said. "Well, not funny, I suppose it's more funny that I smelled it out here at all. No, it was more yummy wummy. I dashed to it thinking it was some super duper supper, but then I wound up slamming into something scaly. And that was you!" That didn't quite explain enough for Spike.

"What smell? I didn't smell anything," Spike said, again trying to nudge Pinkie away again. But Pinkie again ignored the gesture, and now buried her nose against Spike's chest, sniffing greedily. Spike shuddered a little, Pinkie's nostrils tickling him a little. Pinkie let out a contemplative "hm" as she brought up her head.

"Did you do something to your scales?" she asked. "You smell dessert-y!" Spike, realizing his pushing wasn't convincing Pinkie, flipped onto his belly and started to crawl away, grumbling to himself. However, his motions were stopped when Pinkie lowered herself, the front half of her body pinning down the majority of his. When she did that, Spike grit his teeth, clutched the ground, and tried to pull himself free.

"What the hay are you doin' Pinkie?!" he asked as he fruitlessly pulled himself. His question was partially answered when Pinkie buried her nose against the back of his head, and loudly sniffed his scent, which only caused the dragon to wriggle more. Things only got worse when he could swear he felt some saliva dribble onto his back. "P-Pinkie! Did you just-?!"

"I can't help myself~ You made yourself smell too good~" she practically moaned out. Spike tried to glare at Pinkie from over his shoulder, which was halted when he saw her lower her muzzle towards her neck. And then, suddenly, her tongue darted out, starting at the base of his neck, before she dragged it up the back of his head and behind his ear, the little dragon freezing up and his expression falling to a combination of shock and disgust. He couldn't believe she actually... "Mmm~ Even tastes good~" Her muzzle again lowered to his neck, and he felt her lips coil around a patch of it, suckling softly as her tongue kept lashing out at whatever bit of flesh was exposed to her. Spike blushed and his toes curled as he felt her almost intimate suckling on his sensitive neck, a nervous shiver running along the length of his spine.

"Pinkie... that feels really weird..." he said, practically pleading her to stop. With a pop, Pinkie's lips came off of Spike's neck, and she nuzzled against his cheek.

"I know it's not super TV-Y, but I can't help it! You're driving me crazy!" Pinkie squealed, one hoof wrapping around his front possessively. Her tongue lolled out again and she buried it against his cheek, and slowly dragged it up the side of his face, the dragon frozen with terror. He felt extraordinarily uncomfortable about this. He didn't know what Pinkie meant about his smell or his taste, but all he cared about was this weird tasting and suckling thing! If he felt this weird about this, he couldn't imagine how awkward it must look to everypony else!

Eventually...

Just after the defeat of King Sombra, a large feast was held inside of the palace of the crystal empire. All the crystal ponies were shimmering, showing of their name-giving crystal-like skin. At the head of the table was the dragon who brought them back their crystal heart, which repelled the dark unicorn who wanted to take over the empire yet again. Spike has become the most important hero of the empire on that fateful day. His friends were also celebrated for their help, Spike still remained the most important one of them though. Twilight Sparkle was sitting next to the old mayor of the empire, a red shining mare named Ruby. "It is really monumental that our empire was saved for good, by a dragon no less."

At this, Twilight had to stop for a moment. She knew dragons could be scary but there was something about Ruby's tone of voice that hinted at something more going on here. She decided to prod carefully, trying to find out more about this. Come to think of it, she noticed that sometimes the crystal ponies had flashed Spike an almost fearful look before he saved the crystal heart. "Say, what is so special about a dragon saving the empire? Dragons did work together with ponies in history... occasionally." Twilight then looked at her hooves, still sparkling with their new found crystal shine.

Ruby shifted nervously in her seat, looking nervously at Spike, who was still enjoying the party. She then returned her gaze to Twilight and went closer, whispering into the purple unicorns ear. "Well, maybe for regular ponies but the thing is very different with crystal ponies. You see.... we have coats, encrusted with crystal, dragons eat gems, you can pretty much guess how things were between the crystal empire and dragons." Ruby couldn't help but shudder a little at the thought. Twilight also became a little paler in the face.

Suddenly, a line of ponies came inside, a large, buff stallion, a petite mare with the body of a fashion model and a chubby looking mare. All of them looked around and immediately started to grin as they spotted Spike. They approached Spike and bowed down to him, making the small dragon feel a little awkward. "Oh great hero, we know we couldn't thank you enough for what you did for us so a small group of ponies gathered and we were the most fitting candidates to give you the treat of a lifetime as thanks for saving the entire empire." Said the buff stallion, looking at the small dragon with deep admiration.

Ruby meanwhile started to look very nervous and hissed into Twilights ear. "Are they going to propose what I think they will?"

The answer came as the buff stallion continued to speak. "Everything we own wouldn't be enough for saving us from that tyrant so we will offer even more. We know more than anypony else how much dragons love to eat gems, so we three offer ourselves to you, as a meal." The entire room went deadly silent as he said this, everyone stared in shock at the three crystal ponies. After a while though, Spike broke the silence with loud laughter. "Oh man, for one second you guys really got me, good one." He said between giggles, believing them to be joking.

The three ponies looked at him awkwardly, their grins disappearing. "We are not joking, we would have had to endure a lifetime of slavery if you hadn't returned the crystal heart. It is only fair that some of us give their life to show you their appreciation. Don't worry, we volunteered for this." Now Spike stopped to laugh, he knew they were serious. "You really want me to..." The three crystal ponies that offered themselves only nodded. Spike looked nervously around the room, thinking of what he should do. On one hand, those crystal ponies would die if he ate them, on the other hand, he did wonder what they taste like.

“Do you think it wise, Sister?” Celestia said.

Looked back to meet her sister's steady gaze. “Then there are the other ponies.”

“Twelve of them,” Celestia said. “A pegasus and unicorn to give Ms Pie and Applejack wings and magic; a unicorn and an earthpony to give Ms Dash and Ms Fluttershy magic and resilience; and an earthpony and pegasus for Rarity and my Twilight. Twelve of my little ponies, my loyal and beloved subjects who depend on me to protect them. They trust me, and I will betray them to their deaths.”

“More than their deaths, Celly,” Luna protested, “you must devour them whole, and digest them wholly.” Her moonstone greave shone as her hoof traced the long line of her throat, down her chest, pointing to her belly within. “Their flesh, their magic, their souls. You will break them down into a nutritious mush, which you will feed to the god-daughter forming in your womb. These are the things Alicorn are made of.”

Celestia's eyes were haunted by the ghosts of little ponies yet alive. “Yes,” she whispered.”

“Those twelve ponies will suffer unimaginably,” Luna pressed.

“Yes.”

“You will enjoy it.”

“Yes.” There was no point in denying it. Too well, Celestia remembered the feel of ponies squirming within her tum. It was not a pleasant memory, but it dampened her plot as it ever had. And Luna knew that foul ecstasy as well as she. That, of course, was the risk. It would be so, so easy for her to return to the exquisite pleasure of regularly devouring ponies. “I...” Celestia replied, eyes flickering across the throne room's scenes of legend, depicted in stained glass. The elements of harmony defeating Discord. The elements of harmony restoring Luna from Nightmare Moon. “Maybe there is another way...”

“It must be done.” Luna said.

Celestia's gaze slipped to her own golden greaves. “Yes,” she said, “and you will help me do it.”

These hybrid ponies could have foals who were true pegasi or unicorn, sure, but nothing that even came close to the true splendor of an Alicorn.

The legends that covered the birth of Celestia and Luna, while considered to be old mares tales, were pretty clear on one point - there was some ritual pony sacrifice involved. And although it was still far too early for there to be any noticeable effects, all six ponies were starting to feel uncomfortably warm. Worst of all, none of them had any idea what to do.

Except apparently, Pinkie Pie. "Wait! Idea!" Suddenly, her mane and tail poofed back out to their normal volume (in all the excitement, they had deflated without anyone noticing). She grabbed Celestia's horn with one of her front hooves. "Pinkie Pie, darling, what are you doing?" Rarity inquired nervously, noting party pony's somewhat manic expression while trying to clean herself off. "I am just about to be brilliant!" came the eager reply.

Pinkie trotted up to a confused looking Twilight Sparkle and, without any warning, repeated the maneuver she had performed on the princess, snapping Twilight's horn clean off at the base. Her friends recoiled in horror, except for Twilight, who seemed too shocked at the moment to move from her spot. "Pinkie pie, are you insane!?" She screamed. "I need my horn to-" "Shush! No talking!" Pinkie silenced Twilight by shoving her hoof in her educated friend's mouth. With a look of extreme concentration, she brought up Celestia's horn, and slammed into place where Twilight's had been.

Giving Twilight's new horn a few small taps to make sure it was firmly in place, Pinkie sat back and smiled brightly. "Perfect!" She fished a small piece of candy out of her mane. "Here, try levitating this. We need to make sure it worked." Twilight, too shocked by what had just happened to form any sort of verbal reply attempted to follow Pinkie's instructions. To everyone's surprise except Pinkie's, a golden aura enveloped the treat, which floated up into the air.

Rainbow Dash was the first to speak up. "What the HAY just happened?" Pinkie giggled as she snatched the piece of candy out off the air and popped it in her mouth. "Isn't it obvious silly? I swapped Twilight's horn with Celestia's! Phase one of my plan to save Equestria from burning like one Sweetie Belle's glasses of orange juice is a complete success!" Twilight stared at her old horn for a moment as it lay on the ground, completely inert, before snapping out of her stupor.

"Um that's nice Pinkie, but her horn alone isn't going to let me move the sun and moon. Yes, it makes me powerful enough to move them, but I don't have the energy to move them all year round while we think of another solution to this problem." "What in tarnation are you talking about Twi?" Applejack inquired. "I thought you unicorns got your magic from your horn." Twilight nodded. "That's true. But we need energy to convert into magic. Yes, my magic is much more powerful now, but my personal reserves of it are the same they've always been."

Fluttershy spoke up. "So, um, does this mean Pinkie's plan won't work?" Pinkie laughed. "Of course it will you guys! Switching Twilight's horn was just phase ONE! There's still way more work to do!" "Alright," Twilight said, "You seem to have a plan. What is it?" "It's simple!" Pinkie replied. "After we make it so that you can reliably raise the sun and the moon, our long term goal is to find a way to either preserve the elements of harmony without anyone getting eaten or anything like that, OR! to find a way to destroy discord, preferably also without anyone getting eaten. But first things first! Right now we need to get you the energy to do your new job consistently! All we have to do is..."
12112211212222.title: Somepony else has an idea

choices: "...We have more important things to worry about. Just leave her there for now."
"...Um, put her on the throne's cushion. She is still the princess after all."
121122112122222.content:
"All we have to do is put your head on Celestia's body!" Pinkie declared, as though doing so would be the easiest thing in the world. Her friends just stared at her as she pranced around the room in pride with her idea. Rarity was the first to break the silence. "Um, Pinkie dear? Quite apart from the fact that Twilight's purple head would look absolutely atrocious on Celestia's body, you do realize what you just suggested is impossible, don't you?"

"Nope!" Came the bubbly reply as Pinkie trotted back to Twilight. "Watch this!" Pinkie suddenly moved so quickly, her friends didn't have any time to see precisely what happened. As soon as they grasped what happened, they were very grateful for that.

Pinkie Pie had removed Twilight's head from her body, and was holding it in her fore-hooves. However, instead of dying, as would have been expected, Twilight was still very much alive. "Pinkie, how is this possible?!" She asked, as she flailed her headless body around in confusion. "No time to explain! Hold this!" She shoved Twilight's head into Fluttershy's hooves. The yellow pegasus barely had time to give a terrified "Eep!" Before Pinkie had removed Celestia's head and grabbed Twilight's back.

She quickly attached the very confused unicorn's head to the unconscious alicorn's body. Twilight staggered to her hooves, not used to Celestia's body size. "Wow Pinkie... I... Just wow..." As twilight sat down to examine her new body, Applejack, wearing a slightly nauseous expression, gestured to Celestia's disembodied hornless head, ethereal mane still flowing in a non-existent breeze. "Hate bother ya'll while yer still gettin' acquainted withe yer new, er, body, but what should we do with the princess sugarcube?"

Twilight thought for a moment. "Well...
121122112122222.title: "...Put your head on Celestia's body!"

1211221121222222.content:
"Um, just put her on the throne's cushion. She is still the princess after all." Twilight thought for a moment. "Although, I really don't see anypony taking the news that their princess has been reduced to a disembodied head very well."

In silence, Rarity enveloped the former alicorn's head in her magic, and levitated her over to her throne. Meanwhile, Applejack was staring at Twilight's former body, which had gone limp the instant Pinkie had attached her to Celestia's. "Applejack?" Inquired Rainbow Dash, "Why are you staring at Twilight's old body like that?" "Hmm? Oh, I was just thinkin'. Princess Luna is gonna be mighty upset when she wakes up. I, uh, figure it might be best if she wakes up like Celestia." The other ponies shuddered to think about how she'd react. Even if she didn't have her magic anymore, she could still fly, and she would still be enormously strong. And if Pinkie Pie was any indication, they couldn't be sure that Luna wouldn't just find a way to reattach it. "Good idea." Said Twilight. "Applejack, why don't you take Pinkie to Luna and bring her back here so we can work this out." With that done, AJ nodded and galloped out of the throne room, followed by a bouncing Pinkie Pie.

A few minutes later, they returned, Applejack dragging Luna's now headless body by her ethereal tail, and pinkie balancing Luna's hornless head on top of her own, while holding her horn in her mouth. After depositing the disassembled princess parts, everypony turned to Twilight. "What now Twi'?" asked Applejack. "Well, when Pinkie took my head off my body, I could still feel and control it until she attached me to Celestia's body. I think we'll have to attach somepony else's head to Luna's if we want to avoid her making too big of a scene. The only problem is, who should we use?"

Who do they pick?

My mane would completely blend in, and our coats would look hideous against one another," "Really Rarity?" sighed Applejack. "Your worried about that sort of frou-frou stuff at a time like this?" "Yes, well, some of us do have standards," sniffed the unicorn. "Besides, I'm not sure I'd really be the best choice for this sort of thing anyway."

Twilight nodded. "Well, if you say so Rarity. I guess that narrows it down to you four." She waved one of her new, regal hooves at Applejack, Pinkie Pie, Rainbow Dash, and Fluttershy. Which one ends up getting chosen to be attached to Luna's neck?

121122112122222221.content:
Well I can't do it!" Rainbow Dash declared. "I want get into the Wonderbolts, and it would take me forever to get used to Luna's body! Plus, they probably have a rule somewhere that says you can't join if you have the body of one of the Princesses."

Do they choose Applejack? Or Pinkie Pie?
121122112122222221.title: One of the earth ponies. Either Applejack or Pi...
