"Well don't look at me." Applejack said flatly. "I don't know diddly about magic or anything." "Ooh, ooh! What about me?" Asked Pinkie, while bouncing around the room. Everyone considered this for a moment. They all agreed that it was a horrible idea, including Pinkie.

This left just Rainbow Dash and Fluttershy.
121122112122222222.title: One of the pegasi. Either Rainbow Dash or Flutt...

1212.content:
"This is incredible." Twilight remarked as she browsed through a new spellbook.

"What's gotch'ya so gung-ho, sugar?" Applejack asked. All of Twilight's friends had joined her for a spot of lunch but, of course, she couldn't resist studying through the meal.

"This looks like a spell for interdimensional travel." Twilight answered.

"Inter-dimond... what now?" The farm pony sought clarification.

"Interdimensional." Twilight went into 'dictionary mode'. "Between dimensions, universes, or realities."

"So, what you are telling us, dear, is you've found a spell that allows ponies to explore other versions of Equestria."

"Not just other versions of Equestria, Rarity. This spell has the potential to let us explore worlds beyond our wildest dreams."

"Whoa!" Rainbow Dash interjected. "That'd be so awesome!"

"D'yer really think it'd be a good idea t' go explorin' some world where yer dunno how it'd compare to our own?" Applejack warned.

"I'll have to investigate a bit," Twilight replied, "But if there's a way to specify the kind of world you want to explore I feel confident in trying it out as soon as possible."

---

"It looks promising." Twilight stated once they were all gathered in the library. "It seems that you can limit the scope of the spell by focusing on a particular attribute you want to explore. So, if I focus on an alternative Equestria where Princess Celestia is still in charge and is still the cheerful Princess we all know and love it shouldn't go far wrong. Would any of you like to come with me? It could be lonely being a stranger in a strange land."

"I don't know," Fluttershy managed to make herself heard, "It all sounds a bit scary."
1212.title: Twilight's Travels

choices: Twilight stood there, but not their Twilight.
12121.content:
"I take it ya dunno if time'll pass for you as it would fer us." Applejack checked, Twilight slowly nodded. "Then Ah'd better not come, what with all the work t'be done."

"I wouldn't mind waiting for you to come back," Fluttershy just about spoke up, "But I still have all the little animals to look after and I daren't visit another reality until you can at least be sure that... it would be safe... and maybe quiet... for me?"

"Sorry to say this, Twilight," Pinkie Pie piped up, "But I couldn't go galavanting off with you on such an adventure at this time. There's so many things to do, but I might be able to throw you a going-away party. How many ponies should I invite? How many snacks should be provided? Would you like any presents to take with you? Do you...?"

"Pinkie!" Twilight cut her off. "It's okay. Just a small get together between all of us here is satisfactory and I've got a checklist of the things I should take with me."

"You know I'd love to go on an adventure with you, Twi." Rainbow Dash declared. "But I don't think I could take the time off and I don't wan'ta leave Ponyville hangin' and if the majority says they won't or can't go then neither will I. I just hope that the me you'll meet will be as reasonable, helpful and protective as I am."

"Sorry, darling." Rarity said, followed by a pause that told her to elaborate. "I've got to finish ten dresses by the end of the week."

"Fair enough. Spike, you'll watch the library while I'm gone, right."

"You can count on me!" He declared.

"Very well. I shall go on my own."

---

Pinkie kept Twilight's request and only brought a hamper for the seven attendees to tuck into. It was actually a fairly quiet affair as they stuggled to say their goodbyes and provide small reminders of her friends. Twilight checked her checklist no less that five times: torch, binoculours, spellbooks, history book, compass... It went on and on.

Eventually the time came. With one final goodbye Twilight stepped into a specially prepared chalk drawing on the floor and commenced to cast the spell; wind rushed around the library as the magic built up until, finally, there was a bright flash and...
12121.title: Solo Mission

choices: Would you like to become one of us and learn our ways?"
Can you help us prepare dinner?" *Celestia gives Luna a small wink*
121211.content:
As Twilight traveled to the other dimension, it felt like she was falling, and fast. She kept falling until she passed out. When she woke up, her head hurt a little. She got up and looked around. For a second, she didn't recognize where she was. Twilight rubbed her eyes and realized she was in Celestia's castle, or at least just outside of it. She flew up and looked around. It didn't look that different from her own home. She decided to go find the princess. She was excited to learn what this dimension had to offer. She walked around for a bit and already noticed a big difference from her Celestia's castle. There weren't any guards at all. Maybe they have the day off? she thought to herself. She went around a corner and bumped into something.
"Hey, who are you?" A familiar voice said. Twilight looked at what she bumped into to see that it was princess Celestia herself!
"Hi, my name is Twilight Sparkle." The purple alicorn responded.
"Well, it's nice to meet you, but might I ask why an alicorn such as you has come all the way to Equestria?" Celestia asked. Twilight smiled and told her about how she became an alicorn and how she was from a different dimension. She told her about what her home was like and different events that happened to it. Princess Celestia listened carefully and nodded as she spoke. She didn't seem to react much. Celestia then smiled. "Why don't you join me and my sister for dinner? It would be a shame for you to come all this way for nothing."
"Sure, that sounds great!" Twilight said and happily followed her. As they walked, Twilight still looked around to see no guards at all. "Where are all of the royal guards?"
"I don't need guards. Unlike your Celestia, I am strong enough to protect the castle by myself. Now, about your spell, I have heard of it, but I have never tried it myself. Seeing you though, and hearing about your land makes me want to try it as well." Twilight nodded. She though about where this dimension's Twilight was, but decided to ask later. They got to a dining hall with a pretty big table. "Stay here, while I get my sister. I just know she would like to meet you." Celestia left, while Twilight looked around the room.
"Too bad the others couldn't be here, this place is pretty interesting." After a few minutes, Celestia and Luna came in.
"I'm back Twilight, and I have a special question for you. . . .
121211.title: Invited to dinner with the princesses

121212.content:
"You're all here!" Twilight exclaimed as she looked upon them. "Did it work? Did I cross dimensions, or did I travel through time again?"

"Ah don't rightly know, Twilight." Applejack remarked. "What's the last thing yer remember?"

"I was in the library with you and Spike preparing to cast a spell for crossing dimensions."

"Wait! Me and Spike?!? Ah take that yer gone and switched places with our Twilight."

"Oh my." Twilight became ambivalent, one the one hoof she was ecstatic for having succeeded in crossing dimensions but on the other she felt guilty for the possibility of forcing an alternative Twilight to enter her universe.

"Don't fret so, dear." Said Rarity as she walked up beside her. "Our Twilight was attempting the exact same thing."

"Besides," Applejack butted in, "Even if you ain't quite the Twilight we all know we're still your friends, whichever version of yer it is."

"Well, thanks girls." Twilight replied. "So how did all of you make it to this session?"

"Duh." Pinkie announced. "We had some free time after lunch, so we agreed to provide Twilight with some support." Twilight seemed confused and amused.

"Why, darling, whatever is the matter?" Rarity asked.

"Only Applejack, Fluttershy and Spike could've made it to my session." She told them. "Fluttershy didn't make it since she was late coming back from Canterlot."

"I... I mean... your me... was in Canterlot?" Fluttershy checked.

"We were all in Canterlot a few days back." Rarity pointed out.

"But I didn't come back until today?"

"Well," Twilight recalled, "The Princess Celestia I know requested you, Pinkie, Rainbow Dash and Rarity to stay behind for a bit." Twilight seemed to be blushing.

"Oooh!" Rarity squealed. "Did she want us all to make another Marzipan Macarpone Meringue Madness for her?"

"Sorta. She was so looking forward to it and then Pinkie had to go and eat it all at once."

"Sounds like our own experience." Applejack interjected.

"How did the Princess react when you told her about the tasting on the train?" The three involved blushed.

"Quite amused, I'd say." Pinkie Pie put in. "Of course I did leave an open invitation for her to come down to Sugarcube Corner for another MMMM."

"Was that all?" Twilight asked.

"It was much too trivial a matter for her to commence disciplinary action." Rarity told her.

"Yes," Twilight recalled, "The Princess Celestia I know once told me that normal discipline didn't apply to particularly trivial cases, but she still got involved whenever she was around. She just can't resist, and what with the fact that there were four cake-filled ponies in her presence she just went and enjoyed every moment." Some of those present looked uneasy.

"What did she do?" Applejack ventured to ask.

"Pinkie Pie, Rarity, Rainbow Dash, Fluttershy. In that order, she..." Twilight paused, wondering how they'll take it. "Are you ready for this?" They were all clearly braced, fearing what their Twilight had got herself into. "She swallowed them all."
121212.title: Twilight Two

choices: "She usually erases their memory of the whole event."
"Not everypony goes back to their normal life afterwards."
1212121.content:
"Y...Y...Your Princess Celestia," Rarity almost screeched, "Eats PONIES?!?"

"I thought Twilight was aiming for a safe universe to test." Rainbow Dash attested.

"We both were, I suppose." The new Twilight commenced to reassure them. "And it's not as bad as it seems. My Princess Celestia takes up any excuse to swallow somepony but they never come to any harm. After all she is in the form of a pony and ponies are herbivores ergo they can't digest meat easily. Remember those baked bads?" Applejack looked at her hooves. "They made everypony sick because their digestive systems couldn't cope with the chewed remains of earthworms. Furthermore because of her nature as a Princess she can manipulate her own physiology so her stomach behaves more like a combination of cave and womb. In fact she seems to have created some kind of pocket-space inside her seeing as how she never gets chubby no matter what or who she eats."

"Twilight," Applejack ventured to ask, "How many of us have actually been in Celestia?"

"So far, only you haven't. Of course the Grand Galloping Gala will occur in a month or so and the Princess did confide in us that it'd be held inside her stomach. Truth be told not that many ponies are fully aware of her taste for them. She wanted to extend the introduction part of the Gala so the other ponies wouldn't flee in panic from seeing her eating somepony."

"So, you and the other usses," Applejack deduced, "Have the Princess swallow other ponies? Who else knows?"

"Princess Luna." Twilight answered. "She indulges in ponies, too, although she prefers to save it for special occasions. I think some of the guards and servants are aware of the fact. Otherwise I can't think of anyone else unless you don't count Spike when you mentioned 'us', Applejack."

"But if she eats so many," Applejack replied, "How can there only be a small number who know?"

"Well," Twilight thought back...
1212121.title: Reminiscing

choices: Switch to Twilight in the other universe
The New Twilight answers more questions
12121212.content:
Noticing this didn't do much to reassure them Twilight explained.

"Princess Celestia loves looking after and playing with pets and some of the ponies she eats tend to develop an intense loyalty to her when they discover that she's just holding them inside her; the result is that some almost immediately sign up to be servants of the Royal Palace and others are shrunk and kept as pets." Each of them began to envisage what this would be like.

Applejack thought of the familiar face of Princess Celestia suddenly contorting and engulfing her, the image of the uvula zooming towards her made her shudder in an unusual way.

Fluttershy thought of what it would mean to be a pet for the Princess. Shrunk down possibly to the size of her own hoof and nearly always viewing opulent chambers through the bars of a cage. Her mind went back to when she first met Philomena and wondered if the Princess this Twilight knew actually put her other self in that very situation for a time.

Rainbow Dash wondered if the pledge of servitude extended to being a member of Celestia's Royal Guard, imagining herself in the gold-plated armour standing outside the Princess's bedchamber with a multitude of perks in exchange for occasionally feeding the Princess directly. She grinned as she considered it a small price to pay.

Pinkie Pie looked at every single prospect at once, smirking as she wondered what it felt like to be swallowed whole, almost gasping as she imagined Princess Celestia as her giant owner and finally shrugging at the thought of becoming a parlour maid for the Palace.

Rarity ate up the thought of being the Princess's chamber maid (no pun intended). Imagining herself delivering linen and possibly a light bite for the Princess's supper, not batting an eyelid at the idea of following it inside her if she were not satisfied with the quantity.

In spite of their own rather rose-tinted imaginings they were still unsure of how Twilight was going to cope with being in that sort of reality.

When it was confirmed she asked about the other ponies and was informed that Fluttershy had just returned from Canterlot where the other three were. Twilight was intrigued as to why they would be up there at this time but, due to how she had cast the spell, assumed that they had acquired some significant political influence.

Twilight then asked about some recent events. Due to her way of asking them Applejack made a simple summary, which didn't really differentiate from her own timeline. She wondered as to what more could be different in this universe besides the apparent authority that her friends appeared to have acquired.

Twilight wanted to find out more pretty quickly. What is her first action?

"Your Celestia wants to meet with me in Canterlot as soon as possible! She wants to discuss our histories and compare notes on the nature of parallel universes! With me!" In her excitement, Twilight failed to realize how much she was intruding on Applejack's space. "Er, that sounds real nice, Twi. Y'all-"

"Oh this is perfect! I'm already packed! I'mofftothetrainstationbyeApplejackbyeSpike!"

And with that, the unicorn left her alternate-universe friends in the dust.

"Applejack?"
"Yeah?"
"Do you think all Twilights are that crazy over their Celestias?"
"Prob'ly. How long do you think this Twi will last b'fore she becomes her main course?"
"Knowing the princess? Two. Maybe three minutes."
"Hmm."

------

Aside from an attempt to magically hasten the train, the trip went without incident. Twilight happily trotted through town, trying to find as many subtle changes as possible. She was enjoying herself so much that she nearly walked into a guard that approached her. "Miss Twilight Sparkle."

With a flinch, Twilight came to an abrupt halt. "Yes? Is something the matter?" The guard remained as neutral as the ones she knew back home. "The castle staff has been informed of your predicament, and have been instructed to treat you like our own Twilight." His eyes suddenly narrowed. "However, we will be watching for any suspicious behavior. You may pass now."

Twilight reached the awkward realization that she had almost blindly wandered through the castle gates, forgetting that she was more or less a stranger to this place. "I promise you, you won't have any trouble from me!" Entering the castle proper, Twilight couldn't help but fret over that last conversation. I didn't sound suspicious just then, did I? Does the princess trust me? Am I about to be captured? Interrogated? No, calm down Twilight. There's Rainbow Dash, just talk to her, and everything will be fine. Just fine.

"Hello, Rainbow Dash."
12121212121.title: To Canterlot! Er, Other Canterlot!

choices: Twilight does so, and they start talking
Twilight feels something small and furry brush against her leg
121212121211.content:
"Hey there, New Twilight. Lemmie introduce myself. I am the one - the only -" No she isn't, Twilight internally mused. With a dramatic pause, the pegasus did a double loop, stopped with a pose, and shouted,

"Rainbow Dash!"

Her one-mare audience chuckled. "And I am Twilight Sparkle. Do you greet everypony like that?" Rainbow landed and gave a sheepish grin. "Well, my first meeting with our Twilight didn't go so well, so I wanted to do it right this time!" The unicorn rolled her eyes. "Let me guess, it involved a mud puddle and a... 'Rain-Blow Dry'?" The awkward chuckle she got was answer enough.

"So, Rainbow, what do you do here?"

"Huh?" Dash took a moment to process the question. "Oh, I'm just visiting. Rarity, Pinkie and I were planning on going home tomorrow." Twilight raised an eyebrow. "Really? Applejack made it sound like you and the others lived here."

Rainbow simply shrugged. "You must have misheard or something. How're AJ and Fluttershy doing, anyway?"

"Well, Applejack was there to send off your Twilight and greet me. I didn't see Fluttershy, though."

"Huh. I coulda sworn she said she was going back home yesterday. Course, I lost track of everypony pretty quickly. Rarity was all 'business dresses business' and Pinkie went off to do, uh, Pinkie stuff I guess." Rainbow shrugged. "You must have just missed her or something."

"Well, if you don't live here," Twilight said, "What are you doing here?" Rainbow shuffled uncomfortably for a bit. "Uh, did your world have an incident with a baking competition and a half-eaten cake?" Twilight slowly nodded. "And it was all because Rarity, Fluttershy and I were jerks, and then Pinkie went and ruined the competition anyway?"

"You know, that did happen in my dimension. How curious. And you decided to stay after?"

"Well... not really. Celestia heard the whole story and decided to give us one of her... 'punishments', ya know?"

Twilight cringed a little at the thought of a short-tempered Celestia. "...I'm afraid I don't know. What..." She had a bad feeling about this question. "...What punishment?"

Rainbow glanced off to her sides. Satisfied nopony was listening, she merely whispered "You know," and subtly stroked her throat a little. An awkward silence followed as Twilight awaited further explanation. None came. Instead, the pegasus slowly began to giggle.

"You mean... you don't... yours doesn't..." Dash looked as if she were on the brink of tears as she held back her laughter. "Y-you know, you should just go see her now. Really. Go. You wouldn't want to keep her waiting past dinner." And just like that, Rainbow was left rolling on the floor in laughter as Twilight slowly backed away, confused and slightly frightened.

------

Twilight stood trembling at the door. The message was simple, but nervewracking. 'Her Highness is waiting for you in her private chambers.' This was it. The moment of truth. She knew that this dimension's Celestia had to be like the sweet, motherly ruler she knew, but Rainbow had left her second-guessing this assumption. Did the spell not work? Is this just a misunderstanding? Only one way to find out, I suppose. Slowly, she opened the door.

"Welcome, my dearest student," said that familiar, soothing voice.

Okay. Good. This is good, Twilight thought as she stepped inside, She's calm, she's referring to me as her student, it's okay. Everything's going to be okay. Right? Right.

"Come in. You've had quite the journey, I hear."

Twilight barely noticed as the princess used her magic to close the doors and set aside the young mare's saddlebags. Instead, she was focused on the sight before her. The lighting was as dim as the dusk outside, with the brightest light coming from a warm fireplace. Celestia sat before it, lounging on some cushions placed on the floor. The ceiling was dome-shaped, and was painted like a starry night sky. To the side, she could see a massive, opulent four-poster bed alongside a vanity dresser. The princess looked over her shoulder, and silently encouraged Twilight to join her by the fire.
121212121211.title: Second First Impression

choices: What kind of punishments she met out to her friends.
Why she had a canister of whipped cream nearby.
1212121212111.content:
For a while Princess Celestia asked Twilight about incidents that she could recall and received confirmation about their occurrence in Twilight's home universe before she asked.

"In the case of the incidents regarding the parasprites, the Running of the Leaves, Philomena, the Grand Galloping Gala, your Smarty Pants doll, time travel and the National Dessert Competition?" Twilight felt most embarrassed by it all.

"Yes?" She hesitated to speak of them.

"What did I do about the... mistakes you and your friends made?" Twilight paused before answering, the result being that Celestia raised an eyebrow.

"And what sort of food do I like?"

"Well," Twilight struggled to find courage, "There are rumours about your love for cake and you do drink tea a lot."

"The differences between our realities are not particularly prominent then. Except..." Twilight glanced at the Princess, suddenly finding herself wondering...
1212121212111.title: Testing the Ground

12121212121111.content:
The princess hesitated for a moment. Twilight seemed to be getting increasingly nervous, and if not handled delicately, this new information might send her into a panic. "...I just want to be perfectly clear. These 'punishments'... are not truly punishments. It's more like a little game we play, to assure you all that even when you make mistakes, I still love you all very much." Celestia couldn't help but smile as the smaller mare looked visibly relieved. Still, she had yet to say...

"What exactly do you do?"

Celestia shifted herself closer to Twilight, gently extending a wing over the sweet little unicorn. "Perhaps I should begin with my first meeting with our own Twilight. At first, the events of the day went as you had described them; The entrance exam, the dragon egg, the rainboom... Like you, the poor filly lost control of her powers." Replaying the events in her mind, Twilight unconsciously leaned into her alternate mentor. "You... she was overwhelming everyone in the room with her magic when I arrived. The energy needed to be contained, but I couldn't risk a sealing spell or moving her to another part of the castle. I'm sure you know the dangers of magical flares." Twilight nodded. "I did something that may come as a shock to you. I needed to protect both her and the bystanders while the flare ran its course, so I did something drastic. I swallowed her whole."

Twilight's thoughts came to a complete halt."You... what?"

Trying to speak with a reassuring tone, Celestia continued. "It was something I occasionally did as a sign of closeness or as a test of trust, but never with any malicious intent. In fact, before that day, I had never done it under such extreme circumstances. My body took the full force of the flare, preventing any further harm to the others. Before long, the little filly exhausted her powers and fell asleep. Ever since, she has told me that no place in the world feels safer than my belly. That feeling of closeness and trust... That is what I love to share with you and your friends."

Twilight was deathly still and silent for a few long moments. The crackling of the fire was the only sound in the room until Twilight...
12121212121111.title: Celestia's Explanation

choices: She wants to know if Rarity and Pinkie Pie are inside the Princess.
She can only be sure if she goes ahead with the experience.
121212121211111.content:
"Are you saying that it's like being back in the womb?" Twilight asked as she tried to wrap her head round this.

"In a manner of speaking." Celestia replied. "Of course the surge of magic from that time has increased my appetite for ponies, so I've come to show a lot more intimate affection to my subjects." She licked her lips in reminiscence. Twilight gulped nervously.

"So, does this mean...?"

"Why do you think I got the whipped cream out?" Celestia pointed out, floating the canister over. Twilight stared between it and the hungry goddess.

"Wait. It all makes sense now." Twilight declared. "Rainbow Dash did say not to keep you waiting past dinner and she... Uh, how often have you eaten my friends... and I?"

"It so happens that you've been in my stomach more times than anypony in all of Equestria's history." Celestia replied. "I suppose that's why I've taken to mixing in some other ingredients; when somepony's flavour becomes familiar to me I like to experiment to find what compliments them better. As to your friends Applejack looks like a most appetising pony but I've yet to find a good time to indulge in her, but Rainbow Dash has been in my belly three times so far and Rarity's only gone down twice now. Fluttershy's quite a delicacy and I've managed to eat her five times now but Pinkie Pie's almost made for my dining table." She gave her prospective meal a wink. "I must've stuffed her down my throat eleven times by now. Rainbow Dash has a rather spicy tone to her, Fluttershy's like potato salad in a way but with her own flowery taste, Pinkie Pie's essentially a walking sponge pudding and Rarity's got this sweet canape-esque flavour. As for you, my delectable student," She rested a hoof on Twilight's shoulder, "You're more along the lines of a club sandwich stacked full of flowers and smothered in mozzarella." Twilight still felt somewhat anxious knowing that she was gonna be gobbled up by her own beloved Princess but the casual nature of it all helped to dampen her fear.

"If I have a cheesy flavour," Twilight asked, "Why do you want to put whipped cream on me?"

"Pony flavours aren't so easy to pin down." Celestia explained. "I remember once I ate your maths teacher when she came to me fussing over your style; she first tasted like banana cake. A few months later she came back with a request to leave her role as a maths teacher and become one of the palace staff, so I obliged after a thorough discussion and ate her again to indicate that anypony in my service is more likely to be my food than those who aren't so intrinsically linked. That time round I had a pot of tea on standby to wash her down, but she tasted of strawberry jam and clotted cream that time round. You can't be sure what you'll taste of each time I eat you." Twilight thought this over and came to a conclusion.
121212121211111.title: Curiosity gets the Unicorn Devoured

1212121212111111.content:
"If everypony involved in the whole cake-munching incident had to be so-called 'punished', then..." Twilight's eyes bugged out with a realisation. "So Fluttershy and Rainbow Dash have only recently been in your belly?" Celestia nodded in spite of the rather ravenous look on her face. "And Rarity and Pinkie Pie...?"

"They're still inside." Celestia confirmed, patting the side of her stomach. Twilight felt nervous and embarrassed as she expected their conversation would've been overheard by the two mares.

"H...How do you get ponies out of your stomach?" Twilight asked as the whipped cream floated off to the side where a few more items were waiting.

"Teleportation." Celestia answered and then seemed to be muttering to herself before her horn glowed and, in a flash, Rarity appeared in the room.

"Oh, Twilight." She greeted. "You're in for the time of your life. Nopony can say they've got it made until they've had the honour of being Princess Celestia's food." She bowed to her former digs.

"Ah, Rarity." Celestia greeted her. "The walking buffet. Now that you've had time to reflect on your little misdemeanour, would you be so kind as to help me prepare my next meal?" Twilight swallowed, knowing she didn't have any chance of escaping.

"I shall make her into whatever dish your majesty requests." Rarity replied.

"Princess," Twilight asked, "Has anypony ever tried to run away from this?"

"A few times." She answered. "Someponies react rather badly when they learn about this. Truth is I sometimes wish my tasty ponies would try and flee, the hunt can make them taste all the sweeter." She licked her lips nostalgically. "However, if you try it at this time, Twilight, I'm gonna make a burrito of you."

"And if I don't run?" Twilight asked, wondering what difference there could be.

"I've got whipped cream, chocolate sauce and some dinky marshmallows." Celestia pointed out. "I'm in the mood for a Twilight sundae." She took a step towards her prospective prey, salivating so much that her lips began to fluoresce.
1212121212111111.title: Meet the Meat

12121212121111111.content:
As the hungry princess stepped forward, Twilight took a step back.

"If you want to eat me, you'll have to catch me first." Twilight said and ran away. Princess Celestia smiled and flew after her. Rarity just stood where she was, having no idea what to do. Twilight ran through the palace halls, knowing that Celestia was on her tail. Twilight didn't want to end up in her stomach. Twilight didn't want to make it easy at least. She could see the exit and started to head towards it when something landed on her. She squirmed but couldn't get free.

"Nice try, but you're not getting away that easily." A familiar voice said. She looked up to see . . .
12121212121111111.title: A chase through the palace halls

choices: "Can I get my friends to experience this?"
121212121211111111.content:
Celestia was putting pressure on one foot. Twilight couldn't do anything but struggle. Celestia leaned in close and whispered in her ear.

"You'll soon be in my stomach, my faithful and tasty student." Celestia said, giggling. Celestia then casted a spell on Twilight, making her pass out. When she woke up, she had trouble moving. She looked behind her to see that her wings were tied up with her front hooves. Her back hooves were also tied up tightly. She tried to look around. It looked like she was still in the palace, but something was very different. Everything was huge! Suddenly, she could hear a door open and a familiar voice started to speak. "Did you enjoy your nap? I hope you did because it's almost time for lunch." Celestia stepped in front of Twilight, licking her lips.

"Why are you so big? Are you really going to eat me?" Twilight asked. Celestia nodded and gave her a small lick.

"Very tasty, like a basket of strawberries, but yes. I will eat you, that's why I shrunk you, so you could be inside of my burrito without being harmed." Celestia turned Twilight around. Twilight saw that Celestia had the ingredients for making a burrito. The tiny alicorn was forced to watch Celestia make her future edible prison. It was a simple burrito, it was some cheese, lettuce and beans on a tortilla. Celestia then lifted Twilight up with her magic and set her right in the middle. "Don't worry, you'll have company." Twilight was confused until she saw a shrunken Fluttershy emerge from the princess's hair. She willingly flapped over to Twilight and laid next to her

"Fluttershy? What are you doing? Aren't you afraid?" Twilight asked, feeling her friend's soft fur.

"Oh no, of course not. She has eaten me five times so I'm used to it. In fact I asked for this, I wanted you to feel more comfortable." Fluttershy said, giving a big smile.

"If you want me to feel comfortable, then why am I tied up?"

"Well we can't have you escaping. After all, you did run from princess Celestia." As Celestia listened to her two living meals, she started to wrap her food up. It was loose enough that the ponies had a little wiggling room, but tight enough to the point where they couldn't escape. She then wrapped the two ends up, closing their escape. She was very happy with her work, knowing that two cute and delicious ponies were inside, ready to be devoured at her command. Meanwhile, Twilight had calmed down. Though she couldn't see anything, Fluttershy was with her, so she was ready. The whole place started to rumble as Celestia picked them up. She chomped away at the burrito with no mercy. After the third bite, Twilight and Fluttershy could see Celestia's open maw. "Are you ready Twilight? You are about to be devoured by Celestia herself." Fluttershy said. Twilight nodded in response to her question. As they entered the giant mouth, Celestia's teeth came down, separating them from the rest of the burrito. As soon as they landed on the tongue, Celestia could feel them. She made sure to be extra careful. Celestia swirled them around, tasting and massaging them with her tongue. She hoped her visitor from the other universe was having fun. Luckily for her, even though she was tied up, Twilight was having a lot of fun.

"This is really exciting!" Twilight said and laughed. Fluttershy nodded and hugged Twilight. As Celestia started to tilt back, Fluttershy pointed to the back of her throat.

"Here comes the next part, it'll comfortable, I promise." Celestia swallowed them, giving a small burp. For Twilight, it felt a little weird, feeling the chewed up pieces of salad and cheese, but Fluttershy wasn't lying. It felt soft and nice. They landed in the princess's stomach acids. To Fluttershy, it felt like a nice hot tub. After a few minutes, Celestia finished her burrito and teleported the two ponies out, like she promised. They landed on the table, still shrunken.

"So my faithful student, how did you enjoy the ride?" Celestia asked, winking at the two.

"It felt so awesome! It was like an amazing but calm ride. It felt really nice being safe inside you!" Twilight said excitedly, as Fluttershy untied her. Twilight then looked up at Celestia.
121212121211111111.title: Pony filled burrito

12121212121111112.content:
"In light of how Rarity seems to laid-back among a few other indicators," Twilight mused out loud, "I'll try to endure your hunger, Princess."

"So good of you, my little dessert." Celestia teased. "Now Rarity, where shall we start?" She paced round her prospective prey, her mouth almost dripping with saliva. Rarity strolled up and looked Twilight over with a discerning eye.

"Hmm, I think if we put whipped cream on her head like you'd normally wrap a towel while coating her torso with chocolate fudge we can extrapolate from there." Twilight was stunned by Rarity's tone of voice, considering that she was helping the Princess make her into something edible.

"Chocolate fudge?" Celestia checked. "Of course! Why didn't I think of that?" A bell rang and a maid poked her head round the door. "Could you get some chocolate fudge, please?"

"At once, your majesty." The maid replied with a hint of nervousness before closing the door a bit fast. Rarity looked between the door and Celestia.

"She's only been inside me once." Celestia explained. "She still thinks I'd eat her and digest her for minor insurrections." Twilight swallowed nervously.

"And you never digested anypony, right?" She checked.

"Of course not. I try to avoid capital punishment wherever possible. Now, anywhere else for the whipped cream?"

"Perhaps a cream beard?" Rarity suggested. "And perhaps outlining her cutie mark in the stuff." Celestia licked her lips while keeping her eyes on Twilight.

"Mmm, sounds absolutely wonderful." Twilight blushed from a whole multitude of feelings as she heard Celestia say this. There was a knock on the door.
12121212121111112.title: The Missing Ingredient

121212121211111121.content:
"Your chocolate fudge, princess." The maid announced, biting her lip with anxiety as to who was gonna wear it. Princess Celestia floated it out of her hooves and said.

"Thank you, my little pony." And gestured with a hoof to indicate that she could depart. "Perhaps I should eat her again soon, anyway. At least she should calm down when it becomes clear that she's not gonna die in my digestive system." With that a butter knife floated off the tray bearing all the other confections and the tub of chocolate fudge opened in mid-air. "Rarity, would you be so good as to put on Twilight's cream wig?"

"Of course, princess." Rarity answered with a bow. At that point Twilight felt the first layer of chocolate fudge being spread up one of her forelegs, causing her to shudder both from the cold and the implications.

"They are rather prompt with these requests." Celestia remarked in response to Twilight's shudder. As she spread the chocolate fudge over one of Twilight's legs Rarity floated the whipped cream right over Twilight's head; Twilight soon knew the minutes were ticking away as she felt the foam-esque sensation of the cream on her scalp.

"Princess," Twilight asked, "Wouldn't I be a bit rich with all this chocolate and cream?" At this Celestia giggled.

"Why, Twilight, I once ate ten ponies dripping in honey and jam for breakfast, and I had three griffons smothered in camembert on the side. I think I can manage a chocolate fudge unicorn sundae." Celestia once again licked her chops in anticipation.

"Ten whole ponies?!?" Twilight cried more in astonishment that terror, to which Celestia nodded.

"It was a biology study session for you and some of the other students; one of the griffons was your biology teacher."

"Not," Twilight gasped as she thought back to her school years, "Monsieur Pancras?"

"The very same." Celestia held a hoof to her mouth as she salivated at the memory. "Such avian goodness, quite possibly bacon and eggs with feathers." By now all of Twilight's legs were smothered in chocolate fudge.

"Um, what about the other two griffons?" Rarity asked as she waited for further instructions on how to decorate Twilight.

"His wife and the Griffanese ambassador." Celestia replied. "The former was his personal request and the latter was a demonstration of where I put POWs whenever war broke out. It's particularly brilliant since they know I could program enzymes to dissolve my prey any time I want." Twilight looked really frantic now, fearing that the indulgence would cause Celestia to lose control and begin digestion on those she didn't intend to. "Relax Twilight, I've been eating ponies for over five thousand years so I know how far I can go." She now used the spreading in the fashion of stroking. "Rarity, could you do an outline of Twilight's cutie mark? I'd like to keep it exposed."

"Of course, princess." Now Twilight felt the combination of the precision spraying of whipped cream on her flank and the spreading come stroking with a butter knife covered in chocolate fudge on her back; she was now coming to terms with the fact that her beloved mentor was looking at her as food.

"Who's a scrummy pony, then?" Celestia giggled as she finished spreading chocolate fudge all over Twilight while Rarity gave her a beard made of whipped cream. The only purple bits left were her tail and possibly her cutie mark, even her horn was covered in cream.

"If I may, princess?" Rarity chanced. "I think some sprinkles on the back of her neck and a couple of wafers to make it look like she had stubby wings would finish off your sundae."

"What a wonderful idea." Celestia beamed with gastronomic joy. "If you could do the wafers I'll add the sprinkles."

This is it. Twilight thought with uncertainty and anticipation. She's sure to eat me within the minute. She felt a strange solid sensation on her back as Rarity stuck the wafers on and then a slight tickle went down her spine as the sprinkles rained down on the mixture of chocolate and cream. "Princess, won't the carpet get all messy?"

"Think nothing of it, my succulent student. I'll lap up as much as possible and the cleaners will take care of the rest."

"You surprise me, princess." Rarity remarked. "Have you never tried to eat somepony elegantly?"

"I do, now and again," Celestia replied in a tone that suggested that any more wise-cracks about etiquette and elegance and Rarity'd be back on the menu, "But it's much more satisfying to let yourself go with the kinds of meals you have to swallow whole." She smacked her chops with gusto; Twilight knew for sure that the time was upon her with the ravenous way Celestia was looking at her. "Only one last thing, Twilight. Shall I swallow you tail first or head first?"
121212121211111121.title: Chocolate Twilight Sundae

choices: Twilight's tired of Celestia's teasing and tries to get this over with.
1212121212111111212.content:
Twilight took quite a while to decide, primarily due to the fact that she was being given a choice in terms of how she would be consumed. On the one hoof going in head first would provide the opportunity to study Celestia's insides with a clarity she never thought possible before; on the other hoof, going in tail first would allow her a few last words for both Celestia and Rarity as she went down. Eventually Twilight managed to squeeze a reply out.

"Tail first, I guess. Maybe I could offer some insight into the sensation of being dragged down your throat, Princess?" She was clearly shaking her knees and elbows as she thought about what was coming. Celestia's look of ravenous predation became tempered with one of reassurance.

"Would I ever meet a version of you who wouldn't be so studious?" She remarked as she promptly levitated Twilight into the air, causing her snack to yelp. Twilight felt herself being swung round and round as Celestia began her indulgence.

"Why, Princess," Rarity commented, "I really didn't think you could be such a connoisseur with ponies." Twilight managed to give her a glance of bewilderment. "I have heard that the first bite is with the eye, but you seem to be regarding her more along the lines of a fine wine."

"In a way ponies are like wines." Celestia replied. "Every one has their own signature taste. I suppose it's like your cutie mark, it's all part of what makes you special." Twilight's discomfort with her situation ebbed a bit at this as she thought about this comparison. "Of course, the second important thing about wine-tasting is...?" Twilight found she was no longer being swung about but was now orientated with her back to the floor and her hind legs pointing to Celestia's muzzle. So, now's the time. She mused. I really am Princess Celestia's food.

"Aroma." Rarity answered Celestia's question. Whereupon Celestia began to take deep breaths through her nose, slowly rolling Twilight round again to take in the scent of every part of her unicorn sundae.

"Quite right." Once she was done Celestia gave one last lick of her chops that was rather uncharacteristic where Rarity was concerned regarding how loudly she did so. "And now we get to the flavour itself." Twilight looked down her barrel at this, expecting Celestia's tongue to come reaching out to its latest guest, instead Celestia had one last thing to say before her mouth would be otherwise engaged. "Any questions before you go in?"
1212121212111111212.title: The First Bite is with the Eye

choices: She felt something else grab her hind legs.
Twilight felt a disturbing warmth in her lower body.
One golden hoof began to push her in.
12121212121111112122.content:
"N...Not really, Princess." Twilight felt uncomfortable as she said this, knowing it would mean immediate consumption. But Celestia's expression of eager hunger was now mixed with a warm motherly tone as she gave her just a few more words.

"Very well, my delectable student. It's time for tea." At this Celestia's mouth opened up with comparatively little sound, however there was a happy groan emanating from her throat as her tongue emerged, almost like Twilight was receiving the red carpet treatment just after a torrential downpour. She couldn't help but tense up as she found herself moving closer to the waiting maw, her tail now most certainly the nearest part of her to Celestia's mouth. Twilight decided she should make the most of her last moments outside of Celestia.

"Rarity, how was it for you when you last went in?" The mare in question seemed taken aback by this and didn't answer until Twilight felt a sharp but not unpleasant tug on her dock as Celestia's tongue wrapped round her tail and pulled her in with more vigour than she anticipated.

"It's rather like a trip to the spa." Rarity replied. "The muscles in her oesophagus caress you as though you're receiving a massage to every part of your body. Her tongue probes every nook and cranny, releasing the tension wherever it reaches. And then there's the soothing warmth and humidity in her stomach that's somewhere between a sauna and a bath. Why, for an act that's almost eccentric it's simply divine, albeit typically inconvenient." Once she'd finished Twilight felt Celestia's lips close around her hind hooves, the tongue have released her tail and now slurping the chocolate fudge of her legs as they were pulled in. For all the instinctive fear she felt Twilight had to agree that Princess Celestia's tongue really drew out the tension in her muscles, but figured it just made ponies easier to swallow. "So, does the Celestia you know enjoy the occasional pony?" Twilight gave Rarity a glance, expecting it to be the last for the day and answered.

"I've never known the Princess to ever look upon someone as though they were food." Just then she noticed her hind hooves were brushing against something else inside Celestia but before she realised they were in contact with the tonsils the first gulp occurred, drawing her in right up to the knees. At this stage Celestia's levitation spell slackened off and her head rose as a passionate yummy sound rang round those same hooves. "Have you ever known the Princess refusing to eat someone?"

"Only Princess Luna as far as I'm aware." Rarity replied. Celestia neglected to say anything on account of her mouth full of unicorn and not wishing to upset Twilight's journey by nodding or shaking her head. One more gulp and Twilight's rump found itself resting against the lower lip, her legs firmly sealed behind them.

"Well, I guess this is goodbye." Twilight mentioned to Rarity, having little else to say at this time.

"Oh, it's not goodbye." She answered. "It's only au revior." Rarity's smile coupled with the sensations of the gullet's muscles fixing her hooves in place and the tongue doing everything it could to caress and taste her legs gave Twilight the reassurance that where she was going would not be the last place she'd ever see. She gave Celestia a smile that spoke of regret for doubting her and of serenity in her situation. Despite the look of acceptance in return it seemed that Celestia's hunger hadn't dimmed in the slightest as she gave another gulp, dragging in Twilight's rear to the point that the whipped cream surrounding her cutie mark started to get smudged on her muzzle. Twilight just managed to get a look at the throat but couldn't believe how little her legs showed in light of her comparative size. Indeed Celestia was still wearing her regalia, which made Twilight worry more about the discomfort of having a large pony going past than about the fact that she was going down there. Another gulp and her cutie mark was no longer visible, her dock now sat in the pharynx and her hind hooves were now firmly within Celestia's body. One more gulp and a much firmer grip came upon her hind hooves as they finally entered the stomach. As Celestia's tongue continually caressed her abdomen...

121231.content:
After so long, it had come to this. After freeing Equestria from the Iron-Fisted rule of Discord, after halting the Griffon Kingdom's global conquest, even after establishing a tenuous ceasefire with the Dragons of the Western Badlands, Celestia thought that she and Luna had vanquished the mightiest foes that would ever stand before her. How wrong she was. Never in all her wildest dreams, her most outlandish imaginings...her darkest nightmares...had she ever thought that her beloved sister, the princes Luna, would betray her.

It wasn't Luna's fault. Celestia had kept that fact well in mind as she battled desperately against the twisted perversion her sister had become. It's not her fault, not entirely. *I'm as much to blame for this as she is! Why didn't I do more to prepare her for the burden of ruling? Why didn't I warn her that moving the heavens is all to often a thankless task?!* Celestia's shame fueled a charge of white-hot energy in her horn, which she loosed at the ebony demon in front of her, trying with all her might to just get in one good hit, that might stun her opponent. Then, maybe she could reason with Luna - or whatever she had become. Then she might restore peace in her lands once more.

*It's possible she's still Luna - still in there somewhere! Please let it be possible...* Another bolt of energy shot from Celestia's horn like a howitzer. *Please...?*

For her part, Nightmare Moon - The name that this evil simulacrum of Luna had taken for herself - was more than a match for the daytime ruler before her. Any attempt by the princess to damage her met with utter futility; bolts of light meant to connect with the would-be usurper connected with fog; Celestia conjured magical locks and chains to ensnare her, and Nightmare Moon conjured the keys to those locks; Celestia used telekinesis to hurl large objects, Nightmare Moon breathed out a miasma so thick and corrosive that those objects disintegrated completely. What Celestia would call a battle for the ages, Nightmare Moon called child's play.

"You are weak, Celestia! I should have rebelled against you eons ago!" Nightmare Moon bellowed, shaking the battlefield with an imperious authority. "You and your pathetic day are not fit for this country - not fit for my country!"

Struggling to her hooves, a tear formed in Celestia's eye. *This wasn't supposed to happen! This, this thing can't be my sister! I used to feel such a rich harmony between us and-*


Of course! That was the answer to stopping Luna from losing herself forever! The Elements of Harmony!

Celestia would have to be quick. She charged up more energy, this time turning herself into a beam of light that shot straight up and away from the conflict, ricocheting off of invisible things in the air toward the hiding place of the Elements.

"How very typical of my elder sister." Nightmare Moon noted coldly, "Running from difficulty is truly what she does best." The she-devil wrapped her starlight mane around herself like a cloak and transformed into a cloud of blue effervescence, following her radiant sister close behind.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------

Within the dimly lit clearing, on a pedestal, rested the five orbs representing the Elements of Harmony; one for Honesty, one for Loyalty, one for Laughter, one for Generosity and one for Kindness. Celestia stood in front of the pedestal, light radiating from her horn and all around her. Normally, wielding the Elements by oneself would be impossible, since the sixth Element - the Element of Magic, the only Element that had no material form - could only be awakened by a close bond. It was only because they were sisters and endured so much together that the Alicorn sisters were able to use the Elements against Discord. No matter how fervently she wished, no matter how devotedly she prayed, no matter how she demanded, the Elements remained dead-as-a-door-nail stones. Chocolate milk no longer rained from cotton candy clouds, the laws of physics were no longer inverted and night & day once again lasted roughly 12 hours each. Across the great land of Equestria, from Appleoosa to Manehatten to Las Pegasus, the citizens rejoiced in their restored harmony of Celestia & Luna ruling once again. In no place were the people more visibly appreciative than Canterlot.

         Nobleponies were squeamish and reality twisting around on itself made their vast inheritances useless, so obviously they were especially glad to see things return to status quo. Sure, they were short of memory from meeting so many other high rollers daily, so they wouldn't long remember that these particular mares from Ponyville saved civilization. 12133222211.content:
"Good afternoon, everypony." Celestia announced automatically as She walked down the aisle to the gold-plated chair that marked Her place in the chamber during such events as this. All the ponies bowed as per usual, which was something Celestia was beginning to tire of; the multitude of Her subjects bowed out of fear and respect for Her great power, which made Her feel as though they were deliberately trying to keep their distance from Her, but many ponies of the elite classes bowed purely for the formality of it all, which She despised all the more for the sense of hypocrisy it emanated. She sat down and waited for the typical opening of such a meeting as this.

The meeting rolled on in the classical style; one self-important pony rose and gave Princess Celestia a spiel about his/her successes and contributions before asking for more royal backing in some form or other and then another would take their place and the whole procedure would start all over again. Celestia had to be very careful in determining who should be granted their requests and in what way they would. She could've disowned every pony who made such demands if She so wished but politics were a whole different ballgame when compared to divine intervention; in the case of the latter She could simply will anything to be or not with physical motions and magical auras being pure theatre where She was concerned, but had She done the same in the former there would be a vacuum in Equestria's socio-political structure that could only be filled by mortal ponies at this time, not to mention it would ruin Her millennia of effort to encourage religious tolerance and diversity.

"Tell me, Golden Tomes," She interceded at a chosen point, "Has Equestria's bibliographic potential increased since you've been given the lease on the Starlight Publishing Centre... three months ago?"

"Indeed it has, Princess." He replied. "I have been able to check over the company's accounts and have found a way to yield a 6% output with a reduction in expenses of 5%."

"Then perhaps you could explain why unemployment figures in Canterlot have gone up by 6% and the publishing rate of new books has dropped by 10%?" Having reigned over Equestria for over five thousand years Celestia had come to know every little wrinkle, trick, turn of phrase and spin that sapient mortals could come up with; indeed She had mastered the art of detecting when somepony wasn't telling Her the full story.

"Well," Golden Tomes now sounded rather unsteady, "In order to improve the acumen of a business you have to make cutbacks, even a few lay-offs if need be, and the lack of new books is simply because there aren't many ponies writing them at this time."

"And would you be able to theorise as to why they're not writing as much as they were last year?"

"I...I guess there's not enough inspiration around for them."

"A lack of inspiration, indeed?" Celestia's timing was naturally impeccable. "And it would seem that's only happening in Canterlot, on account of the publishing figures from Manehatten and Fillydelphia having gone up by 2%."

"A logical conclusion of course, Princess." He announced with a sense of relief, which She soon quashed.

"And I believe that this time last year you seconded a statement made by Magnolia that Canterlot was the most inspiring city in the world?"

"Well, you certainly wouldn't find any other city worthy of inspiration." Magnolia interjected. "Manehatten is an overcrowded city of modern design filled with low-lives and the nouveau riche, Fillydelphia's a glorified dockyard, Cloudsdale has a charming style but all that cloud... it should be a mere weather factory as there's no other purpose for it; true ponies live on the ground these days. As for those foreign cities: The zebras seem to require our own architectural designs as they can't even think of living away from the jungle, the griffons are so military they can barely plan anything without grids and numbers and those vulgar diamond dogs won't even come up for air where cities are concerned."

"Oh, I really do see your point." Celestia answered in a discreetly sarcastic tone. "Who would dare live in the clouds in these modern times with all these modern ponies taking up space on the ground where they're liable to get in the way of our imports arriving at port. Do correct me if I'm wrong but I believe the term 'nouveau riche' translates as 'new rich' from the Griffanese and the highest proportion of zebras in Equestria lies in Fillydelphia with a healthy Zebrican community developing in Manehatten."

"With all due respect, Princess," Magnolia replied, "But maybe these griffon terms wouldn't have entered our noble language were it not for the fact that those predatory mongrels kept bringing in their foul habits thanks to your generosity being perhaps a bit too... plentiful? We had them on the run in the last war! We could've driven them back to their islands if we stuck with it for another year or so."

"I'm afraid," Celestia answered with strained patience, "That griffons are very proud creatures. If I had refused them the chance for peace talks when they were willing to do so we'd probably have still been at war for another decade to great expense."

"I fail to see how that would've been of such consequence." Upper Crust stated. "Equestria's the wealthiest nation in existence. And we all pay our due taxes." Celestia suppressed a grin.

"So glad you brought that up." She levitated a selection of papers. "The VAT rate has been set as anything up to 12% since the year 913 of the Second Age, the Income Tax rate has been a statutory 10% since the year 765 of the Second Age and National Insurance has been 3% since the end of the Diamond War. So the maximum tax rate is usually 25%. Now, if we look at your records, Upper Crust... you and your wife hold a shared bank account for business purposes, right? Good, now the both of you have made 13,207,048 bits since the start of the Third Age and your last tax payment consisted of... forty-seven bits, four shillings and five pence."

"I believe your majesty realises we're not eligible for VAT." He answered.

"Were that completely true," She replied, "I think you'll find that you've never paid more than a 1% tax rate in that time period."

"My dear Princess," Blueblood declared, "While I'm sure we're all appalled by this news I think you'll agree that those of us of a royal heritage are above such things."

"It's a case of circumstances in that case." She answered. "'Prince' Blueblood: Last year's expenses come to 7,999,011 bits and I do believe you've applied for another 200,000 bits for building modifications."

"But of course. 8,000,000 bits a year is not enough for a royal's lifestyle."

"The full list includes 15,000 bits on dating, 20,000 bits on cosmetics, 59,000 bits on clothing, 350,000 bits on dining out, 5,000 bits on jewellery, 72,000 bits on servants' wages, 78,312 bits on travel, 69,000 bits on opera tickets, 52,163 bits on decoration, 85,200 bits on a private airship, 234,500 bits on a 15-acre estate, 432,000 bits to fix-up said estate, 5,300 bits on electricity bills, 75,210 bits on new furniture, 53,212 bits on vanities and... what's this? 6,393,114 bits sundry? Care to explain?"

"There was a fabulous investment opportunity in a machine to revolutionise harvesting." He said.

"Which was unlicensed." Celestia pointed out, quickly deducing what he was talking about.

"Certainly not. I licensed it myself."

"Which you have no authorisation to do. I've seen a few licenses issued in the past few years with your signature on them."

"Indeed." Blueblood pushed on. "The most noble account in three epic chapters." The list of pointless investments and hidden expenses rolled on. "And I simply must have a swimming pool installed below my bedroom balcony."

"We shall speak more of this." Celestia told him. "I've discovered a fair number of tax cheats while going through these records and many of them are seated within my line of sight. It seems few, if any, of you understand the basic tenet of taxation. It's like dairy farming; you have to get the most milk for the least moo, but it seems that I've been getting plenty of moo but little in the way of milk. As things stand right now it might not seem like much of a consequence but the laws laid down in the earliest years of the First Age dictate that all guilty of tax dodging must pay up one way or another."

"Your highness," stated one of the guards, trying to disguise the contempt in his voice, and having only moderate success, "it is by order of Princess Luna that you are to wait here and comply with the instructions of the High Chef, Peppercorn."

"Feh. Commoners," Blueblood responded, with a flip of his mane. "What is the reason behind this? Peppercorn, attend me."

Peppercorn flapped his wings a couple times to approach the special delivery. "Highness, it is an honor to have you in our kitchen. You see, we are preparing a most special meal for Princess Celestia herself tonight."

"Ah. Ah... well, for Auntie Celestia, I see. And I surmise then that you wished for my regal palate to ensure that my aunt will enjoy her repast then?"

"It is indeed your tongue... amongst other attributes... that are required."

"Commoners are so useless without a noble to lead them." Blueblood probably meant to merely think that rather than say it aloud, but then again, given who it was, one can't be entirely sure.

Peppercorn took the comment with a broad smile, however. "If you will step this way, highness. My apprentice has prepared a grand roasting pan."

"Ah. Yes. By Celestia, what is that... thing?"

"Listen, dweeb, this thing is a Griffon. Got it?"

"Peppercorn, why have you not summoned the exterminators to rid the kitchens of this pest?"

"Why you little..."

"Gilda!" Peppercorn barked, gaining her attention. "Remember why we're here."

Gilda blinked, and her anger evaporated. "Oh yeah," she said, licking her beak. "I've got the stuffing ready, boss."

"Excellent. Highness, would you do us the honor of squatting in the pan, please?"

"You want me to... squat."

"Yes, highness."

"In the pan."

"Indeed, highness."

"Amongst those... somewhat oily vegetables you have arranged there."

"Just so, highness."

"And get my mane dirty."

"For Princess Celestia's sake, highness. It is necessary."

Blueblood sighed dramatically. "I fail to see the point of this," he said, as he timidly began to place his hooves inside the abnormally large pot. "You're certain this is for Princess Celestia?"

"Indeed, Highness, now if you will lay there. Yes... no, fold your legs inward... rump higher, yes, yes, just like that, highness."

"This will take a dozen baths to wash out," Blueblood stated miserably. "Why is this even necessary?"

"You're a bit large to carry, highness. Gilda, now."

"Wha?"

Gilda stuck a needle in Blueblood's flank, and depressed the trigger. Blueblood's eyes rolled, and he fell asleep.

"I thought that dweeb would never shut up," Gilda complained.

"Let's just get started, apprentice. I'll get him glazed, you carefully remove his gibblets and get him nice and stuffed."

"He's pretty stuffed already," Gilda joked, as she raised her claw to get at the annoying noblepony's abdomen, and begin the cooking process.
