"Luna, I have spent several years convincing ponies there is nothing to fear-" Celestia started, but Luna had already walked away from the table.
"Oh... You look so delicious..." Luna whispered as she spied on Blueblood, watching him trot along pompously. She imagined how delightful he would feel squirming in her belly, or how he would sound as she ripped his flesh off with her teeth. "Prince Blueblood!" She called.
"Yes, Aunt Luna?" He responded. They hadn't talked much since she'd returned from her banishment.
"If you had to choose between the two, which would you prefer: swallowing something whole, or ripping it apart with your teeth?" Luna asked. An odd question, but absolutely necessary if Luna was going to make him suffer and sate the dark desires in her heart.
12213211.title: Celestia allows Luna to eat Blueblood.

choices: Luna makes preparations for her meal
122132112.content:
"I... Suppose... I would rather... Be swallowed alive?" Blueblood answered with as much confusion as one would expect. "Why, Aunt Luna?"
"It was merely a question." Luna waved the notion away with a hoof, praying to the gods that foals' history lessons didn't include the princesses' cannibalism.
"Well... Alright... If you say so." He replied. "I'd better be going now. I've mares to disappoint. I'll be in the ballroom if you need me." Blueblood continued down the elegant hall. Luna breathed a sigh of relief. Next up, to the royal chef for her unusual order.
"How may I service you, Princess?" the mare asked, bowing lowly as Luna entered the kitchen. Sugarplum, Luna thought her name was.
"Rise." Luna commanded. The cream colored mare complied, the ends of her deep violet mane sweeping the floor. "You needn't be so formal with me. Though I am a princess, I am also a pony like anypony else."
"I'll remember for next time." Sugarplum promised. "What can I do for you, Princess Luna?"
"Promise you will not judge. It is what some may call an archaic practice, but my sister and I will be resurrecting the tradition on Sunday night." Luna replied.
"What might that be, Princess?" Sugarplum asked.
"Before I was banished, my sister and I would regularly indulge in the flesh of ponies." Luna responded. To her surprise, the cook didn't even wince. "Do you not find this abhorrent? Are you not disgusted that your beloved princesses partake in cannibalism?"
"I've heard the rumors Princess, and yes, it was a bit jarring at first but you are royalty. What you do behind closed doors is your own business." said Sugarplum coolly. Luna was a bit taken aback by this, but the chef seemed serious so she continued,
"On Sunday evening I will require you to take Prince Blueblood, shear him, marinate him, and roast him without killing him. My sister and I will take care of that." Luna smiled, baring her teeth. "Are you able to do that for me?"
"Whatever my princess wishes of me." Sugarplum bowed out of respect.
"Excellent..." Luna nearly growled with lust. Perhaps Nightmare Moon wasn't completely gone...
122132112.title: Blueblood would rather swallow something whole ...

choices: Luna and Celestia eat Blueblood together
Luna eats Blueblood alone/ Celestia eats somepony else
1221321121.content:
Luna drooled as she lay idly on her bed, thinking about the succulent meal. It would be the first "substantial" dinner she'd had in ages. She thought of how triumphant she would feel in front of that pathetic, mewling excuse for a stallion and how he would scream when she took that first, agonizingly slow bite... Luna actually became a bit aroused. Yes... Yes... To look into the eyes of true royalty, knowing your life was a sham, as the rightful ruler of the land devoured your very being... If she reinstated the practice of royal cannibalism, perhaps it would be enough to quell the lingering darkness in her heart. She mustn't dwell on it any longer, she still had duties to perform. It was early morning now and her elder sister was already seated in the great balcony. Luna channeled her godlike magical ability, lowering the moon as her sister raised the sun. She yawned and trotted towards her bed. It was nearly Thursday by now, and Sunday couldn't come quickly enough.
Luna awoke at the crack of dusk, ready to raise the moon. Oh, what day was it? Friday? Despite her endless hunger, time has slipped away from her. There were preparations to be made. Upon raising the moon and seeing Celestia retire to bed, Luna briskly walked back to her own room. She must be dressed accordingly for such a momentous occasion. Rifling through her wardrobe, she found the perfect dress. A delicate piece spun from black silk, its hem falling just beneath her haunches. Luna smiled at herself in the mirror. The dress had soft, lacy straps and wasn't overly flashy, just the way she liked them. Unlike that... that PRINCE. Luna breathed in deeply, walking over to her jewelry box and removing her favorite necklace. A large, oval locket, crafted from silver. It had been a gift from her sister, shortly after she had returned from the moon. Celestia had admitted that when she had originally banished Luna, she thought it was permanent. Luna raised the locket with her magic and inspected it through misty eyes. It was gorgeous, no expense had been spared in its making. Tiny circles of onyx and sapphire (or perhaps blue diamond, Luna was no geologist) were set alternating on its rim. A crescent moon, nearly the exact one on her cutie mark was carved in the center. Supposedly a spell had been cast so the silver would never tarnish. It was truly the work of an artist. But the real treasure was inside. Luna popped it open. On one side of the locket was herself, smiling in a way that she had never let her subjects see in the older days. On the other side was her dear sister Celestia. Luna marvelled at the technological advancement for a moment. They just pointed and shot, so you could do things like smile, instead of holding completely still for and hour or so while waiting for a portrait to be finished.
Snapping out of her astonishment, Luna put the locket away and hung up the dress.
"Hmmm... I think I'll invite Celestia to dinner on Sunday..."
1221321121.title: Luna makes preparations for her meal

choices: Celestia would prefer her own meal at dinner
12213211212.content: It's entirely possible that Celestia has given up her vorish ways for good. It is also possible that the temptation is so great that Celestia will consume ponies with her sister, but feels it unfair to split a "meal" or perhaps while Luna wants to eat Blueblood piece by piece, Celestia prefers swallowing her meals whole and alive.
12213211212.title: Luna eats Blueblood alone/ Celestia eats somepo...

1222.content:
It was nightmare night again and the princess of the moon enjoyed herself immensely. She decided to spend the night in Ponyville again and was currently playing her favortie party game, toss the spider. One thing has always puzzled her though. Why in the name of everything good and decent would the ponies create a holiday tradition where the colts and fillies would get eaten if they didn't bring her candy?

Luna sighed, culture can sure change in a thousand years. As she heard a loud splat nearby she saw a perfect example for this. A thousand years ago nopony would ever have dreamed of wasting perfectly good pumpkins for a silly little game. It was getting late and some ponies have already gone home.
1222.title: Nightmare Night

12222.content:
The princess had enough fun for one night and decided to head to the library. Twilight Sparkle has generously offered her a room for the night until she returns to Canterlot and Luna was more than happy to spend some time with a good friend. Someday she'll have to find a way to thank her properly.

Inside the large tree the lavender unicorn greeted her. "Oh princess Luna, did you enjoy yourself?"

"Indeed, I would even say that the fun has been tripled. And thankfully the candy offerings have been sufficient so no child has been gobbled up."

Luna wondered what was so funny as Twilight laughed, maybe the unicorn was just relieved. Suddenly there was a knock on the door.

"Princess Luna, I still have to give you some candy."

Luna recognized that voice, it was...
12222.title: Go to the library

122221.content:
Snips and Snails, two unicorn colts with somewhat lacking intelligence. Luna opened the door letting the two of them inside. "Well then, present thine offering."

"Sure thing, Snails give her the candy." Said Snip, the smaller plump unicorn.

Looking at the lanky one she saw that he was munching on the candy himself. As he noticed that he was watched he looked at them sheepishly and presented the rest of the candy. With dread Luna noticed that there were only three bonbons left.

Both colts looked at her with a nervous expression. With a heavy heart the lunar princess sighed. "I am so sorry but this offering just isn't enough. I hope you can forgive me but I have to follow the tradition."

All unicorns were now looking at her confused. Then the princess used her magic to grab the small, chubby unicorn and to their horror she swallowed him in one bite before grabbing Snails with her magic.
122221.title: Snips and Snails

1222212.content: While Luna is eating Snips and Snail, what is Twilight feeling?
1222212.title: Other reaction.

12222122.content: Then what is she feeling?
12222122.title: Other feelings.

1222221.content:
Twilight took some time to clean up as Luna looked around the library, taking a moment to admire how much pony architecture has changed over the centuries. This was the first time she’s even been to the humble town of Ponyville, and she’s never seen anything like it before. There was a lot that has changed over time, and quite a few things had happened tonight that Luna simply didn’t understand. She’d have to ask Twilight about some of the quirkier aspects of Ponyville culture tommorow. Particularly the whole ‘gobbling ponies up’ thing. In centuries past, ponies feared the prospect being swallowed alive by their princesses-- and these days they have an entire holiday dedicated to it? These were strange times indeed.

Meanwhile, Twilight, preparing to hit the hay for the night, tosses her robe and novelty wizard hat from her Starswirl costume into a small compartment full of similar knickknacks-- keepsakes from adventures long past that she couldn’t bear to throw away. “So, did you have fun tonight?”

“Oh, yes! We greatly enjoyed the night’s festivities,” Luna announced, cheerfully, though she was disappointed she didn’t get a chance to play more party games on account of, well, everypony screaming and running away.

“Are you sure? You seemed a little bit uncomfortable at times,” Twilight asked. “Did you just find it strange how different everything is nowadays?”

“You ponies’ traditions are many and strange, indeed. But if we are to, uh… ‘fit in’ around here, we must acclimate to this modern culture,” Luna sighed, but put on an air of pomp and royal certainty. Still, Twilight could sense a hint of dejection in her voice, as if the princess was overwhelmed by this new society and missed the old Equestria that she was used to.

“Don’t stress yourself over it too much,” Twilight recommended, still humbled and faintly amused to see even an all-powerful alicorn princess struggling socially. “Ponies today are a lot more understanding than they were a thousand years ago. I’m sure they’ll accept you for who you are, no matter what.”

“Thank you, Twilight. We know well how accepting you townsponies are, we simply… need some time to get comfortable,” Luna replied simply, not even bothering to use her signature purple prose, giving a genuine smile for the first time of the night since she first tried to spider tossing game. Twilight showed Luna the guest room in the basement area of the library, nestled among the roots of the gargantuan hollowed-out tree. “Thanks, but we think we’ll stay up tonight.”

They returned to the atrium of the library, and Luna pored over some of Twilight’s vast collection of books while Twilight walked into the restroom to take a warm bath and get ready for bed. Suddenly, there were three heavy knocks on the Library’s door. “Could you get that?” Luna moved to pull open the heavy wooden library door, before a delightful smell invaded her nostrils as she drew close, like vanilla and chocolate. “Mm! What could that delicious aroma be?” Luna wondered to herself, quickly growing excited. Perhaps somepony had baked her a massive, delicious cake as an offering! She loves cake! She pulled the door open, waiting to chow down on a delicious treat, only to see an exhausted-looking filly standing before her. “Hello, princess! It’s, uh, Applebloom. Applejack’s sister.”

The princess quickly realized what the source of the delicious smell was. The filly was covered head-to-toe with melted and blended chocolate, sugar, cake batter, vanilla, and every other delicious coating you could think of. For a small moment, Luna assumed that she was planning to offer herself as a nightmare night treat, until she saw the small pillowcase full of candy the filly was holding. “Sorry we didn’t make it to the ceremonies. Scootaloo got the bright idea that we should spend all night trying to get our cutie marks in candy making. It, uh… didn’t work out,” she sighed, gesturing to the melted candy that coated her fur. She overturns the pillowcase she was holding, dumping its contents on the ground. Compared to the melted candy splattered across her mane and fur, the candy she was offering was rather paltry. “Anyway, to make it up to you, here.”

“Oh… hmm. We are sorry, child, but this isn’t nearly enough,” Luna frowned, visibly disappointed by the meager pile of half a dozen small candies. “Hey, it’s all the candy we have left. It’s not much, but it’s the thought that counts, right?” she shrugs with a chuckle, before making motions for the door. “Anyway, I should be heading back. I’ve got to get a bath, wash all this off me. It was nice meeting ya, anyway.” Before Applebloom could walk out the front door into the cold night beyond, however, Luna stepped in front of the door, blocking the exit. Startled, the filly looked up at the princess towering before her, who suddenly took on an almost intimidating presence.

“Our apologies, Applebloom, but a royal cannot let thee get away with defying sacred traditions. It would set a terrible precedent! Surely, thou understands,” Luna announced sternly. She had swallowed ponies before, a few times, in the more lawless eras of many centuries past. It was mostly the most despicable criminals that she devoured, as well as any subjects that willingly offered themselves for one reason or another. She wasn’t planning on eating any ponies during her visit to Ponyville, but if it was part of their sacred traditions, she certainly wouldn’t complain. She did want to prove herself to the local townsponies, no? It didn’t hurt that Luna’s mouth was already watering at the smell of the melted sweets splattered all over the small pony’s fur and mane.

Applebloom suddenly started levitating above the ground, and her limbs went stiff, as if she wasn’t in control of them anymore. She quickly realized that Luna had picked her up with her power of telekinesis, and was slowly hovering her towards the alicorn, who looked almost like she was licking her lips hungrily. “Uh, princess? What are you doi- mph!” Applebloom’s query was cut short as the princess, who was almost 5 times larger than her, closed her mouth around the filly’s head, knocking her bow off onto the floor. Luna was immediately overwhelmed by the taste. Like swallowing one big, delicious three hundred pound cake in one bite. She had been chowing down on every sweet imaginable for the entire night, but none of it even compared to this. She had to admit-- after over a thousand years, she missed the taste of ponies. By the time Applebloom could even register just what was going on, only her hind legs were still sticking out of the princess's gullet.

Twilight emerged from the shower, her fur still slightly wet, a towel wrapped in her hair. She seemed content, only for her face to change to that of shock and terror as she saw what was occurring in her own living room. Twilight immediately began yelling something or another-- Luna was too wrapped up in her meal to pay her any attention-- and immediately sprinted up to Luna, trying to pull the earth pony from her maw. ‘Just what does Twilight think she’s doing, interrupting a royal while she’s eating? How uncouth!’ Luna thinks to herself as she pushed Twilight away with a hoof, and take one big last gulp, closing her mouth around her meals hooves, reducing Applebloom to a massive bulge in her throat, and soon, a small, wriggling bulge in her already massive belly.

Luna burps as she finishes her meal, before turning her attention to Twilight, who was sitting on the floor starting shocked at Luna’s belly as it bulged and undulated with the pony inside. “My dear, Twilight! What has gotten into you?” Luna scowls at the stunned unicorn. “Don’t you know how rude it is to interrupt a princess while she’s eating?”

“Y-you...” Twilight said, recoiling back across the wooden floor, shock and awe on her face. “You swallowed somepony...”

“Why, yes, we ‘gobbled her up’, as you townsponies seem to put it,” Luna explains, as if nothing was wrong. “She didn’t bestow her princess a satisfactory offering. Is this not part of Ponyville tradition?”

Luna didn’t get a response right away, but something about the look on Twilight's face told her all she needed to know-- Luna had made a terrible, terrible mistake.
1222221.title: Candied Apples

12222211.content:
“Applebloom! Can you hear me? Are you okay in there?” Twilight asked, as she pressed a stethoscope onto the side of Luna’s distended belly. Luna just laid there, looking embarrassed and ashamed.

“Twilight? I’m fine, I’m fine. I’m not hurt or anything. It’s just really, really gross in here...” A small voice replied back through the layers of skin, sounding muffled even with a stethoscope. Twilight sighed in relief. “Uh, can you get me out of here, please?”

“We’re working on it, Applebloom. Just hang in there,” Twilight reassured her, before turning back to her collection of spell books looking for something, anything that might fix this mess. Twilight already found a spell that temporarily halts digestion, so at least Applebloom was safe… for now. But she still had to act fast. Applejack would kill her if she found out about this…

“Please hear us, Twilight. We are profusely sorry about all this,” Luna apologizes, sounding mortified. “It’s just that, all night we've been told we were supposed to gobble up ponies as part of Ponyville tradition! How were we supposed to know it was all just a game?”

“I know you didn’t mean any harm by it, Princess, but… eating a pony?” Twilight sighed, noticeably exasperated and confused by the entire situation. “You should know never to eat ponies, even if you did think it was a tradition!”

“Swallowing ponies is one of the many powers bestowed upon us alicorns,” Luna insists. “Has not Celestia been swallowing any prisoner who deserves it, or any subject who offered themselves?”

“What? No! There’s no capital punishment in Equestria. Even the worst criminals are simply exiled to Tartarus,” Twilight insisted, before stopping as she remembered something. “Although… a few ancient scrolls do mention that the princesses used to ‘devour’ certain prisoners centuries ago… but most historians just believe those tomes to be speaking metaphorically.”

“Well, they weren’t. It is the literal truth. We and Celestia used to swallow any criminals who truly deserved it,” Luna admits. “As well as any ponies who offered themselves willingly to be swallowed. Thou would be surprised just how many ponies are so devoted that they would be willing to be swallowed just to become a part of us. We assumed thou Ponyville ponies wanted to fill your princess’s belly, what with all the offerings.”

“Oh. So, all the princesses did used to eat ponies? Well, uh… that does explain a lot,” Twilight said, considering the idea. Twilight had asked Celestia about those scrolls before, but Celestia always seemed to suddenly get dismissive and cryptic, refusing to give a straight answer. “But that doesn’t matter now. All that matters it getting her out of there. How much time do we have?”

“Theoretically, if we keep using anti-digestion spells, she can live safely in my belly for years,” Luna responds, pondering this question. “But while we’re under the effects of the spell, I can’t extract nutrients from any of the food I eat, so we can’t keep that up forever. I’d starve! So we’d say thou has about… a week to come up with something.”

“Alright. That should be more then enough time,” Twilight said, turning her attention back to her spell books, searching resolutely for a solution to this whole mess. Meanwhile, Luna puts on the stethoscope and presses it against her belly, which was already so big that the filly hardly even left a bulge.

“Art thou alright in there?” Luna speaks loudly so that the filly could hear her.

“Princess? Yes, I’m alright. Just trying to get comfortable,” the muffled voice responded.

“So.. thou aren’t angry, or scared?” Luna asks, surprised.

“Of course not. Just a few months ago, this whole town got torn apart by these bug creatures that multiplied and ate everything. And the month before that, it got attacked by a 50-foot tall bear! So I’m pretty used to weird things happening around here,” Applebloom responded. “Besides, it’s surprisingly roomy in here. And there’s candy everywhere, too!”

“Well, it’s quite a relief to hear that you’re comfortable, at least,” Luna smiled, charmed by the filly’s enthusiasm. “Don’t you worry. We’ll have you out and about again before you know it!”

Luna set the stethoscope on the ground, and laid leaned against a bookshelf, rubbing her distended belly, staring up at the night sky through a window. It was almost half an hour before Twilight spoke again. “I’ve got it! I found something!” Twilight announced, and Luna hurried over to her, looking down at one of the spell books she had laid open on the floor.

“What is it? What kind of spell did you find?”

“It’s a spell that can be fine-tuned to teleport a very specific object to a very specific coordinate, without the user needing to see the object directly,” Twilight explained, gesturing to the particular page in her spell book. “It should get Applebloom out of your belly safely… however, it is difficult to cast. It requires me to draw runes with very particular and complex configurations. It should take a day or two to prepare. I’ll get to work on it right away.”

“Good work, Twilight. Thank you for everything,” Luna says, and starts walking towards the stairway to the basement. However, Twilight stops her with a hoof before she could.

“And hey. Don’t tear yourself up over this too much, okay? You didn’t know things were different now. Somepony probably should’ve filled you in before you had to make public appearances,” Twilight reassured her, and Luna smiled. “Thank you, Twilight. It is very comforting to hear that,” Luna responds, before trotting down the basement stairs, and laid down on the small, rickety bed in the guest bedroom. She was originally planning to stay up tonight, but after that exhausting meal, she was beat. It’s not like there’s much she could do at this point. All she could do was gently rub her engorged belly as she drifted off to sleep.
12222211.title: History Lesson

choices: Stay inside the library all day
122222111.content:
Luna woke up with a yawn early the next morning. Unlike mortal ponies, alicorns have less of an urgent requirement for basic needs such as food and sleep. However, getting a good night’s rest was still deeply satisfying. Luna could tell from the lack of movement that Applebloom was still asleep, and so she moved slowly and gently, careful not to wake up the filly resting inside her belly. She crept up the the dark stairwell, lighting the path with a simple illumination spell, to see Twilight Sparkle in the living room still working diligently on the spell she was crafting. “Good morning, Twilight,” Luna greeted cheerfully, only to receive no response. Twilight looked absolutely exhausted, slumped over her tomes as if she could barely stand. “Did thou get any sleep last night?”

“Uh… no, not at all. I was working on… the spell,” Twilight shook her head weakly, and Luna could hear the exhaustion in her voice.

“Thine work will be sloppy and poorly thought-out if one is exhausted, Twilight,” Luna warns, seeing how messy the rune was inscribing had already become.

“I’m… fine. Don’t worry about me. I just need to… get this done...” Twilight yawned, dismissively. Luna rolled her eyes. Celestia had warned her that Twilight could be unreasonably stubborn if she feels something is important. Luna decides to grab Twilight with her powerful magical telekinesis, lifting the mare in the air and carrying her up the stairs towards her bedroom. “What? Hey! Let me go!”

“Thou mortal ponies need your rest,” Luna insists, sternly. “We shall take care of things in the meantime. There is no need to worry.”

“Luna, I’m… fine. I don’t need… any...” Twilight complained, before Luna dropped her onto her bed. Twilight immediately stopped her bickering as she was struck by how comfortable her own bed was, and was immediately out like a light, finally getting some sleep after hours of exhaustion. Luna smirked at the sight of the unicorn mare curled up in the blankets before closing the door and trotting back down the stairs. She could tell that it was still early in the morning with a single glance out the window, and took a moment to admire the sunrise as she ponders what she would do today.
122222111.title: A Day to Herself

choices: They head back to the library
1222221111.content:
Luna realized that she had gotten so caught up in the chaotic events of last night that she didn’t get to explore the quaint little town of Ponyville as much as she had wanted to. Since it seemed like she was going to be spending a few more days in town, she might as well have a look around. She crept out the front door, and began wandering the village. The village was stunningly complex and beautiful, considering the fact that the last time she was around this region, this entire area was an untamed jungle. As she walked, she began to feel Applebloom tapping against the sides of her stomach, trying to get her attention. It seems her belly swaying as she walked roused the filly from her sleep. “Hold on, Applebloom. Let us try something,” Luna says, deciding to make conversation a little bit more convenient. She sat down in a back alley, out of sight of passersby, and her horn lit up as she strained herself to perform a powerful spell. She successfully forged what is called a ‘telepathic link’ with Applebloom, so that they could communicate directly into each other’s minds without having to speak out loud.

“Applebloom? Can you hear me?” Luna tested this new link, speaking to the filly telepathically.

“Uhh… loud and clear,” Applebloom responded, sounding a bit confused. Her words were beamed directly to Luna’s mind.

“Fantastic! Oh, and, good morning,” Luna responded cheerfully, and continued on her way. Luna’s belly was already so large that Applebloom hardly even made a bulge, and now that they could communicate with each other telepathically, it would be almost impossible for an outside observer to tell that the princess held an entire pony within her stomach. Now that nightmare night was over, the ponies of ponyville seemed much more excited than scared to see the princess of the night. The townsponies smiled and waved as she walked by, and she waved back, almost giddy with excitement. After all that struggle and isolation, the felt that the ponies had finally accepted her. “Now, what does thou need, dear?”

“I’m hungry… could you grab something to eat?” Applebloom asked with a yawn.

“Did thou already eat all that candy?” Luna asked.

“Um… yes,” Applebloom admitted with an (invisible) shrug.

“Well, then! We shall visit a local diner,” Luna agrees, admittedly excited at the idea of another meal. “After our exile, we are not familiar with modern earth pony cuisine.”

Luna continues to wander Ponyville aimlessly, occasionally asking the townsponies about the best diners in town. Applebloom relaxes as the princess walks, her belly swaying back and forth like a hammock. While it was a bit gross in the alicorn’s stomach, Applebloom had to admit, it was probably the most comfortable and relaxed she’s ever been. She could probably stand staying in here for a few days. Eventually, the princess happens upon a quaint-looking shop, and licked her lips at the sight of the delicious pastries inside. “Will, err, ‘Sugarcube Corner’ be sufficient?” she asks telepathically.

“Sugarcube Corner? Oh, yeah, that place is the best!” Applebloom cheers, immediately excited at the mention of the name. Luna walks through the front door, a few tiny bells wired to the door ringing as she enters. The bakery was almost completely empty, save for Mr. and Mrs. Cake, the couple who ran the shop. They looked shocked for a moment to see a royal walk into their humble diner unexpected, and immediately ducked behind the counter. Luna sits down at one of the many empty booths, and smirks a bit to herself as she hears the couple whisper excitedly to each other.

“Code red! Code red! We’ve got a princess!”
“What? A princess? What is a princess doing here unannounced?”
“It’s Luna, she’s still in town!”
“What do we do, what do we do?”
“Just grab everything we have. We’ll lay out a buffet. Quickly!”

Mrs. Cake emerged from behind the counter, smiling nervously, dragging some table cloth along behind her. With one fluid motion, she knocked everything off the table in front of Luna-- including a few glass vases, which shattered on the floor-- and draped the table cloth over it instead. “Hello, your majesty! It is an honor to serve you,” Mrs. Cake bowed, trying her hardest to remain composed. Before Luna could respond, Mr. Cake emerged as well, struggling to balance half a dozen serving trays along his back, and another three stacked on his head. Before she could even tell them what she wanted, they begun laying down all the best dishes they had. A photogenic display of assorted cakes, pies, and pastries was soon laid on the table, so organized in their arrangement that, if she didn’t know any better, it would seem like it was planned out hours in advance. Luna couldn’t help but to be impressed by their handiwork.

“All-you-can-eat, on the house! Only the best for our most valued customer,” Mr. Cakes announces, a similar nervous smile on his face, as if he expects the princess to lash out at him at any moment. Instead, Luna licks her lips, glancing over the vast table of pastries before her. “These look perfect!” She complemented, before immediately chomping down, eager to devour the delicious pastries. The couple could only watch in shock and awe as the massive alicorn tore through the entire buffet in moments, downing entire cakes in one bite and dumping a tray’s worth of cupcakes down her throat. “Whoa, hey! Slow down!” Applebloom yelled, as the endless pastries Luna was wolfing down rapidly filled up the cramped space within her stomach. Luna’s belly began to expand even more as she continued clearing the table, until the entire buffet had been decimated before the couple’s eyes. Luna leans back in her seat with a decidedly inelegant burp, rubbing her belly contentedly, which now bulged three times its usual size. “Oh! Excuse us. Our compliments to the chef,” Luna smiles as she walks towards the door, tossing an entire sack full of bits over her shoulder as she left. The couple could only stand there, stunned, watching as she walks out of the bakery, their entire inventory resting in the alicorn’s stomach.

Luna’s now massive stomach swayed underneath her as she walked, and she seemed to struggle to even stand. “Ugh! Did you really have to eat so much?” Applebloom complained, as she was completely covered in more sweets than she could possibly eat in a lifetime.

“I apologize, it was indeed a… ugh… poor decision in retrospect. We just haven’t had that many sweets in so, so long...” Luna groans, as her stomach gurgles as it bears the weight of the pastries within. “Does thou know of anywhere we can rest? Your princess needs to… lay down for a while...”

Applebloom was growing increasingly frustrated with her situation, but decided there was no use fighting it now. “Hmm...” Applebloom considered the question.
1222221111.title: Stuffed to the Brim

choices: They play board games while she waits.
She manages to get some rest.
12222211112.content:
Applebloom gave Luna directions to a little tree house in an orchard on the far outskirts of town. It seemed perfect-- it was far out of the way, and no one would just stumble upon it through the complicated weave of apple trees that made up the orchard. It was just the right place to rest for a few hours without being bothered by any unexpected ponies. So imagine Luna's surprise when she climbed up to the tree house only to find there were already two foals sitting inside.

“Hey! I saw that! You're supposed to put the money back in the bank, not just give it to yourself!” The orange pegasus filly yelled.

“Nuh-uh! Bankers can take a 'bankers fee', sometimes! Rarity told me so!” The white unicorn filly insisted. The two foals were sitting around a board game in the middle of the room, arguing incessantly with each other. Luckily, they were facing away from the front door, so they haven't noticed Luna yet, giving her some time to think.

“Who are the two foals sitting in the tree house?” Luna asked Applebloom telepathically, so she couldn't be overheard. “Thou said there wouldn't be anypony here.”

“Oh, those are my friends. I didn't think they'd be here.” Applebloom said. “Just explain everything to them. They're cool, trust me.”

Luna stood there pondering her next course of action, hesitant, before shrugging. What's the worst that can happen, she mused to herself. She decided to loudly stomp her hooves on the wooden floor in a way that sounded like somepony was walking up the stairs, to get the foals' attention.

“Hey, Applebloom! Where have you be-” the orange one started without looking, before both foals turned and gasped upon seeing the royal princess of the night standing in their tree house unannounced. The white one immediately bowed respectfully, and the orange one gave her a strange look. “Uh, what are you doing?”

“What do you mean, what am I doing? She's a princess! We have to bow or she'll send us to the dungeon!” The white unicorn whispered, anxiously.

“Oh! Right, right!” The orange filly responded, before quickly giving a sloppy excuse for a bow.

Luna couldn't help but giggle, before waving a hoof. “You may stand,” she smiled, and the foals stood, looking up at her in awe.

“It is a pleasure to make your acquaintance, your highness! I am your humble subject, Sweetie Belle.” The white one announced, before nudging the orange pegasus in the side and whispering, “Now introduce yourself... and make it fancy!”

“Okay. Hey, I'm Scootaloo. Your, uh... majestyness.” The orange pegasus said with a curt salute. Sweetie Belle facehoofed.

“Well, we appreciate thine hospitality, but thou will find there will be no dungeon-sending anymore,” Luna reassured the foals. “Those days are over. Thou may treat us as thine equal, now.”

“Hey, see? We didn't even have to worry!” Scootaloo smirked at Sweetie Belle, who in response only glared in exasperation. “So what brings a princess to our little treehouse? I'm pretty sure you already have a cutie mark.”

“Actually, Applebloom sent us,” Luna said, sitting down next to them. “I assume you are her friends?”

“Yup!” Scootaloo nodded. “So you know where she is? We've been looking for her since last night.”

“She is right her with us, actually,” Luna said cryptically, before giving the pegasus the stethoscope. Luna gestured towards her belly, which bulged three times its usual size. “Here, listen.”

“Uh... okay,” Scootaloo raised a brow, confused but not wanting to question the demand of a royal princess. She put the stethoscope on and pressed it against Luna's belly.

“Scootaloo! Scootaloo! Hey! I'm in here!” Applebloom yelled. “Can you hear me?”

“Applebloom?” Scootaloo gasped. “Are you... in her stomach?”

“Yeah, but I'm okay! It's actually not that bad in here. Please don't freak out, okay?” Applebloom insisted. “Twilight is working on a way to get me out, but Luna needs to stay here for a while until then.”

“Freak out? Are you kidding me? I don't freak out over anything!” Scootaloo scoffed, posturing. “But, uh... this is a bit much.”

“Hey! What? What do you hear?” Sweetie Belle stepped forward, curious.

“Applebloom's in, uh, there,” Scootaloo shrugged, poking Luna's bulging gut. “But she's alright though. It's safe in there, I guess.”

“What? Luna... gobbled her up?” Sweetie Belle gasped. “That's... so cool! I thought all that was just a legend!”

“It is just a legend,” Luna spoke up. “After all this is sorted out, we may never eat another pony again.”

“Aw...” Sweetie Belle sighed, looking a little disappointed.

Luna laid back on the hard wooden floor of the tree house as the foals went back to arguing. She was definitely way too old to keep up with the pace of their bickering.

“I didn't figure you'd like gross stuff like this.”
“It's not gross! I always wanted to meet a pony that could eat other ponies.”
“Really? Why?”
“Haven't you read the Sweet Tooth comic books?”
“Well, I don't really read that many books...”
“It's about this pony who's special talent is her ability to eat anything... including bullies! Nopony messes with her!”
“I don't know, sounds kind of dumb.”
“What!? What do you mean?”
“Well, it's just not realistic, y'know? I mean, ponies can't eat other ponies...”
“Well, apparently they can!”
“Yeah, Luna can, because she's a big ol' alicorn! But other ponies can't.”
“They can if they have a special talent!”
“That's not how special talents work!”

“Could you not argue right now?” Applebloom groaned. “You're giving me a headache.”

“Yeah, Scootaloo! No arguing,” Sweetie Belle smirked, sticking out her tongue.

“You started it!” Scootaloo yelled, frustrated, as the two began to loudly argue once again. Luna sighed. Resting here was going to be harder than she thought...
12222211112.title: The Two Very Annoying Fillies

122222111121.content:
Luna shrugged, and decided to sit down and join the fillies in their games - nothing better to do while waiting for Twilight’s spell, anyway. Unfortunately, the foals appeared to play very fast and loose with the rules of every board game they played, and Luna struggled to keep up. She didn’t know how they could possibly be having fun with this. They made up new rules every minute and then arguing over whether those new rules were valid by some arbitrary criteria, and before long Luna was started to feel a little dizzy. It didn’t help that hunger was slowly pooling up in her gut. It was a cruel irony-- her stomach was stuffed to the brim, and yet she couldn’t digest any of it, so she felt like she was starving.

“Why’s your stomach being so noisy? I’m tryin’ to take a nap,” Applebloom complained, resting on her ‘bed’ of crushed pastries and sweets within the alicorn’s stomach.

“We are sorry Applebloom,” the Princess apologised, patting her belly. “The spell Twilight found to protect you appears to have some… unintended side-effects.”

“How long is she going to be in there, Miss Luna?” Sweetie Belle asked, turning away from the game. She seemed unusually interested in the whole situation.

“We do not know yet. Twilight is working on a ritual that should be able to rescue her,” Luna explained.

“Okay...” Sweetie Belle said thoughtfully, staring at the Princess's unnaturally distended belly, before sheepishly asking, “So… would you mind if I… felt it?”

“Do as you wish,” Luna shrugged. Sweetie Belle cautiously kneaded and rubbed the massive alicorn’s equally massive gut, hesitantly at first but more eagerly over time. Luna found the belly rub to be immensely relaxing. She hadn’t felt like this for centuries now…

“You said Twilight cast a spell so that it’s safe in there… right?” Sweetie Belle asked, eagerly. Luna didn’t like where this was going.

“Uh… yes, little one. Why dost thou ask?” Luna responded, hesitantly. Suddenly, Sweetie Belle threw herself on the ground in front of the princess, bowing.

“Twilight will never cast this spell again, probably, so this is my only chance to, uh… I want to see what it’s like inside somepony’s belly!” Sweetie Belle begged. “Please, princess! It can’t harm anything, right?”

“You want us to… eat you?” Luna said, a bit shocked, so quietly that the foals almost couldn’t hear her. The foal wouldn’t be harmed, of course, but she had promised to never eat another pony ever again! What would Twilight think? On the other hoof, Luna did feel like she was practically starving. One more snack couldn’t hurt...

“What’s wrong with you!?” Scootaloo said, trying to snap the other foal out of it. “You don’t just ask somepony something like that! Why would you want to get eaten, anyway?”

“This is our only chance to try! Maybe I’ll get my cutie mark, after all? If I don’t try now, I’ll never know!” Sweetie Belle explained, enthusiastically. “Besides… I’ve always been a little curious...”

“Ugh! What’s going on now?” Applebloom groaned, hearing the commotion.

“Your unicorn friend said that she would like to join you,” Luna said telepathically to Applebloom, as the pegasus and unicorn argued incessantly.

“Really? She wants you to… huh. Well, she does talk about this kind of thing a whole lot,” Applebloom said, thinking. “It would be nice to have some company in here, I guess. I’ve been soooo bored.” Ugh! Luna had hoped Applebloom would talk her out of it, but she just endorsed the idea. She tried to find some other excuse, but the idea just seemed more tempting every minute. Back in the old times of the kingdom, many ponies would come to her begging to be swallowed, and she would fulfill their requests. Every good princess needs to make sure her subjects are happy, right? Surely, Twilight would understand...

1222221111211.title: She says yes.

1222221112.content:
Luna laid on her book on one of the wide wooden stairs stretching across the library’s interior. It was probably best that she stay inside for now, until this whole mess had been sorted out. If she went wandering around outside, somepony might notice her bulging belly and realize the truth, and she couldn’t imagine the chaos that would ensue if everypony reacted like Twilight did at first. Besides, she kind of just wanted to relax today. As she was laying there pondering this, she felt Applebloom tap against the walls of her stomach from the inside, as if trying to get her attention. Luna giggled, as she pressed the stethoscope against her belly to address the foal. “Good morning, Applebloom,” Luna smiles.

“Good morning, princess...” Applebloom says, before letting out a cute yawn as she stretches slightly in the cramped interior. “So, uh… did you and Twilight find a way to get me out of here yet?”

“Yes, Twilight has been working on a spell,” Luna nods. “Thou should be out within a day or two. We hope it is not too uncomfortable in there.”

“Oh, no, it’s fine...” Applebloom reassures her. “In fact, it’s probably the most comfortable I’ve been in a long time. I could stay in here for a while, easy. Beats workin at the farm, anyway...”

“Oh! It is good to know thou is enjoying yourself, at least,” Luna smiles. “Yes, a long time ago, ponies used to come to the castle from miles around just to spend some time relaxing within their princess’s belly. We always wondered what the appeal was.”

“Really? Heh...” Applebloom chuckled, sounding drowsy. “Wait.. was this a long time ago? If you swallowed them before you knew this spell you’re working on, how did they get out? What happened to ‘em?”

“Oh… um...” Luna stutters, realizing that she’s said too much, and is probably digging herself into an even deeper hole. Before she could make up an answer, though, there was a knock on the door, interrupting their little conversation. “Oh! There is somepony at the door! Hold on,” Luna said, putting the stethoscope away, and trotting down the stairwell. She pulled open the heavy wooden door to see a orange Earth pony standing before her, wearing a cowboy hat for whatever reason.

The pony seemed to a little shocked to have a princess answer the door, but composed herself quickly, immediately bowing before the alicorn. “Oh, my! Pleased to meet you, princess!”

“Oh please, the pleasure is all ours,” Luna waves a hoof, giving the pony permission to stand. “Thou must be one of Twilight’s friends, correct? One of the bearers of the elements?”

“Why yes I am! Name’s Applejack,” The mare said with a tip of her hat. “But listen. I can’t stick around for too long, I’ve got work to do back at the farm. I was just wondering-- has my little sis been by here? A little yellow filly with a big red bow? She was supposed to stop by this library last night and come right back, but I reckon she might’ve decided to spend the night here or something, ‘cause she still hasn’t come home.”

“A little yellow filly…?” Luna repeats, before coming to a realization. This must be Applebloom’s sister! Luna tries to act aloof as her mind races to think of a response.

The cyan pegasus grinned at her. "Hey G, great to see you, how have you been?" Rainbow Dash flew over to Gilda and gave her a hoof bump. "I've been doing great," answered Gilda. "but every pony besides you is still fleeing whenever I show up. Not that it helps the ones I set my eyes on." Rainbow Dash was only slightly nervous as she heard this, she was already used to this. "Well, can you blame them? By the way, have you eaten already?
132331.title: Gryphon facts of life.

1323312.content:
Gilda wanted to answer but a loud growling sound gave Rainbow Dash the answer. The pegasus mare looked only slightly nervous, she trusted Gilda not to eat her but this still meant that her old friend would look out for a pony to eat. "Alright then, in that case I guess you have to do what you have to do." Even though she was still a little nervous, she was pretty much used to this already and even watched Gilda a few times when she ate another pony. It was difficult for Rainbow Dash every time as Gilda's prey would always cry and beg Rainbow Dash to save them. "By the way, can I come along? I've made a few friends here in Ponyville and I would really prefer if you didn't eat them."

Gilda nodded, it was hard enough to find a friend when all ponies are on your menu so she wouldn't want to have Rainbow Dash fall out with her. "It's cool Dash, just point them out for me so I know not to eat them. But seriously, I'm starving." Normally any sensible pony would be running for the hills if they heard a gryphon say that but Rainbow Dash stayed calm. "Alright then, let's go for a fly." Gilda agreed and they made their way into town.

The news about Gilda's arrival spread fast, Ponyvilles streets were sweeped empty. One condition for gryphons was that they could not break into a home, that's why ponies that lived in a town visited by a gryphon usually only went out if absolutely necessary. What most ponies didn't know is that gryphons were usually not as fast as a well trained pony, so staying indoors all day and getting chubby just made them an easier meal if they had to go out. At first their search seemed to be fruitless when Gilda spotted somepony on the ground.
1323312.title: Hungry Hungry Gryphon

13233121.content:
Gilda pointed out the magenta mare walking on the ground with the smiling daisies cutie mark. "Looks like I found somepony, is that one of your friends or a pony I can't eat for some other reason?" Rainbow Dash gulped. She knew Ms. Cheerilee even though they weren't friends. Ms. Cheerilee was of age and did not have a foal, that means she was free game for Gilda. "No Gilda, you can eat her." Rainbow Dash felt a little knot in her stomach. She knew that she practically condemned Ms. Cheerilee to die as gryphon food but she couldn't take it back now either as Gilda was flying directly towards Ms. Cheerilee.

Ms. Cheerilee was in a hurry. Since she stayed behind in school today she only just heard about the gryphon moments ago. The teacher knew that the school was a public building and so it would not keep her safe, she had to hurry up and get home before she was found. In her hurry she did not notice a growing shadow underneath her until she felt a pressure and was knocked down. Ms. Cheerilee grunted and opened her eyes again, she gasped as she saw eagle claws next to her head, she was found by the gryphon. "Hi there, lunch." As she heard those words, Ms. Cheerilee started to tear up.

Rainbow Dash stayed in the air and watched the spectacle, Gilda lifted Ms. Cheerilee up to her mouth. The teacher was crying and begging, as she noticed Rainbow Dash she started to scream. "Rainbow Dash! Please help me I don't want to end up in a gryphons stomach." Rainbow Dash could do nothing but look solemnly at her. "Sorry Cheerilee, but you know the rules, she is perfectly in her right to do this and I can't help you." Ms. Cheerilee stared at the pegasus in disbelieve before her eyes were drawn back to the open back before her. A weak no was the only thing she managed to say before her muzzle disappeared inside of it.

Betrayal and fear surged through the teachers mind as her chin touched the gryphons tongue. In all her life she would have never believed that this would be her end, eaten by a gryphon. Cheerilee knew about the laws and that there was nothing anypony could do, this only added to her feeling of total defeat as she slid down the gryphons throat. She desperately tried to kick but this only made her slide down even faster. Eventually, her rear hooves lost touch with the cool air and the beak clamped shut around them, completely sealing her fate. Cheerilee was then pushed through a tight ring and dropped down in some sort of chamber. Ms. Cheerilee cried to herself as she curled up, she knew enough about biology to know what happens next.

On the outside, Rainbow Dash watched as Gilda gobbled up Ms. Cheerilee. A strange feeling that she hasn't felt since her time with the junior speedsters welled up inside of her as she watched the bulge that Ms. Cheerilee made travel down Gilda's throat. As Gilda closed her beak and send the teacher into her belly with a few more gulps it started to dawn on Rainbow Dash what this strange feeling was. This strange feeling she got as she watched the swaying gut was, without a doubt.

Fortunately, Rainbow Dash was a mare of action. Anything Gilda had to say was halted by a sudden hug. After a few moments in the embrace, Gilda slowly returned the favor, unsure about what was really going on in her friend's head. "Listen, Gilda, there's something I gotta confess to you..."

Breaking the embrace, Rainbow began whispering something to Gilda.

132331212.title: Lion Taming

1323312121.content:
Gilda had been taken aback, to say the least. She might’ve expected this from another griffon, but this was the furthest thing from the reaction she expected from a pony. After all, Gilda was currently in the process of digesting one of Rainbow Dash’s own kind. How could Dash possibly be enjoying that? Gilda’s first assumption was the pegasus must be lying for some reason. Perhaps Rainbow Dash was just trying to relate to her? After all, griffon culture and pony culture couldn’t be further at odds. Perhaps Dash was just extending an olive branch? Then again, there was also the possibility that Dash had a more sinister purpose. Perhaps Dash was trying to mock her, passive-aggressively? Gilda had stared into her friend's eyes for a few seconds, trying to discern her motive, but the pegasus’s expression revealed nothing. Sighing, Gilda had decided to take the direct route; lying on her back, presenting her distended belly into full view, and daring the pegasus to prove herself.

“W-what?” Rainbow Dash stuttered, though she could hardly speak through the lump in her throat.

“You heard me. In Griffonstone, it’s customary to offer belly rubs after a friend has a ‘big meal’,” Gilda explained smugly, wriggling her belly back and forth, taunting the flustered mare. “So if you’re such a big fan, here’s a prime opportunity. Start rubbin’.” From the tone of her voice, it seemed like the pegasus wouldn’t have a choice either way. Guided by the massive predator’s demands, she slowly approached her friend’s belly, which by itself was almost the size of her entire body. Her eyes scanned everywhere else they could; glancing over the griffon’s powerful, muscular thighs, and staring briefly into her friend’s proud, piercing eyes. The eyes of a predator. By the time she finally laid eyes on the griffon’s belly, she was already light-headed with arousal.

“Oh Celestia...” Rainbow Dash whispers to herself, wide-eyed. This was the first time she had gotten a really good, long look at the griffon’s belly. It was almost as big as her entire body! It squeezed tightly over the mare inside, vaguely showing the form of the doomed earth pony. A shudder ran up Rainbow Dash’s spine every time she saw the tight skin bulge or contract. She watched as, despite the mare’s protests, the belly squeezed in tighter and tighter around her, trying to immobilize the squirming mare so she can be digested without resistance. She was sure the mare was screaming, but her screams were completely silenced by the thick belly walls. Rainbow Dash bit her lip. The Griffon’s stomach was so… so powerful. It was just taking a full grown mare -- a living, thinking, feeling being -- and grinding her up like it was nothing.

As the reality of the situation dawned on her, Rainbow Dash was filled with a primal fear. Almost every part of her psyche told her that this was dangerous, and that she should run away as fast she could. And somehow, her fear only made her more aroused. “I’m waiting,” Gilda teased.

Rainbow Dash’s entire body shuddered as she laid her hooves on the griffon’s humongous belly. It felt like sparks of lightning were going off inside her chest. It felt so... surreal. She hadn’t felt anything like it. She locked her hind legs together, trying futilely to hide her arousal as she began softly kneading the thick, distended flesh. Her heart fluttered as she could feel the sleek body of the mare continuing to wriggle and squirm. She could imagine Cheerilee trapped in there, wriggling, struggling, begging for help. “Huh. You’re… eager,” Gilda raised a brow, surprised by how excited Rainbow Dash seemed. Rainbow Dash’s rubbing grew faster and faster, and in response, more and more gastric acid was kneaded onto Cheerilee’s flesh. Rainbow Dash’s heart sunk as she realized that, by offering a belly rub, she was directly speeding up Cheerilee’s painful demise. Her hooves were shaking so much, it was hard to stand.

“Aaah...” Gilda sighed, enjoying the massage. She was used to getting belly rubs from griffons, who had sharp, jagged talons, so getting a massage from a pony’s soft flat hooves was a nice change of pace. “You really were being honest, weren’t you?” Though Gilda believed Rainbow Dash was being honest now, she still didn’t understand the situation. How could a pony possibly be enjoying this? Being on the bottom of the food chain, weren’t ponies instinctively wired to be terrified of this kind of thing? But when Gilda took a good look at how her friend was acting, and the look on Rainbow Dash’s face, everything suddenly clicked into place. “Hold on a second…” Gilda says, filled with realization. “I get it now. You don’t just like this. You’re getting off on this, aren’t you?”

Rainbow Dash’s face was instantly flush with a bright shade of red. “U-u-ummm...” She stuttered, trying to think of a response, but only making herself more obvious.

“Hahaha! Oh Celestia, Rainbow Dash!” Gilda said through uproarious laughter, interrupting the massage. “You’re one of those those predator fetishists, aren’t you?”

“A what?” Rainbow Dash asked.

Gilda stood up and moved in close, leaning ominously over Rainbow Dash so closely that the mare could smell her meaty breath. “Isn’t it obvious? Most ponies run the other way when they see predators coming, but you, well, you get aroused by the thought of being digested, don’t you?” Many monsters swallow ponies whole. Hydras, manticores, quarray eels… the appetites of these creatures has been a constant threat to ponies for generations. Thus, all ponies are instinctively wired to fear being swallowed, above all else. However, back in Griffonstone, there were rumors of ponies who had that instinct reversed -- instead, they were aroused by the thought of being swallowed whole. Gilda always assumed the idea was just a joke, but apparently, Rainbow Dash had been one of those legendary fetishists the entire time. Come to think of it, that explains a lot. Gilda always assumed that Rainbow Dash was simply brave to have befriended her, but maybe the pegasus had been secretly wishing to be devoured...

Rainbow Dash knew that she couldn’t hide it anymore. She just had to let the truth come out, and let Gilda react however she was going to react. “Yeah…” She admitted, squeezing her eyes shut, not wanting to see the expression on her childhood friend’s face.

Her confidence returned since this Trixie girls would need an amazing performance to top that.

Trixie sighed and slipped her hat off, removing her ID card concealed within. She floated in front of the unicorn's face. "You see that under Trixie's name?"

The unicorn looked. "'N-C-D.' What does NCD stand for?"

Trixie grinned. "Necessary Cannibalism Defect. The lay-pony's name for a rather rare genetic defect. Well, rare in that it does not effect most who have it. There are two forms of this defect. Active and Inactive. Normally when somepony is born with this defect, generally inheriting it from their parents, they get Inactive NCD. Not only do they show no signs, but they will likely never even know there's anything wrong with them... Aside from the occasional odd fetish or an unusually strong stomach. However... a few of us, such as the Great and Powerful Trixie have Active NCD. At some point in their late childhood or young adulthood, they start to show certain... symptoms, and the pony will need to begin devouring others to live, if they go too long without feeding, the symptoms will return and their body will shut down. Trixie doesn't understand all the details. But thanks to her one flaw, laws around things such as murder and cannibalism are a bit more... lax."

"What?!"

Twilight fell onto her backside in shock. Trixie had eaten Applejack, her friend and one of the Elements of Harmony, and she couldn't do ANYTHING about it! Trixie winced at the pitiful sight and felt slightly guilty.

Trixie sighed and gave the purple unicorn a pat on the head. "Trixie is... sorry for you. When she came to, Twilight found herself outside, or rather inside the Everfree. Chrysalis stood over her. "Good, your awake." Twilight immediately began to flare up her horn but was immediately struck by the queen.

"Ahahah~ I wouldn't do that if I were you. After all, there's no telling what will happen to your little dragon friend if you attack me or try to escape." Chrysalis motioned to a couple of the changelings with her, who wer currently standing next to a restrained purple dragon.

"Don't you dare touch him."

"I won't... as long as you behave. I need you Sparkle..." Chrysalis softly placed a hoof on Twilight's cheek. "You're brave, smart, kind... a good leader. ...A good queen."

"What are you talking about?"

Chrysalis sighed and looked at her children. "Twilight, I'm certain you remember our... departure from Canterlot? My children... were not fortunate. You are looking at the last changelings in the world."

"So? It was your own fault f-"

SMACK

"My fault?! Is it my fault my people have to hide their true selves so they won't be attacked as monsters? My fault my people suffer and starve while yours have everything just given to them? Life isn't all black and white, good and evil. I had no choice."

She looked Twilight in the eyes. "You think I caused you to suffer Sparkle? Caused your brother to suffer? You know NOTHING of suffering. We are left to starve because we are different. I had to watch thousands of my children DIE because of what your brother and his bride did."

There was a long uncomfortable silence.

"You don't even know, do you? Of course not. You, Sparkle, are looking at the last of our kind. And when we die we will be gone forever... Not that you care. What's another species disappearing as long as Equestria remains perfect, hmm?"

Again silence. This time however it was broken by a much more disturbing sound. One of the changelings began to make a horrible choking noise, collapsing to the ground as he gripped his throat.

"NO!" Chrysalis, much to Twilight's surprise, ran to the Changeling's side, leaving her completely unguarded. Chrysalis held the suffering changeling in her forehooves holding it close to her and began to comfort it, softly rocking it back and forth as she sang a soft somber song.

"Hush now, my baby, be still love don't cry...
Sleep as you're rocked by the stream.
Sleep and remember my last lullaby...
So I'll be with you as you dream..."

As the song ended the changeling slowly stopped moving. Chrysalis lowered her face and, again surprising Twilight, began to cry. After a few moments she raised her head and looked back at Twilight.

"Now, now do you see? We suffer and die, and for what? I could not save my children, but at least I can save my people..."

Twilight looked at Chrysalis, and after a few seconds she found words. "What do you need me to do?"

Chrysalis gave a small sincere smile and looked over at her remaining children. "I... I am dying Twilight Sparkle."

Every face in the clearing showed shock.

"I am without an heir and without a queen to guide them, my last remaining children will die. I need you to become the new changeling queen."

Twilight was again shocked. "How?"

"I will give you the last 'gift' I can give. You will be... corrupted in a sense, taking a form more suitable. And... you will gain my power as well. The hivemind will be yours... All you need to do is build one."

Twilight stared at the dying race before her. How could she possibly accept this? To become... like Chrysalis? Her eyes trailed over to the other changelings as she was lost in thought. But could she at the same time, let them just die?

Sleep as you're rocked by the stream.
Sleep and remember my last lullaby
so I'll be with you while you dream."

Chrysalis looked to the sky as she continued

"River, oh river flow gently for me.
Such precious cargo you bare.
Do you know somewhere where she can be free?
River... deliver her... there..."

As the last words words passed Chrysalis's lips her eyes closed and her hoof fell limply to the ground. Chrysalis, queen of the changelings, invader of Canterlot, was dead.

The changelings and Twilight cried, the changelings had lost their mother, and Twilight had lost the only one who could teach her what she could do.

"It figures the last thing she'd do would be to sing about herself." Rainbow scoffed.

Applejack removed her hat and placed it against her chest, a sign of respect to their fallen adversary. "Ah dun think she was Rainbow."

"What?"

"Couldn't you tell? She was singing about Twilight."

------------

Chrysalis's funeral was short, they couldn't do anything fancy. Just a hole behind the library to bury her in. Twilight marked it with a stone, and with the help of the remaining changelings carved the following words into it.

"Here lies Chrysalis
Mother and Leader of many
Let her name never be forgotten."

Afterwards, she and her friends returned to the library while the changelings disappeared back into town, disguised once more.

"So now what are you going to do Twilight?" Fluttershy asked.

"I... I don't know... I feel so tired..." Twilight replied, "I... I'll see you all tomorrow, alright?"

As her friends left, Twilight went upstairs to her room, laying on her bed.

"Why did she have to die... I can't do this alone..."

She slowly drifted to sleep.

13513111112121.content:
Sunlight shined into Twilight's room through her window, waking the sleeping changeling to be.

"Mmmm... morning already?" Twilight asked no one in particular. Her stomach growled loudly as she got out of bed. "Wow I'm starving! This must be that hunger Chrysalis mentioned..."

Twilight sighed. "So, I need love now... Ugh... that kind of limits my choices..." She gave it some thought. Her friends were full of love, and as much as she regretted it, she really needed that right now.

"Sorry guys..." Twilight said as she started to head out toward the home of her target.
13513111112121.title: The Hunger

135131111121211.content:
With a heavy heart, Twilight made her way towards Rainbow Dash's cloud house. It was high above the ground and nopony would interrupt her. Twilight could see some Changelings gathering around her. They were disguised as townsponies but somehow Twilight knew that they were changelings. As she was underneath Rainbow Dash's home, she cast a cloudwalking spell on herself and wanted her new subjects to lift her up. Before she even said the order, two changelings that were disguised as pegasi lifted her up and placed her in front of the cloudhouse. Twilight guessed that this was some sort of telepathic link with the swarm, soon she would become a full fledged changeling queen.

Nervously, Twilight crept into the home of her soon to be meal, careful to avoid any noises, despite the fact that she walked on clouds. Slowly she made her way to the bedroom, where she heard loud snoring. Peeking her head around the corner she saw her target, sleeping on a bed made of clouds. With nervousness and sadness in her heart, she went to the bed and took a good look at her friend, possibly the last look she would ever get of her. Then suddenly a thought came to her, the mouth was not the only way the prey could be eaten.
135131111121211.title: Rainbow Dash

1351311111212111.content:
The possibilities went through Twilights head but were discarded. If she would do this to one of her friends, the least she could do was leave her some dignity. Rainbow Dash turned on her belly and exposed her hind legs to Twilight. With shaking hooves, Twilight grabbed Rainbow Dash's hind hooves and led them to her mouth. She opened widely and put the hooves into her mouth. The first thing she noticed that Rainbow was... delicious. For one moment she almost forgot who it was she was tasting. Her stomach growled, urging her to continue.

Rainbow Dash woke up to something wet on her legs. "Wha? What is that?" For one moment she panicked, did she wet her cloud? That was impossible, she was a grown pony and she has been to the bathroom before she went to sleep. She quickly looked down at herself and gasped at what she saw. Twilight Sparkle was currently sucking her legs down, almost reaching her hips. "Twilight, what are you doing?" She asked, only getting an apologetic and sad look in return. "Twi, let me go, please." Rainbow Dash was getting scared, was this because Twilight was a changeling queen now?

Twilight feared this moment, the moment one of her friends would beg for her life and she couldn't stop. The hunger was overwhelming now, it felt like she would go crazy if she didn't eat Rainbow Dash right now. Twilight continued to suck the scared pegasus down her esophagus. Rainbow Dash meanwhile continued to beg as she watched herself getting eaten. "No, don't do this. I don't wanna die, not like this." Rainbow Dash was crying by the time Twilight moved to her chest. "I wanted to become a Wonderbolt at least before I die. I thought we were friends." Twilight was heartbroken by this, but had no choice but to finish what she started. "I'll do whatever you want, just please have mercy." Rainbow Dash could no longer beg afterwards as he head was also engulfed by Twilights lips. The new queen of changelings gulped a few times, sending Rainbow Dash into her stomach where she would be digested.

Rainbow Dash was curled up, unable to move at all. From all sides the digestive juices coated her body but Rainbow Dash didn't struggle, she knew that this was the end for her. A strange, numb feeling spread across her body as she could feel herself becoming soft. Her hooves were starting to turn into goo, which was quickly absorbed by Twilights stomach. Luckily for Rainbow Dash, her nerves seemed to have been damaged already so she won't be in pain, that was at least some comfort for her. Slowly she was becoming liquid as piece of piece of Rainbow Dash's body started to drift off, leaving her almost an amorphous blob. Soon she passed away, nothing remaining of her.

Twilight meanwhile cried for her friend, she hoped that this was the only time she ever had to do this. Rainbow Dash left her with a little layer of fat and Twilight could swear she felt some sort of pressure in her back but she didn't care about that for now.

135131111121211111.title: Crash Course

1351311111212111112.content:
"Wait... where am I? ...Wh- Who am I?" Twilight looked around in horror. "What's going on?!"

As if sensing her alarm a group of unfamiliar figures approached.

"N-no! Stay back!"

"My queen?" One of them questioned, "Is everything alright? You seem panicked. Are you injured?"

"Y-your queen?" Twilight said, "Wait me?"

"Of course my queen. What's wrong?"

"I... I can't remember anything..." Twilight said rubbing her head, "Who... Who am I?"

Another of the figures spoke up. "You are Twilight Sparkle. Chosen heir of the fallen queen Chrysalis. You are the new queen of the changelings."

He looked around, noticing that other ponies were starting to investigate the crash site.

"We should move."

--------

The ten figures led Twilight into a dark forest, eventually stopping at a clearing.

"Alright, this will do..."

One by one, each of the figures was engulfed in green flame, when the flames cleared in their place were terrifying creatures.

"Ahhhh!" Twilight couldn't help it, she screamed.

The creatures before her looked hurt. "My queen..." one of them stated, "We did not mean to offend... We just thought you'd appreciate us showing you our true forms."

Something clicked in Twilight's head. Images of a castle... a mare and stallion... hundreds... no thousands of creatures like the ones before her... and one that was... different. Taller. Stronger.

"I... I remember. I'm sorry."

The changelings look at each other. They speak amongst themselves.

"She doesn't seem well... What should we do?"

"Perhaps we should speed up the transformation..."

"In her state? Are you sure?"

"Of course not, but we desperately need a full fledged queen!"

"Excuse me." Twilight interjected, "But don't I get some say in this?"

"Oh, of... of course your majesty."

"Could you... explain the reasoning behind speeding up this transformation you mentioned?"

"Alright. You see, your body is changing to adapt to new powers it has been given. If we speed up the process you could get all of your powers in a matter of days instead of weeks."

"And the risks?"

"Well... there's a... non-zero chance that, among other side effects, you won't be quite... yourself afterword."

"Well then, I'll just need to think about this..."

And so she did. She's afraid and confused... but maybe with these powers, some of that fear will go away... on the other hand, what if doing it caused her to lose any chance of regaining her lost memories?

13513111112122.content:
Twilight found herself in a open field. The grass around her withered and dying. In the distance however, she could see life, a grand river surrounded by flora.

"Where am I?" Twilight wondered aloud, looking at the strange place before her as she found herself walking toward the river. As she approached it, she noticed a lone, robed figure resting by the river. "Hello? Who are you?"

The figure turned, a pair of familiar green eyes stared at Twilight. "Hello again my child."

"Chrysalis?!" Twilight ran to her, spontaneously hugging the changeling. "But how? I saw you die... I buried you!"

Chrysalis laughed. "You're in the land of dreams young queen. Death means little here."

Twilight looked her up and down. "What's with the robe?"

Chrysalis looked at it. The dark black robe that covered her body, hiding her wings, it was truly dark, seeming to almost absorb the light around it. "...It's a ceremonial robe..."

"For what kind of ceremony?" Twilight asked curiously, "It's rather... simple, although it's still very beautiful."

"...For funerals."

"Oh."

Chrysalis shook her head. "It's fine. A little reminder that I'm dead won't hurt me any."

She grins and looks at Twilight. "Besides, I'm more interested in your appearance."

"My appearance?" Twilight looked into the river, the image before her startled her, instead of the face she was used to seeing, she saw a face more fitting of a changeling queen. She was taller, rivaling Chrysalis in height. A pair of insect like wings stuck out of her back. Her mane and tail had faded to white. Her purple fur was all but gone, replaced by a dark black carapace although there were a pair of tufts on her shoulders, having become a mere decoration. Her eyes were still purple, but the pupils were now bestial slits. Her horn was long and crooked. And her teeth...

"I have FANGS!"

Chrysalis laughed. "What did you expect, you're a changeling now. I think you look amazing."

Twilight looked at herself. "I've already changed? It's only been a day.."

"Not exactly. You likely only appear like this in your dream because of my influence." Chrysalis explained. "Now then, I believe you said something about still needing me? I think I should be able to help you still like this."

"Thank you."

"Now, I believe there's only one thing you absolutely need to know about. The hunger will be coming to you soon. Maybe even by the time you wake up." Chrysalis grinned as she continued, "You will need to feed."

"So... somepony will have to die?"

I apologise that I may have used something drastic today, and I hope not to use it again in the future, unless class order has been disrupted greatly again.” She then told the class, “ For homework, I am going to give slightly less as a result of your good behaviour. Finish pages 20 – 22 on your Biology workbook, that is the pages on the naming of digestive system organs and their functions, and read up the next chapter on the skeletal system, from pages 56 to page 64. You are dismissed.” As soon as she finished, the ringing of the school bell is heard throughout the school, meaning that the curriculum has ended for the day. For Scootaloo and the class, this is a silent ‘sigh of relief’. Scootaloo thought, “Finally… At least this ordeal can end, now I need to find Apple Bloom and Sweetie Belle to catch up on what I have missed.”

The foal students then prepared to pack up their belongings and leave the schoolhouse for home. A few foals stayed behind to consult Cheerilee and clarify concepts on the digestive system, which Cheerilee is willing and delighted to answer, though not in the manner in which she punished Scootaloo. As these foals left, Cheerilee decided to let Scootaloo out, but not in this classroom, for it will make a noticeable mess. Being the caring teacher she is, she then decided to pack up Scootaloo’s lightweight kit for her, before taking it for Scootaloo and moving onto a more secluded location to let Scootaloo out, with Scootaloo struggling to maintain her posture inside her fleshy prison.

As Cheerilee moved around the school halls and grounds, she finally came across a location whereby the mess can be cleaned up easily. “Ahh… This will be a decent spot, now it is time to let Scootaloo out”. Cheerilee thought.

Where will this location be?

In the middle of the dark night, a candle flickers in the distance as the frantic shuffling of papers breaks the silence of the house. Purple hooves are seen managing papers and organising notes in a speedy way, as if to quickly review some core data and take the next

As a Biology Tutor, Cheerilee was not always this anxious. On most days, she would often look forward to teaching her next lesson at the Ponyville Schoolhouse. Not today. As she poured through her observation notes and reports from her superiors, especially the Schoolhouse Ponyhouse, she realised that a lot is at stake. She did not make any threats, but told Cheerilee that she may need to intervene if things continue to worsen.

Therefore, Cheerilee knows that she needs to turn this around… Biology is one of her most passionate subjects, but it is also one which is difficult for her to teach and maintain her students’ interest. 14122.content:
Being the realistic tutor, Cheerilee knows that she is mainly on her own in the middle of the night. With most other ponies in a state of slumber, she knows that, as a tutor, she must lead by example and not be impolite to the fellow town inhabitants. Luckily, she is also a very creative tutor, willing to consider all possibilities, even controversial ones. It is the reason why the Headpony trusted her so much: she knows her options well and she can implement them well.

As she poured through her previous lesson plans, she came across a rather interesting idea for her new lesson on digestion. Initially, she would put it as the last resort, being concerned about the potential implications it may bring to her young students. But after mulling over the idea, she realised that the students are likely to be old enough to understand what is going on and that she has a number of safeguards to ensure her students and her own safety.

The idea is this. In the secret privacy of the Biology room, two ponies would be involved in the demonstration. One pony will be the predator (who must not eat anything beforehand to reduce the muck) and the other pony will be the prey. The predator will then swallow up the prey pony, who has previously and thoroughly applied an anti-acid potion, just in case protection is needed. The prey pony will also be hooked up to a location sensor and a first-pony camera to give students an interactive perspective of the prey pony as the pony is ingested. In this way, the student ponies can have a more holistic learning style.

Cheerilee also knows that ponies cannot digest each other, particularly because their stomach acids are only strong enough to digest plant matter, not animal fibre. Futhermore, in case things get a little tricky, she has three other potions. The first, a lubricant which makes the swallowing much easier to do. The second, a potion similar to the Syrup of Ipecac, which motivates the ponies to throw up their prey if they are unable to do so. And the third, a potion which forces the prey pony up if the predator chokes on them.

The result: A flawless plan… The ponies involved will not be severely harmed and everypony should be able to continue normally, with the exception of the prey needing to take a shower to clean off the acids… and the pungent smell.

There is only one missing detail: Which ponies will be involved?

As Cheerilee thought intensely over this idea, she finally came to a resolution…
