"We can get through this!" Lyra reassured Bonbon, "We both want to stay together don't we?" Bonbon nodded. "Of course! But you have to admit the romance isn't quite there anymore." Lyra looked down. Bonbon was right, their marriage was failing. But maybe there was something they could do...
15133111122112.title: Let Bonbon out again.

choices: No, but you'll become a part of me.
151331111221121.content:
Lyra looked around while she was trying to think of something. Her look fell on the vial sitting on the table, a little bit of the potion was still left. She was curious about the potion so she brought the vial with her when she carried Bonbon upstairs. "Say Bonbon, how about you get a turn being predator?" The tan mare gasped in surprise as Lyra levitated the vial in front of her. "Come on Bonbon, aren't you at least a little bit curious what it would feel like?"

Bonbon had to admit it, she wondered what her wife felt like when she swallowed her. Also, Lyra's stomach was actually pretty warm and cozy once you got over how slimy it was. Lyra shook the vial a little but then she had a more serious expression. "How about it, you eat me and if you feel our marriage can still be saved you let me out. If you believe that it's hopeless you digest me." Bonbon gasped at Lyra's idea but was also touched by the fact that she was also willing to sacrifice her life for her. Without a word she took the vial in her mouth and downed the rest of the liqiud. After the strange feeling passed she looked at her wife who closed her eyes, ready to be eaten.

Like Lyra did it before, Bonbon started with a kiss and then slowly engulfed her wifes head. Slowly she took in more of the unicorns body as Lyra pushed against her to help her swallow. Bonbon was a little worried about the horn first but she managed to get it down her throat without injuring herself. As Bonbon reached Lyra's belly she grabbed her wife's flanks and raised them above her head. Now the act was a lot easier for Bonbon as her wife practically slid down herself. She too took the time to pleasure her wife, possibly for the last time, before gulping down the rest of her.

With a happy sigh Bonbon leaned back, Lyra was still moving in her stomach and started to speak up. "So Bonny, do you think this might work out again?" Bonbon thought carefully, this was not just a question wether their marriage would remain or fail but also a question if Lyra is going to live or die.
151331111221121.title: Give Bonbon a turn to be the predator

1513311112211211.content:
This feeling was exciting, her wife was showing her so much trust, laying her life into her hooves. Bonbon longed to have the feeling back from when they first fell in love and now the flame of love was returning. "Oh Lyra, I can feel it. The same spark I felt when I fell in love with you." In her stomach Lyra was also happy.

"I feel it too. Being so close to you, to entrust you with my life, Bonbon I think I love you now even more than before." Lyra felt a pressure around her as Bonbon hugged her through her belly.

"This was the answer we were looking for." Bonbon continued to hug her own belly with Lyra in it while her wife pushed against the walls of her stomach. Only a small gurgle brought them out of their moment. "I better let you out now, wait a minute." Bonbon coughed and hacked until the mint green horn of her wife became visible again. Slowly Lyra reemerged from the depths of Bonbon's esophagus, covered in slime but still conscious.

Lyra gasped for air before she pulled Bonbon into a tight embrace. "We need to do this more often, this feeling was amazing."

Bonbon slowly started to understand her wife's fetish. When Lyra offered herself as a meal she had shown trust and commitment that went farther than anything they had ever known and the two of them became closer than ever before. The two of them were now making out on their bed, the old flames of love rekindled.
1513311112211211.title: Yes, the feelings are back.

1513311112211212.content:
This was far from an easy decision in Bon Bons mind. Entering this little venture, she’d been more than a little desperate to conserve the romance that had sparked 8 years prior between the two mares. Bon Bon loved Lyra with an undying passion and she had been ready to do anything to fix what had inexplicably been broken in recent years. And here she sat in bed with that same unicorn she’d taken to the winter-chime ball, and then to Manehattan, and ultimately the altar, nestled in her stomach awaiting her approval or disapproval of their marriage status. The weight wasn’t just from Lyra that was certain. Well everything was right with it of course! They were both willing to risk their own hides for the others contentment, there was no reason to believe otherwise!

But now that this element of power had been laid out in front of her the entire dilemma was coming into an entirely new perspective. Why had they been fighting so much? Why was their no excitement between the two where once it was in abundance? Whose fault was it, Bon Bon or Lyras? Bon Bons mind raced at max output searching for the answers she needed; cataloging every event where either of them may have been at fault for some percentage of the damages dealt.

“Uh…Bon Bon? You uh…gonna let me go or keep me? It’s starting to get a bit stuffy in here so if you want me out you’d best hurry it up” Bon Bon heard Lyra loud and clear and it was time for a hard decision to be made. She’d thought through it all and though it made her a bit nervous, she knew that their situation wasn’t a fluke or a result of being cooped up together for so long. Somepony was responsible and things weren’t going to work out if Lyra was let free. But Bon Bon loved Lyra no matter if their marriage was broken, the same as she had all those years ago. She never wanted Lyra to leave her, so she decided it was time to digest the mare she so loved and make her her’s to love.

“I’m…not letting you out Lyra” said Bon Bon with solemn compassion, she was serious and she needed Lyra to understand that. From the power of that single statement, immediately Bon Bon felt the gravity of the situation catch up to her. The mare she had said yes so merrily to was about to be melted down into nothing more than nutrients like one of her own candies. In simple terms, Lyra was going to die inside her. And she was allowing this to happen. Oh would Lyra forgive her?

“Oh…well alright Bonnie. I suppose that’s…that. I still love you sweet heart,” muttered Lyra with a soothing sincerity. That was all Bon Bon needed. That simple little speech was what she needed to permit her actions to pass by her conscious. Lyra was going to be hers forever, and both mares were willing and ready to begin. Bon Bon smiled, not like a filly who had received her most desired object, but a married mare who felt the compassion of her spouse despite everything they had lived through and would live through. Well, perhaps not this time. “I love you too sweet cake.

Bon Bon immediately let her tense body relax, slithering under the covers and letting pass a passionate sigh. She patted the bulge under the covers contently, listening to it moan. Digestion had not yet kicked in, and indeed it would likely take quite a while for the mare of her dreams to well and truly be gone. So for now, Lyra lay nuzzled up in a tiny ball feeling the comforting warmth of Bon Bons stomach feeling as happy as any doomed pony could be. Bon Bon felt her wife move inside her and it was a certainly unique experience. ‘This must be like what having kids is like’ she thought.

“Probably less apparent though.” Bon Bon was a little surprised when she heard Lyra speak up in response to her thoughts, as if she could hear her inside her head. A ridiculous notion of course. “Of course.” Okay now it was definitely more than a coincidence. “ Lyra honey, are you reading my thoughts?” asked Bon Bon. “Yep” was all Lyra had to say. “How in Celestias name are you managing that? I never knew you could do that!” “Well, to be honest I’ve only been practicing since last week but If I do say so myself I’ve made impressive progress” Lyra said with a certain degree of smugness. Hearing this abrupt realization sunk in and Bon Bon realized her moral dilemma from earlier had been broadcast to Lyra loud in clear. And she was able to hear that she was realizing she had only just realized Lyra was there when she-

“Yes yes Bon Bon, I was there. Well…not quite.” That was a tad confusing. “What’dya mean hun?” Bon Bon asked. “I’m uh, not too good at it just yet, and it takes an awful lot out of me. So I only heard up to a certain point and…” The pause was unnerving. “…who’s fault did you decide it was?” Bon Bon meddled with the bed sheets a bit, nervous to say.

“Well Lyra, sweetie, in my opinion it seems to have been…”
1513311112211212.title: One and Together.

151331112.title: Lyra Option 2

1513311121.content:
Lyra loved the weekends. It was all too easy to just lay back on the couch, snuggle up with her wife, and doze off in the comfort of their home. Today, however, she had to settle for two out of three. Her wife had stepped out earlier that morning with little explanation. "You'll find out soon enough," she had teased.

No sense worrying about it. I'll just nap here while I wait...

------

"I'm back!"

Silence.

"Lyra, honey?" Bonbon stepped into the living room, setting down her saddlebags upon hearing that familiar light snore. She then grinned at the sight of the minty unicorn passed out on the couch in that silly way she always sat. A mischievous grin grew upon Bonbon's face. As silently as she could, she snuck up on the unsuspecting mare, putting her own face close to that fluffy green belly and...

BFHFHFHFHFHFHFHFHT

Lyra was jolted into the waking world by a relentless raspberry from somepony. Her initial anger quickly vanished as she recognized the form of her spouse. "Now what did you do that for?", Lyra asked in mock outrage.

"Oh, you were just sitting there with that big tummy of yours exposed for all the world to see! How am I supposed to help myself when you do that?"

"Hey, the only reason I'm so chubby is because of you," Lyra replied as she playfully nudged the candymaker. "So, what's the big surprise?"

Bonbon trotted back to her saddlebags. "I heard about this neat little trust exercise we could try out. First-"
"Wait, a trust exercise? Bonnie, we don't need a trust exercise, do we? I'd trust you completely!"
"Oh, honey, it's not about that, it just sounded like fun! As I was saying, first we need this little brew here..."

The creamy mare reached into the discarded saddlebags, and pulled out a large, unlabeled bottle. The liquid inside was a mysterious electric blue in color.

"Uh, Bonnie?"

Glug, glug glug... She realized that Bonbon really was going to chug the whole thing in one go! With a naughty smile, Lyra realized that she of all ponies should know that her Bonnie could do things like that. Before she could get too lost in her honeymoon flashback, however, Bonbon finished the mystery beverage and joined her on the couch.

1513311122.content: 3. Lyra has a love for eating other ponies, but has given up her habit for the sake of her girlfriend, Bon Bon. But as the months pass by, the temptation continues to eat away at her, until she just can't take it anymore. Will their relationship survive Lyra's unusual passion?
1513311122.title: Lyra Option 3

15133111221.content:
It was a cold, desolate night along the flowery plains that dot the border of the Everfree forest-- completely silent and empty, save for one young, mint green mare sneaking through the shrubbery. Even in the darkness, any passing observer would have been able to notice one unusual thing about the strange mare: her belly swaying beneath her was humongous, almost touching the ground. Still, those observers would likely assume she was just heavily pregnant, or that they were just seeing things-- in truth, curled up in the mare’s stomach was an entire living, breathing pony. He had been squirming so much when she first gulped his body inch by inch down her throat, but now, nestled inside of her gut, the ceaseless humidity and relaxing swaying had caused the stallion within her to fall unconscious, never to wake again. She was now struggling to carry the weight of another pony beneath her as she lumbered through the shadowy fields. She reached a large cottage on the very outskirts of town and quickly ducked inside the front door, before sighing in relief as she closed the door behind her. “Alright, I made it…” She whispers to herself, triumphantly. “Now I just have to--”

Suddenly, she was blinded as all the cottage’s lights turned on at once. Her eyes widened as she saw her girlfriend-- a light yellow earth pony-- had been sitting by the fireplace, as if waiting for her to walk in. There was a long silence. “Lyra, I thought you said you were over this,” the earth pony mare growled calmly but sternly, not even bothering to look her in the eyes.

“Bon Bon, I--” Lyra immediately tried to explain herself, suddenly feeling ashamed of what she had done, but can’t find the words. “I am over this! I haven’t eaten a pony in months! I just… I slipped up, you know? Just give me this one!”

“We moved all the way to Ponyville to get away from this, Lyra,” Bon Bon replied, finally staring the unicorn in the eyes. “You wanted your second chance, and I gave up everything to give it to you.”

“I know, I know. I know what I put you through,” Lyra whimpers, edging closer to the other mare. “But this isn’t like that.”

“Who are they?” Bon Bon demanded. “Who did you eat?”

“It was just a stallion I met at the bar. He isn’t going to be missed, trust me,” Lyra insists. “There’s no way they’ll be able to trace it back to us.”

“Damn it, Lyra,” Bon Bon throws up her hooves, exasperated, before walking quickly out of the living room towards the bedroom, not wanting to deal with Lyra for another second. “That’s not the point.”

***

Lyra laid on her back on the couch, idly caressing her distended belly. They’d had that conversation before, but not for almost a year now. Not since they came to Ponyville. She silently cursed herself. Has she messed things up already? After all they’ve done for each other just to reach this point?

Every pony in Equestria was unique in their own way. Every pony has their own quirk… some more prominent than others. Lyra’s? Well, Lyra’s unique quirk was something special. Ever since she young, she had a passion for swallowing other ponies. They had a flavour unlike any food she had ever tasted, and their squirming desperately within her belly was pleasurable unlike any sensation she had ever experienced. The entire experience of gulping another pony down her throat was unparalleled. She never feels hesitant, or guilty-- to her, when a pony is wriggling in her belly, they aren’t a pony anymore, they’re just food. So for most of her life, her only hobby was gulping down other ponies whenever she got the opportunity. That changed for the first time when she met Bon Bon. Bon Bon was the first pony Lyra ever truly cared about, and they became close friends, and even started dating. Inevitably, Bon Bon learned of Lyra’s terrible secret-- but instead of freaking out and turning her in, she instead tried to wean her off her diet of ponies, to no avail. Eventually Lyra’s secret got out, and she was forced to leave Baltimare. This is when Lyra expected Bon Bon to give up on her, and stay behind-- instead, even then, Bon Bon stayed by her side, and they both travelled to Ponyville to start their new life together. Deeply touched by her friend’s sacrifice, Lyra vowed never to eat another pony again.

Until today. For the first time in her life, Lyra actually felt guilty for having eaten a pony. She hated to disappoint Bon Bon, after all she’s done for her. She looked down at her distended belly. It had already shrunken slightly as her stomach acids began to work on the unconscious stallion inside. She didn’t even know his name.

She had been having urges for months now. Every time she find herself alone with another, delicious pony, she could hardly restrain herself. She had desperately needed to feel another pony wriggle within her belly, one more time. Instead of doing anything about this, she just let the temptations fester, until she couldn’t take it anymore. On her way home from work, she stopped by the bar, met a stallion, flirted with him for a while, before leading him into a back room. The second he closed the door behind him, she had pounced. Over the years, she had gotten so good at this gruesome task that he slid down her throat in under 30 seconds, before he knew what hit him. She rested there for almost an hour, enjoying the feeling of the confused stallion desperately squirming inside of her, until he finally settled down, and she snuck out a window. She never realized how much she’d missed that sensation. It was the best thing she’d felt in months… but was it worth it?

Lyra looked at the clock, and realized how late it was at night. Luckily, she didn’t have to work tomorrow, but she still needed her sleep. She closed her eyes, and decided that she would make it up to Bon Bon the next morning.
15133111221.title: Shameful Indulgence

choices: Her temptation comes back during the day.
151331112211.content:
Lyra woke up early the next morning, long before Bon Bon was going to wake. Silently, so as not to disturb the sleeping mare, Lyra got ready to start the day. Her belly had completely returned to its previous size, allowing her to walk around freely. Lyra donned her saddlebags and snuck out the front door, skipping happily towards the rest of the town. She knew just the way to make things up to Bon Bon. There’s a dress Bon Bon has desperately been wanting, that Lyra has been planning to get her for their anniversary, but she figured it was the least she could do to get it for her early. Usually, Lyra hated getting up this early-- however, after having finally swallowed another pony again last night, Lyra was feeling as lively and upbeat as ever. She knew she should probably feel guilty and ashamed, but there was something about knowing her plump rear end jiggled with all that remains of a recently-digested pony that raised her spirits. Eating ponies was truly her passion-- surpassed by her love and devotion to Bon Bon, of course, but not by much.

On the way to the Boutique, her stomach grumbles. Is she hungry again already? Well, she figures it wouldn’t hurt if she stopped at a bakery along the way. Just as she was about to settle down with some delicious pastries, however, an earth pony tapped on her shoulder.

“Hey. Lyra, is it?” The purple mare asked. “Come on, we should talk.”

Lyra sat down at the booth, sitting across from the strange mare. “Uh… yeah,” Lyra shrugs. “Do I know you?”

“You don’t know me, but I certainly know you,” The mare smirked. Even though she hadn’t done anything yet, something about this mare seemed maniacal and scheming. “You’ve been making waves around here.”

“What do you mean?” Lyra asks, confused.

“I’ve heard a stallion disappeared from a bar downtown last night. Nopony quite knows what to make of it,” The mare whispered, almost tauntingly. “Would you happen to know anything about that?”

“Uh… no, I have no idea what you’re talking about,” Lyra denied everything, as panic began to creep in. Does this strange mare know? How could she?

“Oh please. You’re a horrible liar,” The mare giggled. “You swallowed him, didn’t you? Lured him out of sight of passersby, and gulped him down in seconds, just because you wanted to feel him wriggle in your belly.”

Lyra was shocked. She had left no evidence! “How… how do you know?”

“I know about everything that goes on in this town, honey. Trust me,” The mare chuckles. There was something about the way that the mare talked that made Lyra feel very small, and vulnerable. “Don’t worry. I’m not going to tell everypony your little secret. In fact, I’ve swallowed quite a few ponies myself...”

Lyra was confused and utterly speechless, so the mare continued. “You might think you’re the only one with your little kink, but you’re not,” The mare leans forward, as if getting down to business. “There are dozens of ponies across Equestria that do the exact same thing you do. What is unique is how easily you slipped him down your throat. How quickly you swaddled the entire stallion to sleep, and how expertly you got away with it. That’s talent.”

“Listen. I’m part of a group of mares and stallions that love the taste of their fellow ponies just as much as you do-- including the mayor herself, and several members of Ponyville’s levy of royal guards. We look out for each other, and coordinate together. We make sure none of us get caught, so we can gulp down as many ponies as our bellies desire,” The mare explains, whispering. “I just came here to make you an offer. With skills like that, you can join us any time you like, and we’ll open up a whole new world for you.”

Lyra continued to be stunned in her seat, and the mare rolled her eyes. “I understand it must be a lot to take in, so I’ll let you go think about it. The offer’s open any time,” The mare stated simply, getting up from the booth and walking off. “The name’s Berryshine. You’ll know where to find me.”

Lyra watched this ‘Berryshine’ walk out, stunned, and looked down at her plate for a moment, before pushing it away. Suddenly, she feels like she’s lost her appetite.

***

Lyra trots back towards her cottage, staring at the ground as she walked, the expensive dress nestled within her saddlebags. Why did this have to happen to her? Right as she was about to patch things up with Bon Bon, she just had to get hit with the opportunity of a lifetime. She tried to deny it, tried not to think about it-- but she had to be honest. The mare’s offer was enticing. If this was back in Baltimare, she definitely would’ve taken it. But this town was supposed to be a fresh start. It was supposed to symbolize her giving up her bad habit, for the sake of their love. Could she really throw all that away, and revert back to her old lifestyle?

Lyra immediately threw those thoughts to the side as she stepped into the house, and smiled as she saw Bon Bon sitting on the couch. Bon Bon glanced back at her as she approached.

“Oh, hey Lyra,” Bon Bon said. “I was wondering where you ran off to all morning.”

“Yeah, sorry. I felt bad about what I did last night, so I wanted to make it up to you,” Lyra smiles, hopping onto the couch next to her. “Guess what I got ya.”

Bon Bon look at her, looking skeptical at first, but going along with it anyway. “Alright, alright. What is it?”

“It’s...” Lyra announced melodramatically, as she slowly pulled the dress from one of her saddlebags. “That cute ruffle dress you’ve been wanting!”

Bon Bon, unfortunately, doesn’t react nearly as excited as Lyra hoped she would. Lyra was almost worried she was still mad at her, until Bon Bon gave her the most genuine smile she’d seen all week. “I love it, but... this isn’t what this was about. I don’t care about some fancy dress. I care about you,” Bon Bon explained to her, laying a hoof on her shoulder. “I know what a kind and loving mare you really are, deep down inside. And eating ponies… I know that you’re better than that. That’s what this is about.”

Lyra stared blankly into her eyes for a few moments. “So, uh… are you saying that I can take this dress back to the store, then? Because this thing was really expensive.”

Bon Bon tried to maintain her serious composure, but couldn’t keep it, and burst out laughing at her lover’s signature goofiness. “Oh, no! You’re not getting off that easy!” Bon Bon giggled, grabbing the dress out of Lyra’s grip. “We are definitely hitting the town tonight, and I am definitely wearing this. Lavender is going to loooove it.”

Lyra laughed along, relieved that everything was back to normal again, before Bon Bon walked to their room to try on the new dress. The conversation with the mare earlier was definitely still weighing on her mind… but she tried not to think about that right now. That was a decision she was going to leave for another day. Right now, she was going to focus on having a fun, normal day with the love of her life.
151331112211.title: A Strange Proposition

1513311122112.content:
It was three in the morning, and yet Lyra still couldn’t sleep. It had been an exhausting day. Bon Bon nestled up comfortably beside her in the bed, and Lyra so wanted to cuddle up to the sleeping mare and get some much-needed sleep. But she couldn’t. The stranger’s offer earlier that morning still rattled around in her head. To be able to gulp down ponies with impunity… to finally be able to meet other ponies that share her passion… maybe even to meet some willing prey… it was the kind of opportunity she had always been waiting for! But… all that is something that she’s supposed to have left behind. She’s given up on that lifestyle already, for the sake of both her and Bon Bon. Right?

… she had to be honest with herself. Her penchant for eating other ponies was something she was never going to escape. It was part of who she was. She loved Bon Bon with all of her heart, but… this kind of desire was something she just didn’t have the willpower to resist. She couldn’t sleep, she couldn’t think, she couldn’t enjoy the time you spent with Bon Bon. All she could think of was that damn offer. Her breaking point was coming soon… why delay the inevitable? She crawled slowly and carefully out of bed, before silently grabbing her saddlebags and slipping out the back door. The cool Equestrian night called out to her once again as she descended into the town, searching for the strange mare. It suddenly occurred to her that she had absolutely no idea where this ‘Berryshine’ was. ‘You’ll know where to find me’... what the hay does that mean? Maybe she’s still at the bakery? … it’d probably be closed this early in the morning. Lyra snorted, quickly growing frustrated. She should probably wait until later to find this mare, but she needed her belly filled now. She was so horny, even the very thought of a pony pressing against the walls of her stomach made her feel light-headed. Even if she couldn’t find the mare, she would still catch a pony to gulp down on her own terms.

As she wanders the darkened town, her thoughts clouded, the shadowy buildings beginning to blend together. After a few minutes of aimless walking, she suddenly looked up, as if snapping out of a trance, and analyzed her surroundings. It appeared that, in her stupor, she had wandered to a part of town she had never been to before. She had walked into a little, dark alleyway out of sight of passersby, that she didn’t even remember entering. She figured she had just gotten lost, but something about this situation made her feel uncomfortable. Was she supposed to come here? Was their something here that had been beckoning to her, subconsciously?

Her questions were answered immediately as she heard the sound of hooves tapping against wet concrete behind her. “So you came out to look for me already.” She heard the taunting of a familiar voice. “You just couldn’t help yourself, could you?”

Lyra immediately whipped around, staring the mare in the eyes. This confirmed it. Through some form of sorcery or another, ‘Berryshine’ led her here, subconsciously. Panic grips her as she remembers that Berryshine herself had confessed to eating ponies. Was that what this was? A trap? Lyra backed up slowly. “You… brought me here? How?”

“I didn’t bring you anywhere. It was your own desire that led you here.” Berryshine chuckled at Lyra’s terrified expression, keeping a smug look on her face. “Relax. If I was going to eat you, I would’ve done it while you had your back turned.”

Lyra relaxed a bit, but remained wary. Internally, she cursed herself for being so foolish. What was she thinking, walking around town alone so late at night, to meet a strange mare she already knows has a proclivity for preying on innocent ponies? “My… desire?”

“You’re here to take up my offer, aren’t you? What am I saying, of course you are.” Berryshine smiled, as she began walking deeper into the dark alleyway, not even bothering to look back and make sure Lyra is following. “Come on, follow me. You’re going to miss the auctions!”

Berryshine led her through Ponyville’s labyrinthine alleyways, traveling along seemingly random paths. Eventually, they come across a rusted metal door, conspicuously out-of-place in the barren alleyway. Berryshine unlocked the door and pulled it open with a loud metal screech as it scraped along the concrete ground. They entered, and Lyra pulled the door closed behind them before the two mares descended down a long, dimly-lit stairwell. As they descended down the spiraling staircase, Lyra felt the tendrils of doubt creeping in once again. What was she doing? Why was she letting the strange mare lead her all the way down here, alone? Even if she was telling the truth and Lyra did get a pony to eat, how was she going to explain it to Bon Bon?

Eventually, they reached the bottom, and passed through another metal door. They must be at least three or four stories underground now, in a large, dimly-lit room with wooden floors and soundproofed walls. There were over a dozen ponies chatting at various tables and booths scattered across the room, and to her right, there was an large empty stage. Along the wall on the other side of the room, there were rows of doors. Dressing rooms, perhaps? Was this some sort of theater? Berryshine and Lyra walk over to a handsome, muscular stallion with shiny white fur and a mane featuring several different shades of green, who Lyra recognized as one of the royal guards in Ponyville’s levy.

“Ah, Berryshine! I was wondering if you’d make it.” The stallion smiled, sounding to be quite a few years older than Lyra. “And I see you’ve brought along a volunteer. Mm! A real catch, this one.”

“Actually, she isn’t a volunteer. She’s the fresh blood I’ve been talking about.” Berryshine corrected him, before introducing the two ponies. “Gavel, this is Lyra. Lyra, meet Gavel.”

“Uh… hi, ‘Gavel’.” Lyra smiled awkwardly as they shook hooves, a bit overwhelmed by the situation.

“Really? You’re the new recruit Berry’s seemed so excited about?” Gavel raised an eyebrow. “No offence, but you don’t look like much of a predator.”

“You haven’t seen her in action. I watched her gulp down a full-grown stallion faster than even I ever could with my own two eyes.” Berryshine insisted, before suddenly grabbing Lyra, turning her around in one fluid motion so her plump backside was raised in the air faced Gavel. “And besides! What about my OC, EC?

He's a pegasus stallion with white fur and a black mane and tail with turquoise streaks. He keeps his mane a lot like Doctor Whooves, but grows his tail out like Rainbow Dash's. He wears a pair of Wonderbolts goggles given to him by his father and an obnoxiously multicolored patchwork overcoat made by his mother. His Cutie Mark is the Japanese kanji for "spirit" (which is actually quite often used to express approaching a situation with intensity and excitement.) His eyes are red like Vinyl's.

His overall personality is a lot like Pinkie Pie's. He's very bubbly and almost always approaches the situation with excitement. He's pretty childish and even ditzy on occasion. He has a very limited concept of good and evil and often tries to rationalize the antagonist as a result. He tries to solve problems nonviolently, but if you make him mad (which is hard to do, granted), he'll kick your flank into the dirt. As previously expressed, he's very hard to anger, much to the frustration of the ones trying to make him mad.

An odd quirk about him is he has an odd condition that forces him to eat live ponies. At first he was terrified of this, but his mother solved this problem by putting a spell on the coat she made him that allows him to regenerate ponies he digests if he wants to. He still prefers willing prey, only eating ponies forcibly if he's half starved. He's very caring for the ponies he eats, often giving them whatever they want.

He's also more than willing to be eaten by other ponies, even lending them his coat so they can regenerate him. He does request his predator sings him to sleep before digestion begins (he panics if they don't). His favorite lullaby is "Come Little Children."

He naturally gravitates towards the children, since they're a lot like him and are usually more willing than adults.

He works as a weather pony in Rainbow Dash's patrol. The two are good friends, even though he kind of annoys her.

155332211222.content:
The princess’s personal royal guards haven’t changed their protocols in thousands of years, and the initiation requirements are just as brutal as they’ve always been. The role is restricted to stallions, who are forced to have their fur bleached at a young age, and drop out of school to focus exclusively on combat training. They were also all geldings, too, as no ‘intact’ stallion could possibly resist the allure of the princesses. All of this suffering forms an immense legion of hardened soldiers, who are willing to lay down their lives to defeat the many eldritch abominations that attack the princesses on pretty much a monthly basis. The town guards, however, are completely different. Small towns usually only have to deal with petty criminals and the occasional wild monster wandering in, so their levies usually consists of a militia of local volunteers. In fact, many particularly progressive towns have started allowing mares to volunteer for guard duty.

Such was the case of the Hollow Shades, a small, quiet town nestled in the forests of Foal Mountain. For a population of around three thousand ponies, there were about 15 guards; the newest of which was an plucky young unicorn named Rattlewatch. Rattlewatch is eager to prove herself worthy of the title, coloring her mane golden blond to fit in with the other guards and working overtime to stop crime in its tracks. Even now, somewhere in town, a criminal flees desperately through the streets, and Rattlewatch chases closely behind. “Stop running! You’re only making this worse for yourself!” She calls after the criminal, who was wanted for the heinous crime of petty theft. Rattlewatch followed closely behind the thief, keeping a slower but steadier pace, waiting for him to run out of energy or run into a dead end. The thrill of outsmarting and chasing down criminals was one of her favorite parts of the job. She had been training her stamina since she was a foal, so no criminal has been able to escape her yet. Eventually, the stallion did indeed run into a dead end, and turned to face his captor. Rattlewatch slowly down with a smirk, refocusing her efforts to her magic, her horn glowing brighter and brighter as she triumphantly approached the criminal.

“Get away from me, you crazy-” he yelled, but was interrupted when your horn filled the alleyway with a massive flash of light, blinding him. When he came to, the thief saw nothing but darkness. He could hardly breathe, and his fur was immediately slick with strange juices, so much so that for a moment he thought he was underwater. He tried to move, only for him to realize his limbs were tightly pressed against his torso. For a few seconds, he was disoriented; it wasn’t until he heard the constant beating of the mare’s heart that he realized what had happened. “Damn it!” he cried, as he realized he had been caught.

Meanwhile, Rattlewatch shuddered as her belly suddenly expanded to an immense size in an instant. She immediately rolled over onto her back, wrapping her hooves around her new humongous stomach as far as she could, celebrating another successful ‘arrest’. You see, when Rattlewatch joined the force, she was eager to prove herself worthy of her title, and decided that the best way of doing so would be coming up with an innovative new method of ‘criminal justice’. She had always been skilled at magic, and while researching, she had discovered spells that allowed her to both control her digestion and expand her stomach to any size. It was from these discoveries that an idea came to her; every time she caught a criminal, she would teleport them directly into her stomach to serve out their sentence. This was more effective than arresting them conventionally, as the only way to prevent themselves from being teleported inside of her belly is if they have some kind of anti-magic shield. Plus, it serves as a great deterrent, as most ponies find her stomach a very unpleasant place to be. “Snatching somepony’s purse. That’s petty theft. That’s worth about fifteen hours in my belly,” she informs her ‘prisoner’.

“Ugh! It’s disgusting in here!” the stallion sealed within her protested, but his voice was almost completely muffled by her thick stomach walls. Rattlewatch couldn’t make out what he was saying, but she could tell that he was whining about something or another.

“Don’t do the crime if you can’t do the time,” Rattlewatch teased, as she managed to stand up and walk out of the alleyway, her belly now dragging along the ground. Luckily, her armor didn’t have anything covering the bottom of the torso, which gave her belly room to expand. “Now quit your complainin’ before I give you an extra two hours for resisting arrest.” Seeing Rattle patrol around with a huge, wriggling belly was a common sight around town, and most citizens think nothing of it these days, though it does freak out tourists sometimes. When she first joined the levy, she would have to take the rest of the day off after imprisoning a criminal in her belly, as feeling a pony squirming within her made her feel nauseous. These days, however, she was used to it, and just took it as a free internal massage as she went to return the stolen purse to its rightful owner.

After about an hour, she looked up at the town’s clock tower and realized her shift was about over. Nightfall was imminent, and thus, it was about time for the batpony guards to begin their patrols, as they were nocturnal. Every guard station in Equestria was nearly the same in layout, differing only by size, as every station is built and maintained by Celestia’s government. But that doesn’t mean the local guards haven’t decorated it to their tastes, of course. The station was warm and homely, kept alight with the same lanterns that dot the rest of the city, even when the forest canopy blots out the sun. “Right on time, Rattlewatch,” a pegasus stallion acknowledged as she walked in, as she enjoyed the soft carpet after having walked along dirt and rocks for most of the day. His name is Carnifex; while this guard station was too small to have a real leader, he was generally considered the de facto general of your little levy. He was no-nonsense and a bit of a stick in the mud, though he was pretty good at his job. “Any action?”

“Just one stallion today. Stole a mare’s purse right in front of my eyes. I think he has, uh… blue fur, if I remember correctly. He is probably in his 20’s or something,” Rattlewatch said as she passed by. She noticed the bat ponies gearing up for their patrols in the corner, and greeted them.

“Is that all you know about him?” Carnifex asked, a little annoyed. He liked to keep records of all arrests made by the levy with as much detail as possible. There wasn’t an standard protocol for how arrests should be processed or how punishments should be doled out -- Celestia’s government pretty much allowed every town to do its own thing -- but Carnifex believed that the Hollow Shades levy should value ‘transparency’. “Do you know his name, at least?”

“Nope! Sorry, chief, but he’s not really available for questioning...” Rattlewatch laughed, rubbing her belly with a forehoof. “He’s a bit busy right now.”

“Rattlewatch!” Carnifex growled. “It’s fine that you’re taking the initiative to deal with prisoners yourself, but couldn’t you at least identify them first?”

“Well, I’ll let him out tomorrow morning. He’ll be ready for questioning then… if he’s not just fat on my flank by then, of course,” Rattlewatch smirked. She wasn’t being serious, of course -- she’d never digest a pony for a simple misdemeanor -- she just enjoyed teasing her ‘commander’. Before he could reply, she slipped away into the sleeping quarters and plopped down onto one of the bunks, her huge belly in the air. The stallion inside of her was still wriggling and protesting, though this only served to comfort Rattle further. While she was used to having ponies in her stomach, it still make her a bit drowsy, similar to a food coma. This has the extra effect of making the sleep she gets while full of a prisoner the best sleep she’s ever had.

With that in mind, she drifted off into a deep slumber with a smile on her face, ready for the days ahead.
